Reviews.Title: “On the strip away from the noise”
Reviews.Author: Loomin8
Reviews.Content: Friendly service nice rooms comfortable beds hot showers. What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: Applepie23
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel began poorly with check-in and never improved. The staff was incredibly rude and incompetent. We had to ask 4 different people working at the front desk before they could direct us to our room. The others looked at us like we were crazy for asking where tower 3 was. The room itself was tiny with a couch that we had to pull down from the wall, when out it had no bedding. I don't have a problem making a bed but when I paid to stay in a hotel, I dont expect to have to do that we called the front desk and asked if they would be making the bed they told us the bedding was in the closet and they could make it for an extra fee. The urine on the toilet seat received the same feedback -they would clean the bathroom for a fee. Disgusting. The location is nice in that it is very close to the strip but you have to walk down a sketchy back alley to get there complete with low class dirty prostitutes lingering at night. One pro is the decent rooftop pool (although it closes early and is not open at night). We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “garbage truck wake- up”
Reviews.Author: ph4343
Reviews.Content: I was at the villas at the polo towers and every morning at 5:00 am I was awakend by the garbage trucks. I was exhausted when I returned home.

Reviews.Title: “Villas - similar accomodations as the Suites”
Reviews.Author: Goleta
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Polo towers a few times, but previously only in the ‘suites’ (Towers 1 & 2). However, recently we stayed in the ‘villas’ (Tower 3). I always wondered what the difference was and after having now seen the villas, in my opinion, there isn’t much. I understand that the villas were built after the original suites and maybe there was some distinction at that time, but now having stayed in both and on this occasion getting to see 3 of the villas I don’t see much difference other than the fact that the bathrooms in the villas have double sinks and a Jacuzzi tub/shower combination that takes some gymnastics to get in and out of without injuring yourself. Also given the fact that they sit further back off the strip most villas potentially are quieter than most suite rooms; however, you still get the benefit of the 6AM garbage truck wake up call. Even though we are owners at the Polo Towers, I booked 4 nights through Expedia at a rate that was better than I would have received by using my options through our timeshare company. I called in advance to confirm my reservation (I learned that is always a good idea when booking through a third party) and so when we arrived everything went smoothly at check-in and we were assigned to villa 8301 on the southeast corner of the building. There is no strip view from here, but we have stayed on the strip often enough that this wasn’t a big deal. The villa room was very similar to the king ‘suite’ rooms that we have had at the Polo towers with the exception that there was a Murphy bed and thus a more comfortable sofa in the living room. We did have a problem in that the air conditioning in the bedroom didn’t work and so after a couple of days of calls to maintenance they finally pronounced it ‘dead’ and moved us to another unit. Our next brief stop was in 21311 which was a king villa on the northeast corner of the building. Again not much of a view, but we weren’t here long as I found out that the floors above 18 in the villas do not have wi-fi; I guess these are for those who arrive in horse and buggy as it is unbelievable in the 21st century that a property such as this has some areas without wi-fi coverage. Anyhow the front desk staff (and particularly Michelle) was very helpful in arranging for another room where we would have both air conditioning and wi-fi, room 15312. This unit on the 15th floor is located on the northwest corner of tower 3 and does have a pretty good strip view. Both of the latter units had the sofa bed combo in the living rooms like the suite rooms rather than the Murphy bed that was in our first villa unit. All 3 of the units had bathrooms as described previously. In general the Polo Towers is a nice property in a good location, center of the strip, that is easy to get to and has adequate underground parking, which you come to appreciate in the heat of the Las Vegas summers. It does not have a restaurant or a casino and so once you get back to your room you are away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and have a nice atmosphere in which to unwind. The units do have kitchens with full size appliances in case you are inclined to do some of your own cooking. There has always seemed to be some type of maintenance issue to deal with during our stays, mostly minor, but it leads me to believe that the management philosophy is ‘we will fix it when the customer finds it’ rather than taking a more proactive approach to property maintenance. I will also mention that strip facing rooms in Tower 1 of the suites do get some noise from the Hawaiian Marketplace which usually has a band playing for several hours in the evening; in the past we have had rooms located there and found it to be noticeable, but not too disturbing and the strip views from those rooms are fantastic. A couple of issues that I do have in general with all the Polo Tower rooms is the fact that they do charge for 3rd party wi-fi, however, I find it is fairly reliable and more reasonably priced that other properties where I have stayed on the strip. Another thing is that they use the older style energy efficient light bulbs that take several minutes to come to full brilliance so you have to anticipate your need for light. Also these types never do give you the light of the newer bulbs. All in all we enjoy the Polo Towers and will stay there again because the location is great, the rooms are clean and the staff does their best to take care of your requests and needs in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Again polo towers was great”
Reviews.Author: Aime61
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas and we stayed at Polo Towers a one bedroom villia (613 sg.ft. ) and as last time it was as we expected, great. You can,t get better for the price even at the high end hotels . the large bedroom a great bathroom and a living room to relaxe in after you made a drink from the fully equipped kitchen with ice maker. And this all just steps from the strip next to Planet Hollywood and Wallgrens. Staff are friendly and helpfull and ready to help if you need it. As last time I said we will be back and I really can see myself and our friends staying anywhere eles. Over the past 20 or so yrs coming to Las Vegas and stayed in some of the big high-end hotels, Polo Towers is by far the best over al .

Reviews.Title: “polo towers 1st-9th March wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Janet F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at polo towers for one week and it wonderful. The staff were very friendly. We had a two bed appartment on the 14th floor facing the city centre. The view was amazing up and down the strip. The shop was much better than expected. The whole place was spotless. I reccomend taking a tour with Char Cruz, earthmark tours. She is a native of Las Vages and took us to the valley of fire for the day. If you see any shows you have to see "O" and "LOVE" both AMAZING Thank you to all the staff at polo towers

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin G
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews before booking and was a little nervous. I have to say we were 100% pleasantly surprised and impressed! Check in was super easy and we got in our room early, the room was gorgeous (clean, comfy bed, great kitchen), the location is ideal, and the pool was fantastic! They even provide you with huge pool towels and the sun is never blocked by other tall buildings. It's so easy to walk almost anywhere on the strip, but there is also a bus stop right on the strip in front of the hotel. I always felt safe walking the half block off the strip to the hotel, even at 1 AM. It was well-lit at all times and never seemed dangerous to me, like others reviewers mentioned. I love that it was smaller, non-smoking, and it only takes 2 minutes to walk outside from your room. When you stay at the huge casino hotels it can take 15 minutes just to get from your room to the lobby! There were a few maintenance issues in the hotel during our stay, but the customer service was excellent. The desk people were so nice and helpful and fixed everything ASAP. I recommend this place 100% and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: SuperRn11
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms, good value. Enjoyed the jacuzzi tub after long walks on the strip. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Be1and2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Polo Towers Villas. I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. We arrived before checkin time of 4:00 and they allowed us to have a unit right away. The person at the desk was very accomodating. The 1-bedroom was very clean and had all the necessary items. The bathroom was huge and there were plenty of toiletries provided. The towels were exchanged daily and more toiletries provided. We had one light not working and the cd player not working. We reported it at the front desk and went for a workout. When we returned the light bulb had been changed and the cd player replaced. Great sevice!! The fitness center had everything you need for a good workout. The roof top pool was gorgeous. The location was excellent. I would recommend this timeshare to anyone and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service - Yeah!”
Reviews.Author: Connie H
Reviews.Content: Started out NOT SO GOOD. The 2 bedroom we booked had the carpets cleaned and was still damp and had a chemical smell. The Front desk people immediately moved us to another unit which was great till we saw the lock off was a very tiny unit with a murphy bed. We were not happy so back to the front desk and were assigned to a 1 bedroom villa and a standard 1 bedroom. They were both roomy, full kitchen, living room and good size bathroom. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE at no extra cost. This was important as we were having guests join us and did not want them in a murphy bed. THANK YOU STAFF at Polo Towers for making our stay so great! Diamond Resorts knows what customer service is all about...especially since this past weekend was Nascar and rooms were at a premium. GREAT JOB!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: lilfeet66
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is like our home away from home because my family and I have stayed there NINE times and we NEVER had a bad experience!! We were always treated great. Eveb when our room smelled of smoke, one call to the front desk and we were moved IMMEDIATELY! It wasn't a big deal! The rooms and beds are the most comfortable I have ever stayed in at any hotel! We LOVE the location......you dont have as much noise from the strip but it's still VERY close! A stones throw away! I dont think we will ever stay anywhere else for a week! I have spent one night at Mandalay,Mirage, Red Rock, MGM, Aria and still like Polo the best!! YOU ROCK POLO!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KristinShmoe
Reviews.Content: Polo Tower suites were fantastic, the customer service was amazing, They didn't even try to sell me anything (I just left after they gave me my room keys). The room was fantastic (one bedroom suite), it was huge, had a balcony, and the kitchen was awesome (we saved a ton of money by just buying food from the grocery stores and cooking it ourselves). The location was perfect, it was right in the middle of the best part of the strip. Although it was set back a tiny bit from the strip we never felt uncomfortable or unsafe walking back to the hotel (even at 3:30 in the morning, and we are a bunch of 20 something girls). I would highly recommend this place and will definitely be staying here again the next time I come to Vegas. Also a plus, we never had to wait for an elevator and we never got lost trying to find our rooms (because it doesn't have a casino).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and close to LV attractions”
Reviews.Author: yeulife
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted very nicely by the hotel host. Within minutes of checking in, we were in our rooms relaxing. The room was very clean, typical timeshare. No thrills, but just plain adequate for our needs. The hotel itself was next to Planet Hollywood on one side, MGM on the other and across the street from Aria and Cosmopolitan. Across the street, there are lots of fine shops such as Louis Vuitton, Prada, etc. If you win big, there are a lot of good places to shop. Overall, the Polo Towers is nice decent place to stay. Enjoy and good luck with the winnings!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: KazinSD
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Polo Towers, both for business, and I was pleased to see they have made some nice updates. Clearly the carpeting had been replaced in the hallway (floor 17), and the small kitchen appliances were all new Cuisinart stainless steel models. There was also an excercise room that was lacking before, but is there now. Location is excellent, and parking was pretty easy. Pulling in from the Strip can be confusing, so watch closely. The Polo Towers are behind the Hawaiian Marketplace and the turn off is just on the other side of the small tourist attraction booth. You can also go down Harmon, turn onto Planet Hollywood Way, and come in the back way. The concierge desk is very friendly and want you to go on a tour (some of you it is required to get the deal they offered on the room). Even if you don't take their time share presentation, the desk is helpful and willing to get you the information you need. The room seemed very clean and everything in working order. The iPod/iPhone dock in the bedroom is a nice touch. The beds at every Diamond Resort property we have stayed at have been SO comfortable, and the Polo Towers are no exception. There are flat screen TV's in the bedroom and living room as well as a DVD player in the living room. The living room furniture is not the highest end, but no where near the cheapest quality either. Don't miss the rooftop pool - it was clean and has quite a view! I do have a couple of suggestions for Diamond. One, find a way to eliminate some of the outside noise. Those are some thin windows! The garbage trucks are VERY audible at 6:00 in the morning - fortunately being there for business, we had planned on being up shortly thereafter anyways. Two, most people have come to expect some sort of internet service provided when they travel. If they do have to pay for it, the service is usually very good. The internet at the Polo Towers is neither free or good. Luckily I remembered that from the previous visit and had brought a Verizon Aircard for use at our business venue and the Polo Towers, and that worked perfectly there. Other than those to issues, our stay at the Polo Towers was comfortable, clean, and relaxing. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star... Good if you can get an affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: ALO_YYZ
Reviews.Content: Tried this place out since friend was staying here as well. I came on business so lets start with the pro's from a non-partyer perspective: Basically on the strip without a rowdy casino. Quiet. Close to a lot of hotspots on strip, shopping etc. Can be good value for space depending on your rate. Staff are helpful Cons: Dated decor and washrooms... think student dorm style. Don't pay for the IBAN Wifi internet unless absolutely necessary. It's slow, drops and disconnects. It's like 8 bucks a day... I will probably not choose this place again... too many compromises... Unless everything else is booked up while they provide a very affordable rate.... I think it's worth $60/night at best, but would personally pay double for a nicer joint like MGM signature condo suites....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel condo on strip”
Reviews.Author: surfingmo
Reviews.Content: Room was freshly painted and appliances all looked new, very clean, bed comfortable, nice soaking tub, new carpeting, triple sheets which I really like, Was located across from Aria, next to MGM. Checked in a little before 4pm, asked if we could have upper floor attendant said come back after 4 and a upper floor room will be ready, came back at 5:30pm was given a room on lower floor told them I was told there would be upper floor room available, they had the manager come out and ask me who told me I could have a upper room what was her name there not suppose to promise anything, Jeez I don't mind paying extra if you'd ask me, but don't give me the third degree at the counter and then expect that Id want to do a timeshare here! and not to mention pool was being worked so it was not open.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad!”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: Loved the bed and pillows. Very comfortable. The shower was also great with good water pressure for peeling skin. However, there is not a bar or restaurant. We did our homework and decided to pack light and use their laundry facilities. Good thing I have insomnia, I spent 4 hours in a room with one washer and dryer (only one on the 6th floor). The dryer took almost 2 hours to dry the first load and then the second load we just hung in the closet back in the room...it took less time and I didn't have to sit in a little room with no windows.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas 2012”
Reviews.Author: ally1957
Reviews.Content: Polo towers villas and suites are 1 block back off the strip on the corner of the strip and east harmon behind the hawaiian village. I mention this beacouse in the dark the village neon make the polo towers sign hard to see. Polo towers is a west coast flagship building for selling vacation ownership. They don't like to call it time share anymore and its NOT a casino. Its been there a long time, in vegas 30 years is a long lime. The lobby is not as glitzy as some in this town but its large airy not too bright check was quick no trauma there and the compulsory visit to guest services for your welcome pack (arm twisting for timeshare oops vacation ownership tour) as we already own with Diamond Resorts we signed up for the freebi, (show tickets and dinner). Underground car park first come first serve basis didn't have any trouble parking underground and there's a valet parking which we we told was free (+ tip) if its full but we never used this They charge for wifi in the room.There's free wifi if you can find it but its not in the room. 3 courtesy computers with internet access and a printer limited to 20 minutes if busy Room 1 bedroom Non-smoking overlooking the strip. Million dollar view. Usual stuff in there 2 tv's fridge microwave air con etc wehad a towel change every day and bed linen service mid week towel service everyday which is unusual for timeshare (ooops VO). Room as you would expect room was clean well maintained and generally excellent. Lift to all room floors is with a room key. Small shop on ground floor didn't use it there's a 7 11 100 yds away and a walgreens 200 yds away Theres a gym, pool didn't use them either but the gym looked well stocked may be a little cramped with equipment not that I'm an expert. Kid pool was closed for maintanance and refurbishment. There is no restaurant cafe bar its just a hotel One of the reviews asked at the front desk for restaurant options IN VEGAS come on thats like asking where's the snow at the north pole. Nice place but its just somewhere to rest your head and put your feet up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kim2008
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at Polo Towers. We were there for a week. Wonderful "everything" The only thing I could say negative is that they charge a minimal fee for the gym. Location was fantastic without the feeling of a casino. Rooms and bed clean, very comfortable, great view- we stayed in tower 2. Free laundry (only charge for soap), free shuttle on certain days to shopping- grocery and outlets, and to downtown Freemont St. I would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone. We are part of a travel club for rates (exchange)

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST MISLEADING HOTEL IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: This is a time- share property that is outdated, over- prized and does not hve any ammenties.. When I asked about restaraunt options I was refered to a Denny's. The entire staff was rude and any futuristic traveler should never be exposted to a situation like this.. I was there for one night and checked out and moved to another hotel called the Trump who knows what customer service is all about.. I lost over $400.00, however I could not stay in a box for another night.. It was a studio apt with the bed in the wall.. Travel's beware!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dirty, smelly and loud oh my!”
Reviews.Author: Julia H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel staff seemed curtious, however as soon as they realized we were not interested in any upgrades or time shares, the helpfulness and any politeness stopped there. Any time we asked a question after that they were short and snappy. The room itself appeared clean at first. When we removed the couch cushions to pull the bed down from the wall, there was something slimy caked on the outside. It looked like blood and mucous. Disgusting! Also, when we opened one of the bathroom drawers it had dirty hair and a used bandaid in it. This room had definitely not been cleaned properly! The floor was also wet in several Large spots and the room had a strange smell. One of the worst night's sleep I had in a long time. The bed was uncomfortable and there was a VERY annoying sound that would come through the air conditioning when it came on. I'm a deep sleeper and couldn't even shake it. I called to tell them about it and all I got was "oh, sorry". On the postive, the rooftop pool and hottub were great and the hotel is centrally located on the strip. Perfect for walking to places close by. HOWEVER- you have to walk through a scary looking area to get out of the hotel. Would never stay at a Diamond "Resorts" hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - mid-strip, good quality”
Reviews.Author: RLCD
Reviews.Content: The Villas at Polo Towers are a timeshare, so certainly you may expect a sales pitch. We went and it was not bad at all, nothing pushy or over the top. Stayed in the 1 bedroom unit - which had a very comfy bed and lots of space. Had a partial strip view. Walk to the strip was about 100 yards or so - not bad at all. Very centrally located for Vegas Strip, walked to everything. Would trade for this one again, for next time in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “The Other Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mbeachjr
Reviews.Content: Had a good time in LV @ Polo Towers. Good resort, went on an exchange. Had a great room on the 8th floor. Nice pool on roof, just too cold in Jan to take advantage. After 3 days of casino's and walking the strip we wanted to get away. The Clark County museum is 2-3 hrs well spent, also the Natural History Museum. We hiked in the Red Rock National Conservation Area and The Valley of Fire State Park. Saw the most awsome sunset on our way back from Valley of Fire taking the Northshore Rd along Lake Mead to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: GunniMom
Reviews.Content: Well lets start with the positive. Fun, beautiful room. We were in a 1 bedroom on the 8th floor. Views were not good but that's okay. The front desk was not very helpful with transportation to and from the airport, a service that they should definitely offer. My downside: I have owned a timeshare for 10 years and have always been treated very well as a timeshare owner at a visiting resort. This hotel, couldn't care less. Before I arrived I had gone back and forth with one of the hotel representatives on the size of the space. We had originally booked a studio, which I was concerned with b/c of size. Finally since I was only using the room for 3 nights instead of the 7 that regularly comes with a timeshare exchange, the man that I was talking to said they would upgrade my room for free. When checking out there was an additional upgrade fee of over $100. Needless to say I am disputing the charge. I will look for another property next time I'm in Vegas. Sorry a few more negatives:No restaurant or lounge, no daily maid service, sketchy walk from the "strip" and lastly they charge you for coffee in your room after the first night :) (an important ingredient in a Vegas morning).

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Jim F
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Polo Towers in Las Vegas, Nv. We had a two bedroom suite which was very comfortable. The suite consisted of a full kitchen, master bedroom with bath, a living room/dining area combination and an adjoining bedroom with a pull-down wall bed. This room also had its own bath. The location is great-in the heart of the strip district and across the street from the Mirage- and a short walk to all of the major hotels/casinos on the strip. There is no casino at this establishment, but, that certainly was not a negative.There was no restaurant in the facility but they had a menu from which you could order food to your room. The staff was very friendly and took great pains to meet all of our needs. If you are looking at this location you should be aware that there is the Polo Towers as well as the Polo Towers suites. They are in adjoining buildings but the suites are newer and more modern. We stayed in the Polo Towers which we found very comfortable and would certainly recommend. We used this location as a base from which we visited the hotels/casinos on the strip, drove to downtown-old Las Vegas approximnately 4.5 miles from the Towers- as well as visiting various National Parks. If you are not interested in spending every day and night in the casinos, we recommend renting a car. Renting a car permitted us to visit Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, the Grand Canyon/skywalk and Death Valley. We also went off the strip to adjoining areas for some great food at very reasonable prices. This hotel was an excellent location for our needs since none of our travels were over two and one half hours from our hotel. It was very easy going to our outside destinations and getting back to our room. Whether you would strictly want to visit the various casinos or combine your trip with gambling and exploring unbelievably beautiful National Parks-this hotel should warrant your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke free appartment suite on/close to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: tezza B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night here (after 2 nights in Fremont Street). Likes: Great location in "new Vegas" + Not a casino and smoke free (yey!), nice rooftop pool, close/on The Strip, friendly, initial reception service good. Very clean and spacious appartment, good facilities including laundry. Very close to the big casinos MGM Grand etc. Dislikes - promises of a free/discounted show etc did not materialise after we made it clear that although we would be happy to attend the "time-share" talk we were probably not in the market to buy. In fairness I think it was a particularly busy time at the hotel as there was a major Boxing fight on at the MGM Grand next door at the time and other matters took precidence. Cost approx $110-$120 per night online booking via a website appox 4 weeks out from stay. Overall - would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “WOOOHOOO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the summer and had an amazing time. Staff were friendly and really tollerated our partying. Barely slept the whole week. Staff allowed us to drink at the pool. One downside was no room service but other than that, really good value and lovely staff. On the day we were leaving, we had to drive 9 hours to San Fran. However, we were still too drunk and the staff member we spoke to seemed genuinely concerned and convinced us to stay another night to sober up.She was extremely professional and very very nice. I wish I could remember her name. Amazing place, amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: scunny_b0y
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 friends stayed here for a lads holiday and it was perfect for what we needed. Rooms are nice - staff were very relaxed and could not do enough to help if you needed it. Has a full kitchen in the room and a nice pool on the top floor that also has a BBQ facility that we used a few times for dinner and a few beers before heading out (very nice addition). The price was amazing and i really couldn't have wanted more - it is not 5 star but it doesn't say it is and for the price and location you really couldn't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Way Better than I had expected!”
Reviews.Author: Brady N
Reviews.Content: We were offered a deal from Diamond Interantional to stay at the hotel at a discounted rate as long as we attended one of their "sales pitches." We arrived on Wednesday night and pulled up to valet. Some young kid asked what we were doing and I said checking in. He acted like this was his first day on the job with out any training. Needless to say, I thought we were in for a very bad treat. We checked in and went to our one bedroom suite. It was very nice and very clean to my surprise. We had a room that faced south towards the MGM's parking lot. Not a big deal. It would have been nice to see the strip from our room but it was fine. The next morning we went to the sales presentation. Since we are Diamond owners, they wanted us to change over our condo ownership to a points system. It sounded like something that we wanted to do but in order to do it, I'd have to buy more points. Just not in the cards right now. We politely declinced and they were fine about it. Our sales guy took us downstairs for the hard sale but she was fine as well. Maybe if we had a little cash to throw at it we would have done it. I was a little worried about getting crapy service after we said no, or that they would be upset, but all in all it was okay. I'd say no again for another deal like that. The service was good. They valet was fast. We didn't experience the pool. It was nice being so close to the strip. You're not on it but only 100 yards off it behind some small shops. I'd definately stay here again, especially if I was looking for a suite or condo. I hope this review has helped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but the rooms are noisy and be careful about the offers”
Reviews.Author: Russell H
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is pretty old by Vegas Standards but its right on the strip next to Planet Hollywood and has good parking while you are staying there. ON the down side the rooms were really noisy. We ended up moving after the first night because the aircon was like a 747 turbine winding up. This was a real hassle even though the staff were pretty good about it. Don't put anything down either because someones got light fingers around there. Lost a sweatshirt after walking away from it for less than a minute. Also be careful about the offers of free shows. They do these timeshare sales pitches and say it will take 90 minutes but really its more like 3 hours and they get really forceful at the end when you tell them you are not going to buy at like $50K. What do they expect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Breed26
Reviews.Content: We visited the Polo towers Dec 24-31 2011 on exchange from our own timeshare. The location is amazing. You can walk to places of interest, and restaurants, or you can cook in your fully stocked kitchen. This was not our first visit so we knew exactly what to expect. Everyone was very friendly, from the desk staff to the valet, and the housekeepers. We did attend the 90 min presentation and learned some very exciting and different amenities of the Diamond Resorts, in comparison to many of the others. Always look forward to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: JMRVLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as "on the strip" as the big casinos where you have to walk for miles once you enter the door to get to your room. It is set back from the sidewalk--which is a good thing. I liked the fact that there is no casino--it is an oasis of calm in a crazy city. The roof top pool is lovely and only for adults after 5pm

Reviews.Title: “the time share presentations are to stay away from”
Reviews.Author: rickcasi
Reviews.Content: great location,very good valets and bell men...........staff is very good.....rooms are large and nice,nothing fancy...kitchen is perfect.....maids are very nice......but man the time share stuff is never worth it,,,never..........no matter what they offer it is NEVER worth it........

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are fine, but beware the timeshare presentation!”
Reviews.Author: VisitingFromCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the strip, so the location is fine. Parking was ample. The rooms were fine, with a king bed. No casino on site, but that was just fine with us. The staff was friendly, but beware the concierges true job is to book you into a time share presentation. Against or better judgement we agreed. And this is when my opinion went downhill. 90 minutes? Nope, three hours!!!!! When we pointed out it had been 2 hours, they said it would be just a few more minutes so the manager could talk to us. Then 1/2 an hour later we had to wait for another person to talk to us. We were on time for our obligation, so why did we have to wait for them? We own a time share, so we have no problem with timeshares, but I would NEVER buy from diamond if this is how they treat potential customers. Absolutely not acceptable! For this reason I don't recommend polo towers or diamond resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Okiya
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel has really disappointed us all, as it turned to be really under Las Vegas hotels standards. Unfortunately the price is average, so nothing good to talk about. Check-in was slow, probably because of the high season period (we arrived on 30th December and I understand that's when everyone moves to Vegas for a few nights). The girl at reception who welcomed us did not find our reservation and needed a couple of minutes to understand what was happening. She did not give us proper information about hotel services because she was clearly in hurry for all the other guests who were waiting in line behind us. No valet parking and that's definitely not a problem, as long as you can park your car. Unfortunately that was a real pain: I had to find the garage by myself and once I did it I could realize it was totally full. It took more than one hour (!!!) to find one parking, with several other cars playing the same game and waiting for others to go out. What is more there are many drunk people around and that makes everything even more unconfortable. When we went to the reception to ask them if there was another place where to park the car they just told us parking is included for free, so it is not guaranteed. As we have reserved our room (a suite!!) online and it was clearly stated parking was available and free, we found that really annoying. Ok, step forward. We went up to the room, a large suite. As we opened the door we could feel a strong smell of fried food. Just a note: that smell never left us till our departure. The room was ok, even though it did not have anything to do with a suite. It was good size, but divided in two communicationg rooms. There was only one double bed, while the others were couch beds with no blankets on them (we had to ask reception). Once you open all the beds the room looks similar to a camping, more than a hotel suite in Las Vegas (that should be what we paid for). Heating system was crazy: from time to time it goes on by itself and there is no way to stop it, even if you switch everything off. It has its own soul... and it doesn't look to be friendly. Swimming pool was on top floor, on a nice terrace with little view, as the walls all around are just closing all the nice view you could have from up there. It is cold water, so pointless in winter. Closed at night. Same for the whirlpool. Fitness room was supposed to be on ground floor, but we never had the chance to find it open. It is one of those facilities we were looking for when we booked, but finally it was closed all the time we were in the hotel. I also understand there is a little fare to pay to get in (if you are lucky enough to find it open). Wi-fi internet, which is another thing we were looking for, was not included. Unfortunately you have to pay for each device accessing internet, so if you have two laptops and two mobile phones you will need to pay four times in a day. Wonderful. That's not it. In our room the signal was so weak we had to go outside our door just to send an email or to use skype. Amazing service for a suite, isn't it? Last point is about cleaning: the room was everything but clean. Room service never cleaned our bathroom. They didn't even touch anything. It was just a towel change. I would never suggest anyone to try this place. As our flight changed we had to stay one more night in Vegas and moved to another hotel that turned to be 1000 times better in everything for a much lower fare. IWhat we cannot stand is unfriendly staff. Look for it. Walk on.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: maja651
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay in a one bedroom on the suites side of Polo Towers. We had a great stay. There were 4 of us in the room for the NYE weekend and the room was plenty big enough for the 4 of us. The staff at PT was very good and handled all of our requests promptly when we called. We love having the kitchen in the room and staying in a non-casino resort. Nice to be in a smoke free place in a town full of so much smoke. We have decided PT is now our go to place in Vegas and plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable atmosphere and nice ambience”
Reviews.Author: Luvelylioness
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was perfect size equipped with all your necessities ( except your groceries) but there is plenty of marts around to purchase. The whole room was just perfect for me and my husband. Easily could have fit another couple in the living room / sofa bed. The location is perfect fir the strip, located by top hotels and casinos. I highly recommend this place to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location-Time Share Hassels”
Reviews.Author: sbfoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was recommended by friends, and was on the strip. We usually stay at the Desert Rose Condos which is located behind Hooters Casino. Our check in was horrible, as we were bombarded with Time Share meeting requests, and when they finally got the message that we weren't interested, the service ended. We weren't even told where to go to find our rooms. We go to Las Vegas three to four times a year, and know it is tougher times for them, you would think that they would go out of there way to make a difference. The rooms we had were below average at best, with a view straight out over the dumpsters and into a parking garage. It was quite loud from hallway traffic. I have stayed at nicer for lesser, such as the Desert Rose which has awesome complimentary breakfasts as well as happy hour, and being only two blocks off the strip is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time staying here”
Reviews.Author: NOLACreole
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Polo Towers for a week. We were in unit 10-112 I believe. We were facing Harmon and Marriott's Grand Chateau, so not really a good strip view. It was at the very end of the hallway, next to the stairway. I'm not sure if the stairway is what kept our room so cold, but we had trouble keeping a good temperature in the room. Just watching tv in the living room had to be done with a blanket. The room was nicely appointed, everything was clean and nothing was missing. The only issue (besides the heat) that we had, was the bathtub didnt drain properly. I called and maintenance was up within about 30 minutes but the only thing they did was pull the stopper completely out. And that still didn't really rectify the problem, so we just dealth with it. Everybody was friendly that we came in contact with. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Mithril013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Diamond Resorts and Interval International Resorts portfolio. The accommodation is spacious and well equipped and kept spotlessly clean and stocked with clean towels and toiletries. My wife an I had a 1 bed appartment on the 10th floor overlooking the "Strip", wow what a view. All our needs were catered for by a dedicated team in reception and concierge, nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. We had a wonderful two weeks there and would return again should we decide to visit Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year / X'mas Stay”
Reviews.Author: JavaAlii
Reviews.Content: We are staying in our week 52 timeshare at polo towers again. I am so glad that we bought this unit over 17 years ago. We are one of the few early owners of the timeshare. It has a 2 bedroom unit facing the strip. Since we bought it, the Aria/Cosmopolitian has been built across the street. Planet hollywood and MGM is new door. Wonderful location especially during the New Year celebration when the strip is closed. This year, we had 9 people staying in our unit. the kids slept not the floor and had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Jonvic2
Reviews.Content: The Polos was a very pleasant surprise. Being our 1st time in the US & booking accommodation via the web I admit I was a bit nervous as to what we would find. The rooms are wonderful, they are clean, well equipped and very spacious. We are a family of 4 & had a 1 bdm apartment with an adjoining studio, great to be able to have some privacy.. The location is just right, we felt that we were in the heart of Vegas, as it was only a short walk or bus trip anywhere. The only downside is that on the first morning my shower was only lukewarm. Would recommend this as a place to stay. Narelle

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay - nice room and location”
Reviews.Author: herendeyr
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family we never really enjoy staying in hotels with casinos with all the noise and smoke, however we do enjoy the location of being on the strip for the attractions and shops. So when we first came across Polo Towers Villas we weren't sure about it since we'd never seen it before but it turns out it was also on the strip and directly across the street from City Center which was a new attraction for us! To the north was Planet Hollywood and next to that was Paris. Then to the south was MGM. The room we got at Polo Towers was a nice king size one bedroom with a pull down bed in the living room large enough for our 2 teenagers to sleep on. The bathroom was also large with one door facing the bedroom and the other towards the living room, and it has two sinks one at each counter on opposing walls. It has a spa tub/shower although with our short busy stay we didn't have enough time to actually use it as a a tub. On the other hand our teens did use the heated pool/jacuzzi on the rooftop. The other resort amenity they made use of was the gym with its weights and cardio equipment. I guess if we had smaller kids they'd enjoy the small kids' water park directly outside the gym. Back in the room, we had a decent sized kitchen with cookware, tableware and utensils. Then there was a stove/oven, microwave, coffeemaker, toaster and electric can opener, but the only appliance we made use of was the fridge. The dinning room is part of the living room with a 4 chair dinning table. There were in panel TVs in both the living room and bedroom. In the bedroom closet there was also a good sized safe where we kept our iPad and other valuables. The only negative I can say about our room in tower 3 is that the windows were facing a bit to the east and in the morning the light would come through the living room and bedroom even with the blinds and curtains closed. It seems that the kitchen blinds could have something else over it, and that the curtain in the bedroom should be able to close all the way to the wall so the daylight would not be able to seep in. If there was another slight negative it would be that the internet access from the room was one we'd have to pay for, but fortunately its free in the business center behind the lobby but with limited hours and use of only their computers. One late evening when the business center was closed I needed internet access and didn't want to pay, so fortunately with that location benefit there was a 24 hour McDonalds next door with complimentary wifi. PTV had no restaurant although they did have room service and a coffee shop down the hall of the lobby. For our meals we'd find ourselves taking a short walk on the strip where there were several close by restaurants to choose from. Parking at PTV was also very convenient for self or valet, since it was directly under the building and the elevator would take you directly up to the lobby hallway. Speaking of the lobby, the staff at PTV was very friendly, professional and accommodating from the time we checked in and throughout our stay. There was a mention of a 'welcome package' (timeshare presentation) that we were offered which we didn't feel pressured to take. All in all this was our best hotel (actually resort) stay in Vegas mainly because of the room and location, and for our future visits to LV we'll look forward to a return stay at PTV.

Reviews.Title: “"staycation" at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: Funlv1
Reviews.Content: Had not been to many new places on the Las Vegas Strip and decided to stay at Polo Tower, right across from the new City Center Hotels and Casinos. Stayed December 15-20 and had a one bedroom, strip view room on the 9th floor. Check in was uneventful and Sam, the clerk would have been happy to be anywhere but at work that day - while not friendly nor helpful, was NOT rude. The room was very nice, modern and updated and had a nice view of the City Center properties just across Las Vegas Blvd. The property sits back off the "strip" yet was easy to walk to and from the hotels and casinos to see the water show at the Bellagio and the pirate show at the TI as well as the other local resorts. No eating establishments at the Polo Tower, but many nearby including Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino and the shops, eating places there. even though it was December, the pool was heated nicely and people were using it each day of my stay. The gym facility was modern and well equiped and not crowded at all. The underground parking area was small and compressed, yet easy in and out with careful entry and exit. My sons would like us to reserve for New Year's Eve next year (already booked for this year) to see the fireworks and "craziness on the strip" for New Year's. All in all, a nice, well positioned facility close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, CONVENIENT AND FRIENDLY!”
Reviews.Author: LadyT49
Reviews.Content: So much better than a hotel. I had a full kitchen which I was able to cook my food everyday. Housekeeping gave me clean towels and emptied my garbage everyday. Polo Towers was close to everything and had a lot of stores like 7-11, Walgreens, McDonald's and CVS near by. The one thing I loved was there was a frozen yogurt shop right on the corner YEAH!! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: amtlza
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas about 7 times now and the one complaint I had staying in the Casino hotels is the 20 min walk from your room to get outside. Polo Towers was the perfect solution for this. The midstrip location is amazing and so was the price. My 5 friends and I really wanted to stay in adjoining rooms, but that wasn't an option in most of the other hotels. The 2 bedroom (2 bathroom) suite slept the 6 of us comfortably. We really enjoyed having a full kitchen for cold drinks and did some entertaining as well. On the negative side, the concierges were either trying to get me to go to the timeshare presentation or had no idea how to answer the most basic questions. I would stay here again in a large group of friends, but probably not for business or with a significant other.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and sleep!”
Reviews.Author: LarBearSSF-CA
Reviews.Content: When we vacation, we really need a nice bed and a good location; this place meets BOTH requirements! We got this place on an I.I. exchange for my Marriott two bedroom. We originally had a tiny 300 sq. ft. efficiency studio, but after reading enough reviews, AND talking to a front desk worker the week before, I knew I needed something bigger. When we arrived our Saturday night, I spoke to the front desk worker and she notified me of the $30/night upgrade fee if I wanted anything else. At that point a concierge walked up trying to help me out because he overheard what I was telling the front desk worker, "My wife is pregnant, I've read the beds aren't that great, etc.". He was willing to call the manager to work something out for us. After the call, he offered an upgrade to the 1 bedroom unit size, if I simply attended a presentation and paid a $30 upgrade fee, FOR THE WHOLE WEEK! After consulting with my wife, and us being pro's at saying "no thank you", we decided to do the upgrade and presentation the next morning. Since we were leaving Friday night, not using our Friday night stay, we paid only $15 for the whole week upgrade. (BEST Timeshare ever!!!) In all seriousness, the guy that did our presentation (we think his name was K/Chris? About 250 lbs / 6’1”) was great, very low pressure, none at all really and very personable. We were out of there in about less than 90mins and enjoying our vacation. If you can, as other members mentioned, ask for the backside "suites". They have been renovated and have Jacuzzi tubs, plus flat screens and DVD players. Our room in tower 3, 12311, required a little repair after a day or two. I didn't notice, until it was too late, that our DVD player had NO video hookup to the TV! Something happened and it was destroyed. I put call in at the front desk on my way to work out and maintenance was there before I finished my workout. It was fixed on the spot, after the guy went to get a new component cable. Speaking of working out, the gym is very nice!!! All the basic equipment you could want. It’s not some small hole on the ground floor or basement, it’s overlooking the kiddie pool area on the ground floor and has all different machines and weights, plus aerobic equipment. The pool on the roof seemed nice, but we weren’t there to swim, nor were we in any shape to. :-\ LOCATION: IT IS ON THE STRIP!!! It’s behind the Hawaiian Marketplace building (one building back in Vegas is STILL on the strip!). As for being on the strip, go behind that facility and you’re at Polo Towers. It is hard to find the “front” entrance, which actually faces south, but Google map street view and you’ll get a better idea. If driving North on the strip, pull in at the road/Alley just at the beginning of the Hawaiian Marketplace, the alley just after it is one way to the strip. The easiest way to enter if there’s moving foot and car traffic is to just turn down the road (E. Harmon Ave.) towards PH and the Marriott behind Polo Towers. Make a right as soon as you can and you’ll see the Marriott on your left, and the parking lot for the Polo Towers on the right. Enjoy the strip and don’t gamble all your money, there’s plenty to do! P.S. if you like Indian food, there is a G R E A T lunch buffet (and only $13, use the 10% coupon you can find in every discount book!) right in front of Polo Towers, inside the Hawaiian Marketplace. Leave the side entrance (Tower 1) of Polo Towers closest to the Hawaiian Marketplace and go in the back entrance of the building. You’ll see Tamba Indian Cuisine on the second floor in the main foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers avaliação”
Reviews.Author: SusanaCovelo
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, nice room, helpful staff, small swimming pool, the studio not included a stove.

Reviews.Title: “One night quick stay”
Reviews.Author: bass108
Reviews.Content: We just used our Diamond membership to stay for one night. We got a one bedroom with living room and kitchen. It is a nice facility. However, we had a devil of a time finding our way to the front door of the building. Not easy to find with all of the Las Vegas Blvd. traffic around us. It's kinda weird not having a walk-in entrance from the strip and being one building behind the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean, contemporary and on the strip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Vegas to celebrate our birthdays for the month of November and we had a ball!!!!! The service is top notch. Chris at the conceige desk is simply AMAZING and has wonderful connections to the nightclubs. This is a wonderful Resort next to the MGM Grand and directly across the street from the ARIA Hotel and 3 Resorts away from the Bellagio. Word to the wise. There is aloooooooooot of walking and every corner is not a crosswalk so you may have to walk 2-3 long blocks to cross the street and then walk over an overpass to get on the other side of the street and then back up the block back up 2-3 blocks to get to your destination. BRING COMFORTABLE FLATS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If going to the clubs, where the flats for walking to the club and put your Stillettos in your purse unless you are catching a cab everywhere which is expensive. Vegas has a terrible transportation system. It cost us $6.00 for a cab to take us right directly across the street from where we were standing. You can pay $7.00 a day for a 24 hour period to catch the Shuttle up and down the Strip which comes every 20 minutes. The clubs DO NOT have seating unless you have bottle service for a table which start at $500.00 otherwise you are standing all night and dancing so again this is where comfortable shoes come into play. All the stores cell liquor, the walgreens, CVS, grocery stores etc. and the price is pretty consistent with anywhere else you would purchase it.:) Since drinking is legal you can walk up and down the street and in businesses with an uncovered drink in your hand. The show Zumanity at the New York New York is a must see!!! Also, Hitzville the Motown Review show is AWESOME too at Planet Hollywood at the V theatre. CLS Transportation is a good company which transports you from the Airport to the Resort to the Hotel. It is $7.00 one way or $12.00 roundtrip which is the cheapest and you are 3 miles from the Resort. You can get it from door 13 at the airport. The next time I go back I will stay at the Polo Towers!!!!! I hope this helps and Have a ball!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT D
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the Strip, across from the spanking new 'City Center' complex.....perfect home base for LV......Mostly a time share property

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers Villas Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NJFam123
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers Villas is a timeshare not a hotel. It is located one block from the strip. A walk to City Center and MGM. There is no casino, no smoke to walk through which we appreciated. No restaurant but a well stocked shop for snacks. Evening security was seen patroling. Business Center and Fitness center. Ample parking. The staff we encountered were efficient and friendly. Excellent Housekeeping. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. Not large but sufficient. Murphy bed was comfortable for 2 teenage girls. A second bathroom would have been useful. Would definitely return to Polo Towers on next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO POLO”
Reviews.Author: tylman
Reviews.Content: We traded a banked week of our Marriott timeshare for this resort. This was done through Interval International. When we have traded our week before, we would recieve in exchange a like unit to the one we own in Hilton Head, (Two bedrooms, two baths, full kitchen with dinning room, living room, patio and laundry with three tvs, and free wifi). 1300 square feet.We understand that the booking was done through Interval. BUT!! The trade for our Hilton head timeshare was a 300 square foot unit with a murphy bed. Not even close to the same unit.The staff at Polo were understanding but could do nothing. None of the one or two bedroom units were avaliable. We were told that if there were larger units avaliable that we would have to pay at least $30.00 a day for an upgrade. I wonder if Interval is aware of this? We own two timeshares. When you book them they have pictures and diagrams of their units avaliable to see. Every other timeshare we have traded for over 19 years have diagrams to show their units. This is not so for Polo Towers. We could find no daigrams of the units on the web site. The location of Polo Towers is really very good. It's in the heart of the (new strip). The staff is very polite and try to be helpfull. We rented a car and found the onsite and undergroud parking a real plus. Polo also offer free valet parking which we did use on occasion. The little 300 s/f room fullfilled our needs but not our wants. The murphy bed slept well for us but you had to move the coffee table, remove the four cushions and two pillows from the couch to pull the bed down. (The bed pulls down over the couch). The bar kitchen had a mini fridge with a small microwave and a very large coffeemaker that took up a lot of the countertop. The shower bath was adequate as was the closet and furniture drawers. We took the timeshare presentation. (Free show tickets and debit card). The presentation was a real production. My wife and I needed to use the lavatory at the same time. We had an escort. I think the escort went with us to make sure we returned to the presentation. They said it would be two hours, but was just over two and a half. If we were to trade for Polo towers again, you can be sure we would get a unit that comes a little closer to the one we traded. .

Reviews.Title: “Well Maintained Property - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sanniam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott owners and I did an Interval exchange for a two bdroom/two bath unit for a "girls trip". The location is great, approximately 1/2 block off the strip and is a terrific central location. The property is clean, up to date and very well maintained. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone. (No need at all to rent a car if you're staying here!) Here's my rundown of the pros and cons of the property: Pros: Fantastic, accessible location Friendly professional staff Clean, well maintained rooms Great shower pressure and hot water Very nice fitness facility Nice onsite market with a fairly priced diverse selection of items Great view from the pool/spa area -- nicely designed Accessible business center to print up boarding passes, get internet access Bed and bedding in the master were awesome Cons: Pool/spa closes at 10 pm --- say what??? we're in Vegas?? Have to pay for inroom WIFI....$7/day or $36/week. Daily towel refresh/trash pickup didn't happen reliably. No full midweek clean as promised. Lowwww shower head...I"m 5' 10" and it came up to my neck, had to actually point it up! Fitness facility has limited hours (6:00 am - 7:00 pm)..expected more for a 24/7 city Terrible in room tolietries (by all means, bring your own!) Business center is always crowded..so bring your own iPad or laptop Murphy bed in the lockoff was a bit tricky to figure out No inroom laundry (but there are facilities onsite) Enjoy! It's Vegas BABY!! :)

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ffrancises
Reviews.Content: This place is not a hotel. This is a timeshare. A very overpriced timeshare. Me and my friend booked this place off of hotels.com. And to our dismay , beautiful timeshare , high quality and all that. The room we booked was the size of a studio apt for I dont know 70 bucks a night. We when to check to explain the problem the clerk told us this happens all the time. So for us to get a two bedroom it would be an additional 250 on top of what we already paid for three nights. So this really spoiled my experience here. Really nice place, but for two young guys looking to have fun in vegas. It doesnt have the hotel feel and party atmosphere I was looking for. When to the room I had to pay an extra 13.00 for wireless internet. Which that company is located in the Philippines. The climate control couldnt be controlled. A/C would be on non stop no matter the settings. House keeping didnt change the sheets on the bed. You have to scan you key just to get up to certain floors. Besides that , location was great, we were off the strip and could walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: MUFC3499
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Polo Towers after a 10 hour flight from Manchester. We were a little annoyed that the room would not be ready for another few hours, but our luggage was taken from us and we arranged our time share presentation. For this we got a choice of gifts amounting to around $100. The presentation was useful as we are already members of Diamond and wished to upgrade our package. We returned a couple of hours of later and got access to our room. I felt it was wonderful and was of a very high standard. The living area had plenty of room and the kitchen was extremely well equipped with things like dishwasher powder and washing up liquid provided. We had to ask for a kettle for tea as there was only a coffee machine but this was provided instantly. The balcony on the bedroom was great as it was totally in the shade and this kept the room cool too. The bathroom was huge but I felt it could have done with some ventilation. I liked the fact you could access it from the bedroom and living room. There was plenty of storage space both for drawers and hanging with hangers provided. All equipment in kitchen and bathroom was in excellent condition and all amenities were extremely clean. The maid service was excellent as beds were made and bins emptied every day. The swimming pool was amazing as it had plenty of shade. As the temperature increased however they stopped heating the pool and it was too cold for us to use. In contrast the jacuzzi was too hot and was like going into a pot bubbling on the stove! There were plenty of towels available, toilets and a barbeque area for everyones use. Polo Towers has no casino which is a bonus as it gives a very tranquil air to the place. There are no restaurants but a well stocked shop for snacks, coffee etc. Polo Towers is in a great position on the strip, set just slightly back, which means you don't get a lot of noise. The little road from the strip to the building is quite dark and perhaps more lighting would be an advantage. However I have to say I never felt unsafe at any point. We found the whole experience wonderful and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas stay at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: Tenerifel0ver
Reviews.Content: These are appartments with hotel services and we love it at Polo Towers. The appartmetns are very spacious and although the roof top pool is small, it has lovely comfortable sun beds and tables and chairs with sun shelter available. Polo Towers does not have a casino nor does it have a restaurant but these are available so close by it does not matter. We don't care for hotel rooms so we find the spacious rooms of Polo Towers, where we can open the windows for fresh air instead of aircon, just right. Having been to Las Vegas twice before we chose the Polo Towers for the location and would definitely recommned this appartment complex to anyone who is looking for a few home comforts of an appartment but with hotel style service.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: BMcBride81
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a wedding being held at Mandalay Bay but had family staying on the opposite end of the strip so I decided to try the Polo Towers since it was a little more centrally located and a little less expensive than some of the "bigger"-named resorts. I pretty much just used the room to have a place to leave my things while I was out and about and to get a little shut eye. The room served it's purpose but for a little more money I could have stayed at a higher end place and gotten a lot more out of it. The room was like a tiny studio apartment, murphy bed included. The service was great and all of the staff I encountered were friendly but I would not make the choice to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for the location.”
Reviews.Author: schneiks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a friends bachelor party. I must say, I've been to Vegas several times and never even noticed this place. The rooms are very nice, and the facility is well kept - for the price! Make no mistake, its no Bellagio, but who cares! The roof top pool was nice, had great views, but was often crowded. There is a snack shop with everything you can imagine at good prices. You are a half block off the strip in a central location to all the biggest and newest casinos. We had great views of City Center from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelnwrite
Reviews.Content: The rather faded, dated exterior of Polo Towers had always made us wonder if the interior was the same. We decided to find out when we booked a week using the Getaways program offered by Interval International (a membership program for timeshare owners). We stayed for a week. Oct. 1 - 8, 2011 in a one-bedroom (excellent king-sized bed) unit, with full (and fully equipped) kitchen, large living/dining area and spacious bathroom with entrances to it from both the bedroom and the living room. There were large flat-screen televisions in both the bedroom and living room. We asked at check-in to have a higher room so were assigned to the 21st floor - our southwest view looked out over McCarran Airport and across the valley. It was also convenient to the rooftop pool, just a floor above us. If there was any negative about our stay it would be experiences at the pool/bbq level. It is clearly marked there is to be no food, beverage or glass in the pool area yet the day we arrived one family had taken over a cabana and set up a virtual buffet at poolside while another guest drank a beer from the bottle while in the pool. Perhaps plastic cups and plates should be provided. The location is excellent: We were a block off the Vegas Strip, an easy walk to City Center, Planet Hollywood, Miracle Mile Shops and MGM. We caught the city transit ($5 for two hours/$7 for 24-hours) and did our grocery shopping at Whole Foods grocery found in the Town Square Shopping Center at the south end of The Strip. On the very positive side was the daily garbage collection and exchange of used kitchen and bathroom towels that room service provided -- as well as a mid-week full cleaning -- we don't get that much room service at Marriott's Ko Olina in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, PERFECT for Vegas on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Charles-M-SJ
Reviews.Content: There are times when you go to Vegas, and you wanna have a great time, spend top dollar and not think twice about it! I've yet to have one of those times, so finding a reasonable place to stay on the strip that does not cost an arm and a leg is imperative for me. Luckily I got it right on the first try! Polo Towers is great! Located one block from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops, a block from the MGM grand, and at prices that even I could afford this place was a prayer answered. It gets better, the rooms are nice! New furniture, flat panel TVs, I didn't feel like I was sleeping in a motel. The only thing that may throw some people off is the Murphy bed (Thats a bed that folds into a wall when you are not using it). I personally only used my room to sleep, so I took it down once and left it that way the whole time! All the above perks, plus there is a pool, decent gym (for a hotel) snack bar and very friendly staff. This is my new hotel of choice!..until the day I can spend top dollar and not think twice about it at least!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay,can,t get better”
Reviews.Author: Aime61
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 1 week stay at Polo towers las vegas. Oct 12 - 19th It was great. Yes the place is getting old , but it is well maintained, Great location , The suite 1 bed room was 613 sq. ft. large liviving room & fully equipped kitchen . nice bathroom and nice king bed in bedroom. Over all the satff were great and very helpfull. You can not get better for the price, If you want the noise of the strip stay on the strip. Polo is only 1/2 block off the strip, but it gives you some peace and quite after a night on the strip. The pool on the roof is nice quite and not over crowded , no kids and room to lay around ,not like the big high end hotels. We will be back ///

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Carrotty
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night only, in a studio room with a murphy bed and kitchenette. Although small, the room is perfect for one person. The coffee maker was great, fridge and ice maker worked (although it was noisy) and the bathroom deluxe. The place was spotlessly clean and staff friendly. Centrally-located on the busiest part of the Strip, I thought it would be noisy, but it was quiet. It would be nice if they included instructions on how to pull down the Murphy bed, but you'd have to be pretty dumb if you can't figure it out. The bed was comfortable and the mattress nearly new. Since I was there only one night, I didn't partake of any amenities such as the pool or fitness center. Parking was in a fenced area and seemed secure, so I didn't have to worry about my vehicle getting broken in to.

Reviews.Title: “No Followup”
Reviews.Author: CC_Poky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Polo Towers last winter just befor Christmas. The place was nice and we had a good stay. We had one incident in which we were cooking with oil and a defective part of the microwave fell off, splashed in the grease, and nearlt burned my wife and I. As it was, it only splashed on our clothing and ruined it. The staff told us they were at fault, but we never heard back from them again. Very poor follow up, bad management.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vagas”
Reviews.Author: rixjeff
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Polo Towers Early September 2011, Very easy to book in, very polite and helpful staff in reception,Stayed in 1 Bedroom apartment on 18th floor, really clean with basic amenities. Bathroom was nicely set out, more than enough room in the apartment for 4 people. Just off the strip and very convienient for getting around the strip area. We used the buses to get to the outlets and walked to shops and casinos on the strip. Bellman very efficient at getting taxies on the 2 occasions we needed them. I have stayed in time share resorts before where you are bombarded with requests to sit through a timeshre talk, This resort did not do this, we were asked if we would be available, however we declined and the resort respect this. Would stay again if I return to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonDisneyfan
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes, studio unit with kitchen just off the strip, inexpensive...we should've known better. Check-in was fast but staff neither friendly nor welcoming. This place is geared towards time share owners, not so interested in tourists just renting a room. Kitchen was a mini fridge and microwave, coffee maker and some dishes. No dish cloths, soap. There was a little coffee basket but you pay $1 for each coffee package. No room cleaning if stay is up to 4 days, fresh towels and trash is supposed to be done daily, but no one came and had to call front desk on 3. day for towels and trash removal. Toilet not working properly, the flush was broken, had to call maintenance twice during 4 day stay. Location was good, rooms are very sound proof and roof top pool is small but nice. Would definitely never book here again but gladly pay the extra $ and stay in one of the 4 star hotels in area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lsa13
Reviews.Content: We rented the 2bedroom villa. While the master bed was comfy, the murphy bed left a bit to be desired. The room however was very sufficient and was in a perfect location, right off the strip by Planet Hollywood. While we did have a rental car, we had the opportunity to hit all the casinos on the strip by walking and the tram. Our rooms were promised to be ready for us by 11am and was not. For our inconvenience we were promised a box of chocolates (which out of the 8 nights we were there we never received), also the person who spoke to us about reviewing the time shares after asking us what day and time we wanted could not get it straight and when we showed up was told it was for the next. I refused. . .I will never agree to go to another time share review with Diamond Resorts again. . this is the 2nd bad appointment in the past year. . so I am done with that. However with that said the resort was very nice, great view, again perfect location. Very friendly bell men, and valet personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in 1 bedroom Villa - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: scottyskywalker
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weeklong stay in a 1 bedroom Polo Towers Villa. Exceeded my expectations - would definitely stay again Purchased time-share week from owner (a little stressful till the confirmation email came from Diamond Resorts - reservation dept staff were very helpful and promptly returned my calls) Location was perfect - even though its a 3 minute walk to the strip that's still faster than the trek through most hotel/casinos to get to the hotel elevators. Less than 10 minute walk to MGM, Monte Carlo or Planet Hollywood. We arrived at 5PM on a Friday & waited 5 minutes in line - check-in took 2 minutes then passed to another person for 'check-in package' after 5 minutes I explained that we'd been travelling all day & we were too tired to listen to the offers. Condo was great - very clean, 2 flat screen TVs, jacuzzi tub. Daily housekeeping to change towels, remove garbage & make bed. Kitchen very well equipped (even had a blender) - didn't do much cooking but was nice to not have to leave room to have coffee/toast/cereal in the morning & also lots of room in full-size fridge for beer/drinks/snacks King size bed VERY comfortable - nice bedding. Our friend slept on the fold-down murphy bed - much more comfortable than a sofabed. Rooftop pool was exactly what I like - music was current but not pounding bass like my teenager plays, no problem finding a chair even over the busy holiday weekend. Used valet - nice guys ( and one lady), prompt service. In-room internet was nice & strong - never had problem with weak signal **payment for internet service is PER DEVICE** - $36/week or $7/day We were very satisfied with our room & service from staff - would recommend to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location but be very careful of the timeshare pressure.”
Reviews.Author: Kawgirl46
Reviews.Content: I had swapped a time share for two rooms for two couples--my guests were talked into upgrading the rooms in exchange for a timeshare presentation. The upgraded rooms were otherwise empty so where's the favor? BUT the timeshare presentation was the worst I have ever experienced. Friendly, distractive, chatter for much too long, didn't listen that we were all senior citizens with a different perspective than a young couple. We asked for some time or alternate means of considering the offer because the mother of one of my guests was, literally, terminally ill in the hospital. The presenter just ignored that and blundered on until we walked out after two and a half hours, at which time he told his supervisor we had only stayed 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cbsjohn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times in the last 10 years. Each time the place has had improvements. The location is great, just a few hundred yards off the strip It backs up to the side entrance of the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood, both fun spots to go to. There rooms are very well maintained and they have shuttle service to supermarkets if you are staying for the week. They also have a free shuttle to the Old Vegas. The prices are reasonable and the staff is helpfull

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MANDY082
Reviews.Content: Stayed our last night here as close to airport - nice roof top pool, good location but the apartment rooms have the pull down beds (ok for 1 night) but not for long stays as room was slighty cramped - but clean and nice bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Studio room is good for single, not for family!”
Reviews.Author: fengshuiman
Reviews.Content: Polo studio suite is really small, smaller in size than a normal hotel in LVegas. Once the 'Murphy' bed is down, you don't hv much room to move around. They is not much space to bring friends into the suite to relax or chat. Gd for 1 person or max, a partner. It is clean though with no smoking but you be better off paying for a hotel room along the strip if the price is right. Bigger and spacious. Or get a 2 bedroom suite. Do watch out for the 'mattress spring' as you bring the murphy bed down and pillows tends to be too soft and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: nomad-drifter
Reviews.Content: We were able to exchange our Florida timeshare thru Interval International for a one bedroom unit in Tower 1 at Polo Towers for Sept 17 -24, 2011. From the airport we took the shuttle which cost $12 round trip. We had no problems for the return pick up .Just call them the day before and they picked us up at the agreed time.They were prompt . Check in at Polo was fast and efficient. All the staff were friendly and courteous. There is free internet in the business area from 6am to 10 pm. 20 minutes time limit .We were able to check e-mails etc. Our 1 bed room unit was fully furnished with a kitchen etc. We found the bathtub was draining slowly - called the front desk and it was fixed the same day. We were pleasantly surprised that they offered free shuttle to a supermarket Mondays and Wednesday as well a free shuttle to the outlet shopping mall and to Fremont , Sunday and Fridays. There was daily maid service for trash and a mid week general cleaning. Polo Towers is located between MGM and Planet Hollywood - it is a minute walk from the Strip .There is a Walgreens and CVS drug store nearby where you can buy groceries for breakfast till you go to the supermarket on the free shuttle. We did attend their time share presentation and found them to be a bit aggressive. All in all we enjoyed our stay at Polo Towers and would stay there again. However, we would go mid October when the temperature is a bit cooler - the temperature in Sept was 30 + deg C .

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: AtticusB
