Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a one bedroom unit, so we avoided the murphy bed, and it was worth it. The staff here were very good. Quick to answer questions and check in and out. The room was bigger then a lot of my old apartments and had a view of the strip. The king size bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. On the downside, first, the constant drive to make you go to a timeshare sale presentation. It takes about 2 hours which we didn't have to spare. Second you only receive coffee for the maker for one day, after that you have to buy more. Third the housekeeping decided to shampoo the hallway carpets at 11pm with a noisy cleaner. All in all a great place to stay if you don't want to pay for all the gimicks of the typical on the strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: dixiedogCanada
Reviews.Content: Great location, maybe 100 feet from Las Vegas Blvd South. Lots of amenities 2 pools, one for kiddies, and one on the roof. Great rooms. Fully furnished kitchen. Easy access to the Strip no need for car or taxi. No underground parking fees. Best beds that I have ever slept on.....One down side, have to pay for internet service for each laptop...Otherwise, freat value for your money. Good front end service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gem a short walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am quite pleased with the week I spent here. Considering the location, the price, the full kitchen in the 1 bedroom, and the service, it beats paying double and staying at other strip properties that don't have anywhere near the same value. I stayed here during a business trip to Las Vegas, in which I spent every day 8AM-5PM at the client site all the way northwest on Sahara Ave. If you have ever rented a car while in Vegas, you may be thinking that I had a difficult time getting around, and the answer is, pleasantly, no. Even though the Polo Towers occupies a fairly small grid between the MGM and Planet Hollywood, it was designed quite efficiently, especially with regards to parking in the underground spots. There is surface parking that I think may be shared with the nearby businesses or possibly the Marriott Grand Chateau, but the walk is a bit more than just taking the elevators in the Polo Towers down to the basement. Thinking more externally, though, the access road to the hotel is off Harmon Avenue, which is typically not heavy traffic-wise. I'd recommend this as the only way to enter the property because the alleyways off S. Las Vegas Blvd are prone to pedestrian blocking at any time of the day. The rooms are quite nice, but inconsistent when it comes to amenities. I was initially given a great room on the 9th floor with a direct view of City Center and a soaking tub with jacuzzi jets, but the guest in the next room felt it necessary to rock the house with loud music for hours on end, so I relocated since I had work to do. The second room I got was on the 10th floor and faced east toward the Signature at MGM towers, and the tub did NOT have jacuzzi jets. A bit of a disappointment as I was looking forward to it. I suspect this may be due to many of the units being condos, in which case I can understand that each suite would be designed slightly differently. The 1 bedroom King suite I selected had a nice, upscale-ish design with flat screen LCDs in the living room and bedroom, a full kitchen with all needed utensils, plates, pans, pots, and silverware, and a somewhat small bedroom with a great bed. The bathroom had dual vanities and a larger sized soaking tub. The complimentary soap/shampoo/conditioner was sufficient, but fairly standard generic hotel industry stuff. The bedroom window is actually a sliding glass door which leads to a very small standing-only balcony where you can get some fresh air. The selection of TV channels was good enough, but who does much TV watching in Las Vegas, anyway? I checked out the pool, but did not have time to enjoy it. It is located on the 22nd floor and is fairly small but probably adequately sized for what I think is a rather low occupancy rate at any given time on this property (<30% is what it felt like mid-week). There are also complimentary laundry facilities on select floors. These are literally rooms that have 2 washing machines and 2 dryers, just like the machines you would have at home. They don't have timers, though, so if you are paranoid about someone stealing your clothes, take a book to read while your laundry finishes. This is a really nice feature that I have yet to see at any other property I've stayed at. There are a few things I need to mention, though. First, when you initially arrive it can be rather confusing to figure out where to park so you can check in. There is a row of parallel parking spots on the east side of the building for 15-min check-in, but I suspect these tend to fill up quickly and are used beyond the 15 minute intended window. There is a valet at the front of the building, but being a capable human being with legs, I don't need someone else to park for me. I would recommend just parking in the garage and then taking your bags with you to the elevators and up to the lobby level where you can check in. At check in, the front desk will provide you with a parking pass that you need to place on your vehicle's dashboard before midnight, which I guess is when they do a daily patrol of the garage. Next, the the building is shaped sort of like an H, and the east side elevators do not go down to the basement level. The west side elevators do, though. What this means is if your room is on the west side, your elevators will go directly to the basement. Those staying on the east side either need to go down to the lobby using the east elevator, then transfer to the west elevator for basement access, or walk through the connecting hallway on your floor to the west elevator. Additionally, like I mentioned in the beginning of the review, I had noise problems with the person in the next room. I think most newer hotel properties have nearly eliminated this problem by building thick concrete walls between rooms, but the walls here probably aren't thick enough. Fortunately, the front desk asked no questions when I asked for a different room, so I was able to get quick resolution on this problem. Just something to keep in mind if you are stuck in a similar situation. For what it's worth, I think the property has given guests the means to be inconsiderate like this by providing a stereo with large speakers on the entertainment center, which butts right up against the shared wall with the next room. Finally, while the inside of the building is maintained very well, the outside reminds me of older downtown buildings, especially the "big city" smell that you may notice in certain areas. There are no plants or landscapes.. just a lot of concrete, utility boxes, dumpsters, and funky smelling puddles of water. It isn't the most inviting atmosphere to see when walking back after a night out on the strip, but something to keep in mind if you are used to a more scenic return like at the Bellagio or City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: 2008OklahomaCity_OK
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay on the strip. Quiet and centrally located behind Hawaiian stores and next to everything. Rooftop pool and another pool on ground level for kids with splash park. Staff was extremely friendly whether you were at the counter or passing them in the hall!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rayharney
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel only fault we could find was the pool on the roof did not have enough shade with temperatures at 112deg staff were really helpful great location just off the strip near MGM and Paris sorry remembered another fault no restaurant at hotel but enough good ones nearby really enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the really bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: km100503
Reviews.Content: We are time share owners and were unable to get into our desired place, so settled for the Polo Towers Villas. We were NOT disappointed. We read all the reviews and were nervous about staying here from some of the bad comments written and were pleasantly surprised when we got there. Yes, the outside is questionable,it's not the grandest looking hotel on the strip, but never judge a book by it's cover. We were quite early, but our room was ready and we were checked in promptly. Our "personal consierge" as he called himself, was a bit miffed that we didn't want to attend a presentation to receive wonderful gifts, it would only take 90 minutes. We told him we were not interested as we were already owners of DIamond Resorts elsewhere. He quickly looked at our confirmation again and apologized for the error, however, we were invited to a 55 minute presentation instead! Still, we said no thanks and that was the last time we ever saw our "personal consierge". We weren't expecting any phone calls, so each time the phone rang, we just let it go to voicemail. Of course, it's the front desk inviting you to a presentation again, so just be forewarned, if you don't expect a call from anyone, don't answer the phone and they will leave you alone. The one bedroom villa we stayed in was very clean and well equipped. You can see the strip from the 10th floor and a bit of a parking lot, but in actuality, who stays in Vegas and stares at the view all day and night....get out of the room and enjoy it firsthand. There is a convenience store in the hotel and carries everything you need at the same or lesser prices than the supermarkets or Walgreens. There is no casino nor restaurants in the buliding, but there are hundreds out on the strip, do your choices are abundant. The only complaints we had was that the pool area is very small and more chairs and tables than lounges to relax on. Also, we were there for a week and were told we had trash and towel service daily. The first day was great...fresh towels trash removed, bed made. Second day, fresh towels, trash removed. Third day, no towels, no trash. Fourth day, same. We actually had to call housekeeping 3x to have towels and toilet paper delivered. We were also to have a mid week full clean, which we had not received until we called and then we received it at 430PM. We felt it may have been retaliation for not attending their presentations. We are however going back to Polo Towers as it is clean, mid strip, close to everything and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway- great location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickLongBeach
Reviews.Content: Since we own a timeshare, we kept getting calls asking us to check out this property. We are not big Vegas people and when I looked at some of the reviews of the property I was not too keen on going. However, they made us a great offer ($100 for three nights and go to a 1.5 hour presentation) so we could not pass it up. I was expecting the worst, however, that did not happen. As others have commented, the driveway is difficult to see, but we made it in okay. The back parking lot does look a little seedy, but we used valet parking which is free. When I walked in, it was a pleasant surprise to see nice marble floors, and a great reception area. Check in was a breeze and we were in our room within minutes. The room was a one bedroom suite with full kitchen and a view of the strip from the 14th floor. The room was spotless and everything was in great order. The balcony has no chairs and is really small and not worth trying to squeeze out onto. The interior of the hotel looks like it was just redone with all new carpet, etc....very nice. I was not impressed with the photos of the rooftop pool, but it turned out to be nicer than the photos...we enjoyed it. The presentation was quite comical (a little over the top) but the sales guy was not high pressure. I was surprised how easily they let us say no and leave but maybe they just had a good read on us that we were not going to buy. The location of the hotel is fantastic...walking distance to all the major hotels which saved money on cabs. There is one of the cheap showtickets booth right out in front of the hotel and that was a good deal. Got some 1/2 priced tickets for a show and 50% off dinner in Harrahs and Bally's fine steakhouses. As others have said, a downside is no bar in the hotel or casino but that is just a short walk. All of the staff was super friendly and helpful. The hotel market it great also. I would give the place two thumbs up...it is not the Four Seasons but it is a great deal for the prices I saw advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkRobinson70
Reviews.Content: The good/bad thing about is the lack of a casino and its size. In comparison to the usual Harrah's or MGM hotels, check in was easy with no queue although there was the timeshare offer of a tour and free upgrade. After a 24 hour trip you just want your bed. However we hassled in PH about timeshares in Westgate last time we visited. We stayed in the studio with the pull down bed and it was fine. The big advantage to this property is the fridge. We had a Strip view room. Across the road from City Center and 2 minutes to the tickets for tonight , Deuce bus stop, Walgreens, McDonalds and less than 5 to PH for the usual Vegas facilities. TIP CVS across the street is significantly cheaper than Walgreens although it a hassle geting across as the skybridge is further down the street. Air conditioning did have a mind of its own and turn itself off and on when it felt like it. Be aware they will want a $250 authorisation on a card at check in. There are no bars or restaurants on site although that simply isn't a problem with hundreds to choose from elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at the Clarion Hotel & Casino I escaped to the Polo Towers and I sure was happy to find this place. The hotel/condos are set back from the Strip down by the MGM Grand, but it's quiet and the rooms are lovely. The lobby is marble, with a horse sculpture fountain in the middle, and there are comfy couches to lounge on. The staff was very helpful, from valets to the concierge to the desk attendants. There is also a small store that's open early and late and nearby are loads of restaurants, casinos, shops, and oodles of pedestrian traffic to watch. This hotel is also right behind the Hawaiian Gardens shops, where you can eat, catch a street show, get misted with cooling vapors, or just watch the crowds. The room I was in was a studio suite, with a Murphy bed. The bed was not very comfortable and with the bed down, after you move the coffee table to let it fold down, there is very little space in the living room. This might be awkward for more than one person. Otherwise, the room was great, with a full kitchen, a large bathroom and shower, nice decor, a flat screen HDTV and DVD player. Also, on the second floor is a laundry room and the washers and dryers are free! If you want to use the gym downstairs, which is very nice, if you're not a timeshare guest you have to pay for a day or week pass. I recall it was about $20 for seven days. Not bad but an unexpected expense. Overall, I was very happy with the Polo Towers and I was able to avoid a timeshare presentation. But I definitely will stay here again when I travel to Las Vegas. The valet parking is free, just tip the valet, and much easier than trying to park your car yourself. Besides, with the excellent location right off the Strip, having a car is more of a liability anyway, unless you want to go somewhere else. Hoover Dam is only about a 45 minute drive and well worth the trip and tour into the power plant.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rat1084
Reviews.Content: I'm giving an average rating since dissapointing isn't an option. checking in was a hassle because of the push to attend a timeshare presentation. We attended/got the Visa gift card and got the hell out of there! The room was overlooking a parking lot, we specifically asked for a view of the strip not a parking lot. The room was clean, we had the dividing door opened between the two units. My daughter and I were on the "small side". Once you pull down the pullman bed you can't move in the room there is too much furniture-makes no sense! It is very convenient to be able to take the shuttle to the grocery store and the outlets! There is also a shuttle to Fremont Street, ask first thing it fills up fast. I won't stay here again...like I said, we were disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: marebu16
Reviews.Content: After viewing the photos on trip advisor, I was pleasantly surprised to see our 1 bedroom suite. Grantie counters, very clean, nice furnishings. Very secure, need hotel card to ride elevator and saw a security presence. I was glad to not have a casino there. Very good location we walked to both ends of the strip several times. Bed and linens very comfortable.The a/c is loud as I saw mentined previously. Enjoyed the rooftop pool, very realxing. Nice fitness area with full massage menu. We did attend the time share presentation and if you do your homework it is not that hard to say NO. We were given a free buffet and free show tickests. We chose VEGAS the show and I would highly recommend it. We also took the free shuttle to Fremont Street which is a great way to travel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Aido1982
Reviews.Content: The Polo Resort was actually better than I expected. Location is ideal because we were on the strip. The prices were extremely cheap. Free parking included. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience, will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: scochelle
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas on business, and have been plenty of times before so i am familiar with the caliber and prices of all the different hotels on the strip. This one was booked for us, as a colleague has a time share, so apparantly they got a good deal. Firstly, when checking in... the said after giving us the keys, to go to the next lady for our "welcome pak". Their version of a welcome pack was an attempt to sign us up for a timeshare. After saying no, no, no... they continued to call our room that day to increase the offer (show tickets, etc.) to go into a presentation. I have been to presentations before.. and i know how high pressure they are. They say 2 hours, but really they are 4 hours+. Secondly - they said the room had a murphy bed, and a bed (the studio suite). The room was the size of my bedroom at home! There was a murphy bed.. and a hide-a-bed / couch.. but the room was so small, they cannot be opened at the same time! We tried to speak to the front desk about the problem.. and the best they could do is upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite for an extra $30/night.. that would make it around $70/nt total, and for that price there are MANY options way better than this aging has been hotel.. no restaurant.. no casino.. no return from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation....loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmisssassey
Reviews.Content: The Polo Resort was actually better than I expected. The place is just fabulous. Everyone on staff were pleasant and very professional. Location is ideal because we were on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely time we had and will most definitely return! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Modise N
Reviews.Content: Went there in July 2011 and the hotel is ideally located, in the middle of the strip. It has a bus stop just a minute walk for exploring the whole of Vegas. I went there for my birthday and I found Vegas to be the place to be for those special occassions. The city never sleep. The Polo Towers rooms are adequate size and functional. You have a fully equiped kitchen for those who enjoy a home cooked meal. The only downside to the experience has to be the housekeeping ladies who seem to be more than happy not to tend to the room and the fact that servicing of the room is done once a week or so. I would I go back? Emphatic yes!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, minus the timeshare presentation and construction noise”
Reviews.Author: ToastyHam
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic! It's right on the strip, only a little over a block from Planet Hollywood and the mall. Unfortunately, the outside structure looks a little rundown and it is accessible by alley-way when you're walking, but I didn't feel unsafe at any time. My girlfriends stayed mostly at Planet Hollywood while I found luxurious refuge in my own villa, which was nice because it didn't get loud or have any obnoxious music playing at 2am. I went to Vegas for my birthday with plans to both relax and party hard. While my friends were enjoying both day and night events, I leisurely attended one party a day and relaxed in the room; reading, did some shopping at the mall, and enjoyed the rooftop pool. It gets crowded with children running around in the lobby, but I was lucky enough to stay in the third tower in a corner room so family noise wasn't an issue. Large jet tubs and a nice fitness facility made me feel like I was living better than at home! Staff was nice...until the timeshare presentation. Here are the only cons: high pressure guilt trip if you didn't buy their timeshare, and weird construction noises from above that began every morning around 930am until noon. I notified the front desk but they said "Yeah, they're just doing some maintenance up there," and did not proceed to do anything about it. So if you're going to that presentation, make it for a day before you leave so that way you don't feel guilty for staying too long. Hah. Would I recommend this to a friend? Most definitely! The location itself is worth it! The villas are impressive on the inside, but Polo Towers definitely does not look too inviting on the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not as nice as other Diamond Resort properties”
Reviews.Author: ThatBrownGirl
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers... can't beat the location. It's right at City Center, so you have access to all the great shopping and attractions. It's easy to get to, out of and around. It's clean, very clean. I just didn't find it as nice as other Diamond Resort properties (it could use a refresh/remodel... soon. If you are an owner, you'll be expecting a little more). The convenience store was reasonable, affordable and well-stocked. The front desk/concierge staff is outstanding. If you are just looking for a clean place to sleep with easy access, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal7777
Reviews.Content: We were on a three-week/4.000 km trip through west USA (from Frisco over Las Vegas to LA, visiting all the national parks) with our two kids (12 and 15). We stayed at this hotel (after checking TripAdvisor) and everything was A-OK for the price we paid! The Strip is 200 m away but it's very restful...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great kitchen and Great kid's pool!”
Reviews.Author: TonyGrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Polo Tower with 2 rooms (1 bedroom + 1 Studio connecting). My family of 4 was staying at the 1 bedroom while my friend's family of 4 was staying in the Studio. The 1 bedroom only has a king size bed so we use the sofa bed a lot in the living room. My friend's family felt the studio was small (like the other reviews) so they have to put the cushions on the floor to extend the bed a bit. Other than that, it was a great stay. Location was so convenient to public transit and attractions (middle of the strip). Nice staff (from bell service, to front desk, to housekeeping to security). It has all the amenities we need (laundry room is clean, kids' pool are great, although internet is not free-they have a computer room on the ground floor with printer). We love the size of the kitchen, utensils and cookware are very new, clean and complete. 2 vanity counters in the 1 bedroom-bathroom. The first night when we noticed the fridge was not cold enough, the maintenance worker came within 5 minutes to fix the problem. The hotel has free shuttles to grocery store, outlet mall and downtown Vegas (on schedule, once a week) so you don't really need to rent a car if you are able to work with their scheduled time. Great place! Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Bug Bites”
Reviews.Author: jjinpg
Reviews.Content: Besides the service being majorly sub-par, I woke up on the 3rd morning with a huge patch of welts on my side that looked to be what I thought were spider bites. Upon returning home that night, they got worse and they were spreading. After googling what I thought the marks were, I stumbled upon bug bites and found pictures of exactly what my bites looked like. I don't have Dr. confirmation yet however, I feel pretty confidant in the evidence I have found so far. Will not be revisiting.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers is great, but check your reservation when using Expedia”
Reviews.Author: Goleta
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers deserves a good solid 3 rating because of location, nice clean rooms, well kept property and friendly accommodating staff. We have stayed there previously and I have posted a review which pretty much reflects our experience this time. However, I wanted to post information about an incident this time regarding a mix up in reservation information that reminds us all of the need to check in advances with the property a couple of days before your arrival. I booked this stay through Expedia, but when we arrived at the Polo Towers they informed me that we didn’t have reservation. Upon further checking they said that in fact we did have a reservation starting the previous day and suggested that I contact Expedia. Expedia was absolutely no help in resolving this difficulty. I was kept on hold for 30 minutes with the end result being that the Expedia representative told me to “go to the front desk and see what you can do.” I have used Expedia in the past thinking that if there was an issue with a reservation they would help me resolve it in a timely manner. This certainly was not the case – I was on my own (which by the way the staff at Polo Towers did accommodate the change in a timely and friendly manner). I don't know where the mix up occurred, but Expedia was of no help in resolving the issue. Lesson Learned – you might want to use Expedia because you can get a deal or a package that you want, but don’t expect them to provide any assistance beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family but not for gambling”
Reviews.Author: Mendelssohnian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Polo Towers Suite (Villas is for their club members only) because my brother and sister-in-law were staying there and we want the cousins to play together. Although the rate isn't as great as some other Vegas hotels, but each rooms come with a full size kitchen. We loved the kitchen as we can stock up on food and drinks, and cook our own meals. The downside of that is the hotel doesn't have any onsite restaurant. You would have to bring food in or eat out. Although the hotel is centrally located on the strip, you have to walk to pretty much everywhere, including playing a little slot machine. The hotel is definitely not for people who want to enjoy the casino atmosphere, as there isn't any casino on site. However, I would give it a high rating for comfort, convenience and cleanliness. We like the room, just not having to walk everywhere. It does have a kiddie pool/playground area which my kids loved.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities without the glitz”
Reviews.Author: foreigncarnut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated on the LV Strip. We had a room with a small kitchen--great for the quick breakfast in-room, keeping cold beverages and brewing your own coffee in the morning. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. And, laundry facilities are available for the cost of detergent. Plus, it has protected underground parking; we had a restored classic car with us but would think anyone with an expensive car would appreciate this amenity vs. valet parking (where the young jocks get to "joy ride" with your car).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, place, and service”
Reviews.Author: brbetha01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were gifted a timeshare for our honeymoon at this hotel. It is conveniently located towards the middle of the strip which allows easy access to several of the casinos. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are not disappointing. I was actually able to sleep whereas in hotels I usually have a hard time sleeping comfortably. The service was great and if we needed anything, someone came up soon after being called. The parking area beneath the hotel was very tight and finding a spot could be difficult. The pool was on the rooftop of one of the towers but was very small and disappointing. There was no restaurant or bar in the hotel either which was kind of disappointing, but not essential considering you can buy alcohol ANYWHERE along the strip. Last thing, internet access does not come as an aminity - you must pay for it. Other than that, the Polo Towers was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “On the Strip, Huge Rooms, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: loralake
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in a 2brm condo at Polo Towers during Easter week. Booked with Getaroom.com and paid $128/night (call the 1-800 number for their lowest rate). Good Stuff: • 1bm condo plus hotel room with kitchenette spacious size • In-room internet ($6.95/24hrs) inexpensive compared to other hotels • Kitchen has granite countertops • Quaint pool, outdoor BBQ for guest use, cabana huts, hot tub, big towels, decent music playing, and excellent lounge chairs (kids must leave pool area by 5pm) • Kids splash park is on opposite part of hotel • in-hotel mini market good prices • Tucked about 100 feet back from the strip next door to the Hawaiin Market and PH Hotel. • CVS a block away - pick up liquor, food, snacks, etc.... • Friendly staff Not so good stuff: • Wish pool was bigger and more tropical with palm trees, waterfall, etc.... • No grocery store close by. ABC store a few blocks away where you can buy premade sanfwiches, salads, milk, juice, bread....(take free shuttle to grocery store) • Balconeys are the worst I've ever seen in my whole life. No furniture, but you wouldn't wan to sit there anyway. • Kitchen faucet water pressure was weak • Carpet a little outdated • Ice machine only on a few floors • Murphey bed is okay. Memory foam topper would make it better! • No restaurant onsite, but some good ones are close by Vegas Shows (ranked best first): 1. La Reve - Amazing!!!! 2. O 3. The Lion King 4. Mystere 5. KA 6. Jaberwalky 7. Blue Man Group Buffet at the Wynn is the best.... For Steak & Lobster look for specials on Freemont street if you're an attractive woman walking down the strip during the day you'll most likely get approached by Bar VIP hosts who want to give you a free wrist band for no cover, no wait in line, and free drinks. Tell them you have 8 more single girlfriends back at your hotel and they'll give you more wrist bands. These come in handy when making friends in Vegas. Hand them out to people you meet and have fun! Money and Time Saving Tips: • Easy to walk evverywhere plus it's good exercise. • Reserve your seat on the free hotel shuttle to Freemont street a day early • Free shuttle to major Grocery store 3 times/week • Cheapest Airport shuttle is Gray line via Getaroom.com $13 roundtrip from airpoirt to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tsaunder
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in July, 2011 as an exchange with our timeshare and had a great time. Myself, spouse and 14 yr old were on the trip. The service was excellent, the rooms clean. We had a problem with the TV but they promptly fixed the problem. Would definitely go back if in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend on second trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: reshee
Reviews.Content: Generally I was quite happy with my stay at Polo Towers where I stayed for 5 nights in July 2011. I stayed in a murphy studio. PLUS: -Good location on the strip between MGM and Planet Hollywood. -Clean modern rooms (ie. flat televisions, white linens). -Comfortable bed-- and mine was a murphy. - I did not get bothered to do a time share presentation. -Balcony -Very close to a McDonald's if you're looking for an inexpensive meal, especially breakfast. -A tix4tonight booth was right out front. -relatively inexpensive. -Speedy check in without the insane lines of the big hotels. -BBQ's on roof on a first come first serve basis with nice seating around them. If you are there with a group and have a car to do grocery shopping this could be a great way to do dinner. MINUSES: -No restaurant in hotel. This was a minus for me because having never been to Vegas I didn't know where was good to go eat. I would have liked to have just gone downstairs to grab a bite before heading out. -Order in menu not very appetizing and loaded with extra fees because the food is delivered. (like a $15 dollar "packing fee") -Really bad conditioner. If you have long hair you're going to need to buy or bring your own. -2 of the 4 days of my stay I came back in the evening to see that my hotel had not been touched by housekeeping. -Pool very very small and shallow. Even though there is a separate pool for kids/families there were still many kids playing marco pollo at the "adult" pool. -Because it's a timeshare, I always kind of hesitated before contacting front desk or asking the concierge for something because I didn't want to get roped into a presentation. DEPENDS ON YOUR PREFERENCE: -No casino. Whether that's a positive or negative is up to you. -Coffee machine in room, but only 1 free packet of coffee per stay. After that it is a dollar a day. Whether that's a negative depends on whether you'd rather stay in and have coffee or have it with breakfast. -Parking is outdoors and probably more vulnerable to crime (though I experienced none) and definitely makes your car an oven when you get in. This didn't bug me too much but it depends on your taste. OVERALL: I would definitely recommend the Polo Towers to anyone who has done Vegas before and knows where they might like to eat, where they'd like to gamble, what shows they'd like to see, etc. With none of that on-site you have to go out of your hotel to get the Vegas experience which can be daunting for a first time visitor when you don't really know where you should be heading. SUGGESTION: -When you check in there is a two step check-in process. First you go through a normal check-in where you get your key, show ID, etc. Then they send you down to a different counter to get your "welcome package"-- maps, "where" guides, etc. My thought on this, and I could be wrong, is that this is the part where they size you up to see if they are going to try and get you to come to the timeshare presentation. The gentleman at the welcome desk was rather smarmy, and sales like, and had a list of guests names and times that they were coming to the presentation or a reason why they weren't written on it. To my surprise, they did not attempt to get me to come to one, but this might be that I simply wasn't their target market-- I'm in my mid 20's and they probably realize I can't afford it. My suggestion for anyone really looking to avoid the timeshare presentation is to simply get your key and not continue down to the second desk and just go to your room. You will miss getting the map, some guide books, a list of shuttles, and the take-out menu, but most of that you can find online or maybe ask housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and elegant place to stay but needs some upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: Spicki
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is a property of Diamond Resorts, which is selling timeshares, so be prepared for them to try to sell you an ownership. The hotel fortunately doesn't have a casino which makes it a calm place to unwind after a strenuous walking tour on the LV strip or some long poker nights. The rooms come in three different categories: studios (up to 2 travellers), one (up to 4 travellers) and two bedroom units (up to 6 travellers). Being a timeshare place each unit has it's own kitchen. The rooms are well kept and look inviting but in my opinion could use some more decorative elements. The hotel lobby looks elegant and the staff was very friendly. The exterior of the complex needs some upgrades to make the propoerty look appealing from the outside. Polo Towers is very conveniently located, the MGM, NYNY, The Belagio and many other places are all in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hoffman121110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week. The location is fine and the price was ok. We walked EVERYWHERE!! So it was nice to stay on the strip. We never used the kitchen because we woke up and then came home just to sleep. There are TONS of non English speaking people out front trying to hand out strip joint adverts. But they are all over the strip. We felt safe walking to and from the place night and day. The room was comfortable enough. The room stayed nice and cool. There are a couple souvenir shops in the hawaiin market right out front and they sell cokes and waters for around $1 so we loaded up on those to have in the room. We didn't realize until the end of the week because we didn't take the time to read the paper work, but they have a grocery store run and transport to the Freemont Street experience. Both would have been Great to have taken part of.

Reviews.Title: “May or may not go back, undecided”
Reviews.Author: fwilde
Reviews.Content: The room itself was good, the location is on the strip. I thought that was going to be good, however, lots of sirens ambulances, police almost every night in Vegas. I stayed here for 5 nights. One day I was gone the whole day, came back at 5pm and the room still was not cleaned, that was disappointing. I was going to go to the hotel gym and entered and left quickly when they told me there was a 5 dollar charge. That is ridiculous!!!! I have prepaid for 5 nights and you want to charge me to use your gym, give me a break. Lots of hotels in Vegas that want your money, do not charge for the gym.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this facility!”
Reviews.Author: misalinedmosaic
Reviews.Content: The units are miniscule. It was suppose to sleep 4; however the Murphy bed in "living room" cannot be pulled down unless you move the furniture to where????. Although close to the strip, it is not a good area. We were told by the exterior security guards not to walk there alone. There was a murder (next door at McDonald's) the first day we were there. The pool is on the roof. No food or beverages allowed. No shade and not large enough for the number of people using it. We checked out the first day of our 6 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfrect location!”
Reviews.Author: terrapin21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Polo Towers during the first week of June 2011. It was more than we could have imagined! We arrived early, around 10am and upon checking in the friendly desk staff took our luggage so tha we could drive sround Vegas and have some lunch without haveing to pull up to the front door again and unload our items. They kept them for us and when returned our room was ready and the luggage was delievered to our room promptly. There is free parking (self and valet) both outside and in the underground garage. Very easy accessibility. Our room was a one bedroom suite and it was beautiful! The room was so clean and spacious and we could see the stip from our window. Even though this is a Diamond Resorts property there was absolutley no pressure to attend anything or to meet with anyone about timeshares. We were even pleasantly surprised when we saw our message light blinking on our room phone nad it was a message from the front desk consierge for a coupon for two donuts and coffee for myself and my husband! The pool is on the rooftop and it is just right. There are two great grills for those who want to use it (they were in use each time we were there and the smells were so yummy!) and plenty of lounge chairs and towels as well as cabanas! You can bring anything to eat and drink in the pool area which made it so reasonable (no glass) and fun to lounge all day and drink and snack at our leaisure. There is no free wi-fi but you can use the computers in the business cneter for free, including free printing. We didn't use the spa as we felt relaxed with the pool and jacuzzi on the rooftop. The kitchen has everything you could need and all you have to do is pick up food and bevergare as you need it. There is a tix for tonight located just around the block from the hotel which was so easy and inexpensive! The front desk staff are so helpful and knowledagble! The location of this hotel is practically right on the strip. We had a renatl car, but were able to walk the strip just as well. We never felt unsafe or far from lots of people watching. I was unsure about vacatioping in Vegas, but this made me a believer! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: CurlyLagunaHills_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, right across from City Center and easy walking to most spots on the strip. We were in a 1-bedroom unit; it was nice to have full kitchen and space to relax in separate living room.

Reviews.Title: “JUST ALRIGHT.....”
Reviews.Author: EMJ69
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel/condo rental on the south side of the strip. The place is located behind the Hawaiian Marketplace and in between the MGM and Planet Hollywood. Hotel entrance can be deceiving since there was no markings of any type directing toward the hotel. The room were decent size for 1 bedroom with small kitchen and living room. The bed however was soft and very comfortable to sleep in. Parking is offered as self-park or complimentary valet. Be aware: Self-Parking underground is very limited but the hotel also offers ample parking space behind the property (the only drawback with this is your car is left outside uncovered under the sun in 100+ degrees temperature - your car is basically an oven when you get in).The valet parking has a separate underground structure but waiting for your car can be a nuisance since the hotel has limited valet attendants. The main pool is located on the rooftop...it is small but had a nice vibe. The kiddie pool or kids waterpark is located on the groundfall behind the hotel....it was very small but my two year old kid loved it. The hotel staff were ok and nice. I did not encounter any problems with them except when I checked in and found out all strip view rooms were already booked. With that in mind, the only downfall I encountered with the hotel is that I booked and paid for a strip view room however when my family and I checked in I was told all strip view room were taken but I will be compensated to a higher floor with a view behind the hotel. Tired and grumpy from my long drive, I accepted and the hotel never answered any other type of compensation for overbooking the room that I paid for. I booked the room through the hotel website Diamond Resort. Overall, my family was very satisfied with the stay at the hotel which is more critical than anything else but falsely indicating availability of the rooms ruins it rating, therefore I can only give the hotel 3stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Fine but I Probably Will Not Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: MadisonJ2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine. Marble entry, complementary valet and self parking, the typical time share hotel. The first encounter with front desk staff was not pleasant; he was very rude, so I changed lines and spoke with another front desk representative. This hotel have strict rules for their rooms, so I didn't feel like this was a home away from home type of stay. Also, they will charge a $250 security deposit on the rooms, so it does not matter if you go through Hotwire or Priceline for a discount rate for the room itself. You will still have a lien on your credit card for $250 several days after your stay. Check in is 4 pm and check out is 10 am, which is earlier/later than most of the surrounding hotels. A word of advice: For check out at 10 am, be sure to give yourself at least 20 mins to get to the lobby. The elevators become packed with people trying to check out after 9:30 am. This property would not be my first choice for a stay in Las Vegas. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: claretbarry
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a one week holiday in Vegas and we stayed at Polo Towers. All we can say is "thank god we stayed there and not at one of the themed hotels". As "Vegas virgins", we were not 100% sure what to expect. Vegas is busy, busy, busy and not a place for the fainthearted. Whilst Polo Towers is not as big and glamorous as most of the other hotels, it is a sanctuary from the noise and overbearing atmosphere in most of the larger hotels. Polo Towers is set back one block from the strip and easy to find. The check-in was fast, efficient and courteous. The suite, was large, clean and comfortable. One of Polo Towers best features - is the roof top pool. Whilst the pool is small, the furniture and general layout is excellent. Free towels and modern sunbeds. An ideal way to start and/or finish a busy day. No slot machines, no casino - just a nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare location”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite with full kitchen and living room and dining area with our friends. We had a great view of the strip and City Center. The master bedroom is large but the guest bedroom is quite small with a Murphy bed which is comfortable. The rooftop pool is small and there is a hottub, lounges, tables and grills. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom to Top a Hit”
Reviews.Author: CQtopgun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Polo Towers ( again ) with friends that own there and again this places is a hit with us. Very clean & quiet with great service.Located just off the strip , walking distance to plenty of places. Bottom - I never spoke with a concierge that was more helpful than Michael , he hooked us up with shows, tours & meals at super savings, To Top - Pool on the roof , spent most of our mornings up there , never crowded , plenty of chairs & towels , and everywhere in between - rooms were Great coffee maker , dishes & silverware , morning paper , micro , fridge , toaster , big screens. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Our Special Place!”
Reviews.Author: KatieDid6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Polo Towers in Las Vegas almost every year - we absolutely love it there! It is the perfect location in Las Vegas, sitting directly on the strip (behind the Hawaiian Marketplace), between Planet Holleywood and MGM, and across from the new City Center. Everything you need or want is within walking distance! Take a cab or the shuttle from the airport...either are fine! From restaurants to McDonalds to CVS and Walgreens, the Half Price Ticket kiosk, and the bus stop... all right outside your door! And you don't have to worry about Casino crowds because Polo is not a Casino hotel. Stay at Polo Towers if you want a great Strip view room - and ask for a higher floor so as not to be obstructed by the Marketplace...the MarketPlace also tends to be very noisy...especially the entertainment and the Kareoke - it echoes! Polo Villas are a little less noisy, but again, ask for a higher floor - ask for strip view, side strip view is great too, or the canyon view is ok also. I can't say that we have ever had a "bad" room, and we always do 8th floor or higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: PRGirl22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polo Towers after trading our timeshare in New York. The location cannot be beat- it's directly across the street from the Monte Carlo & Aria, and everything is within walking distance. Our one bedroom suite was beautiful, and spacious, with a jacuzzi tub and the world's smallest balcony (I think it was smaller than the rest because we had a corner suite). The bedding really Is amazing, and the kitchen was well-equipped, though we did not cook at all. I don't know what the house keeping deal was, but they didn't come at all, except the fifth day. We stalked them down twice for toilet paper and garbage bags. I would have liked to see them more! =) The pool is small, by Vegas standards, but very nice and we had no problem getting chairs and even space under the cabana. There's no glass allowed up there, so I recommend bringing plastic cups! I will note, after touring the studio apartment, I can understand the other reviews that complain about their size. They were tiny, and I would have been miserable/angry if we'd been put in one of those for trading our two bedroom time share in NY. One way around the studio is to call ahead and agree to sit through the timeshare presentation. Now, I knew going in that there was no way I was going to buy a timeshare, which made the presentation much easier, but I will say they definitely push you to buy. But, by sitting for an hour and repeatedly saying "no," I got the 1 bedroom suite upgrade, as well as a -day, 2-night trip to any one of their six resorts. Not having a casino in the hotel was great, but I would have liked a restaurant (though the on-site convenience store was great and not terribly overpriced). I was NOT impressed with the Hawaiian market restaurants in front of the hotel, but it was a quick walk anywhere else. My only other complaint is the exorbitant price they charged for wifi. Wifi is in McDonalds now, it should be free in all good hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Theivyleaguer
Reviews.Content: Traded into Polo Towers to entertain family with small kids from Iceland...we booked two one bedroom suites...asked for them to be next door, but settled for same floor (15th)...the suites were very nice, and our guests had a wonderful view of the strip (we looked at the airport, but we have been to vegas many times, so it was no big deal). The units had very comfortable beds, nice furniture, and good kitchens...customer service was great...small convenience store on site was well appointed, albiet expensive...pool was very nice, although there is no pool bar or drink service. All in all, this is an outstanding property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for college grads! Awesome and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Ccohsev
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us girls, all recently college grads and wanting a vacation. After reading the reviews I was a little skeptical but I went for the hotel because of the price and the fact there was a full kitchen. We were so pleased when we got there, literally jumping up and down with our view from the 8th floor in the front tower. I don't know why people say it is a walk at all to the stip, it is literally a 1 minute walk down a small side, and if you don't want to go down the 'alley' you can walk down the side roadway which is more open. We would walk with 2 of us at a time and had no problems. We had 5 girls in our 1 bedroom hotel, and we got a cot. Since we were not in our room much at all it was a perfect size. We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon and caught the hotel's shuttle to Albertsons (grocery store) on Wednesday morning. We spent $200 and had plenty of food for the week we were there. This saved us so much money in the end, as we went out a few times to get some restaurant made food and cost us $15-$20 a person each time. The staff was awesome, whenever we needed anything we called and it would be up to our room in 45 minutes. We asked for extra hangers, towels every other day, dish washer soap and some other things. The staff was very helpful answering questions about where to go and things to do. The only negative things I would say would be the pool size. On the nice days you have to be up at the pool by 10AM at the latest to be able to get chairs because there are a very limited amount. The only other thing is that in the business center, they need to monitor the people on the computers-when we needed to print our boarding passes, there were women(yes, women probably 35 years old) sitting on facebook for about 20 minutes before getting off. All in all, I would definetly stay here again, basically on the strip, rooms are nice and the kitchen was SO helpful we probably saved $200 a person because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected luxury at an affordable price - would return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: naomi83
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom villa which we were really happy with, especially for the price and location over a weekend. It worked out to be about $90 a night after tax etc. Our apartment had a fully equipped kitchen with all the mod cons such as a blender, toaster and a coffee maker, a large oven, microwave, full size fridge-freezer complete with ice maker and a large dishwasher. As well as a complete crockery set and all the required cooking implements, there were other little things included like dishwashing liquid/powder and tea and coffee which meant you didn’t have to buy these things making life easier! It also had a dining area, a small living area with a sofa, large flat screen cable TV, CD player and DVD/VCR. There was a separate bedroom which had an extremely comfortable queen sized bed, flat screen cable TV and DVD player and a large wardrobe with a safe and iron/ironing board inside. The bathroom was very spacious with a large double jacuzzi bath and parallel sink areas. The whole apartment had a luxury feel which we weren’t expecting for the price we paid. We also found the communal facilities to be very convenient – for example there was free underground secure parking, a free laundry room (small charge for soap powder) and free internet access in the business suite with printing facilities which was great for sorting out our onward travel plans. The rooftop pool was also a surprise as it had a great view over the neighboring hotels and casinos. The only negative I can think of is that that we did not have a good view from our balcony but the room was so good we didn’t bother to ask to move which may have been possible. Other people may also miss having a casino attached to the hotel but for us MGM, New York, New York and Aria were so close that we did not actually feel as though we were missing out. I would not hesitate to stay here again especially as the room compared very favorably with our suite at The Venetian which we went onto to stay at after Polo Towers.

Reviews.Title: “A great location on the strip with beautiful rooms and pool area.”
Reviews.Author: ocean14_11
Reviews.Content: The villa rooms were tastefully decorated with a lovely jacuzzi in the master bath. We ordered groceries from vons which was an excellent way to save money on food and drinks! The pool area was very nice! There is a grill up there as well. Get there by 9 a.m. for a cabana with lounge chairs/table. The strip was a block away and this hotel is right across from Aria. The only negatives were it was sometimes difficult to get a cab without waiting 20-30 minutes. The balcony also had no furniture to sit on.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers experience was restful and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: cmalja
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one bedroom suite with no complaints. The staff were helpful and knowledgable. We would not advise the studio accomodations, as they appear to be small and cramped for space. The Polo Towers is situated on the Strip and allows for taking in the sights of Vegas. The pool area however, is very nice but extremely small and when we arrived at 11:00 am, there was no seating available, as people had moved chairs from tables to around the pool area or into cabanas, leaving tables with no chairs or seating. We did attend the timeshare sale and tour, we were not pressured to purchase more points although they did try. We are already Diamond members and happy with our status. We would like to suggest to Management that free internet service be provided to Diamond members as it is at Hilton Vacations Resorts. The Vegas experience was enjoyable and enabled us to see the sights, as this was our first time in Vegas. We hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: ttwinn29
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Villas at Polo Towers during a four night stay during mothers day weekend. I exchanged a week through Interval International. The resort is located right behind the Hawaiian market, and is a 3 minute walk to the strip. Yes, i stayed in the villas which seems to be better than the suites. I did go on the timeshare presentation and saw a model suite, it wasn't bad. Not sure what all the complains on the suites are about. We didn't buy a timeshare but our presenter, Kalib, i think is his name was very nice. He definately put on a good sales presentation and tried for the sale, but wasn't pushy so the presentation overall was pleasant. And we got free show tickets and a restaurant voucher!!! We had a 1 bedroom villa, 1 bath and a pullout sofa. All were comfortable. I thought the furniture was sort of IKEA type like, but nothing wrong with that. Everything was nice and clean. Daily maid service which was great. The free business center is very convenient and the staff was great in responding to our needs and making suggestions for things to do in Vegas. Overall this was a great, and relaxing trop, the weather was good, though a bit windy and we met some nice people. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get Rid of the Murphy Bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: CowCatZ
Reviews.Content: The location is great and didn't mind that it was off the strip. We weren't too crazy how small the room was but it was doable and nicely decorated. The murphy bed was a pain to deal with we had to move the couch to get to our bed. If we didn't we wouldn't have any room to walk around. There was a small coffee table that we moved onto the balcony and threw some pillows on top of it for outdoor furniture. We did have an amazing view of the MGM, NYNY & Exalibur, which we enjoyed ....especially at night. The studio rooms do have a mini-fridge which was nice as we stocked it drinks. If you do get the studio, make sure you ask for blankets!! The first night, we went out partying and came back to our room, we had to sleep with one flimsy sheet and a very scratchy blanket. But the pillows were comfy. The strip isn't too far of a walk and kinda fun to walk thru the Hawaiian shops to get to the strip. If you need soda or water as you walk the strip, get it at one of the Gift Shops at the Hawaiian shops; 2 bottled waters will cost you $1 and they have great tacky gifts to buy friends/family. I did use the pool and was pleasantly surprised how nice it was and enjoyed the rooftop view(s). Check-in was easy and was given the option to schedule a Time Share presentation. We did not as we were not intersted and they never bothered us about it. The Concierge did help us find tickets to the Blue Man Group, she was very nice and helpful. I did ask for an option to upgrade our room, they wanted $30 extra a night or if we wanted they would upgrade if we went to their Time Share presentation.We did have an issue with a light in our room and the maintenance staff was right on it. He was very quick to get the issue resolved. All in all, decent place, close to strip and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls and NO customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: To say this place was okay would be giving it way too much credit. This was the third time staying in this hotel due to always receiving great service and it not having a casino so it is quiter. This time around was completely different. Every night I heard a screaming child and party music. The child was from a neighboring room and the music was coming though the bathroom ventilation. So sleep was limited to when everyone around us was quiet. We also had the unfortunate situation of lost luggage arriving around 3am. When we called the front desk in the morning to have them bring up the bag they said they were too busy to locate it, then said it wasn't there, then told us we had better come down to get it if we wanted it. So, after wearing the same thing for 2 days and having no toiletries I am being told that I need to search through a room full of bags because they can't locate the one bag without a storage tag from the bell boy checking it in. There was also the situation of none of the outlets working when we arrived, so no tv, music, clock, coffee, etc. The final straw was when we asked for extra towels to shower with and received hand towels 3 hours later.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities but annoying timeshare sales agents”
Reviews.Author: mummy0310
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers was well equipped and a great location. One washing machine and dryer had to be shared over 2 floors but was free to use. The worst part was the annoying sales agents / conceirge. We advised that we were not interested in purchasing timeshare but persisted everyday with phone call and gimmicks to get us to go (eg. come to reception and get a welcome pack) Next day, come to reception and see if your a lucky winner. The phone would ring every morning waking us up. We eventually unplugged the phone and avoided reception. FRUSTRATING

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Eavabug
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Polo Towers and we've decided that we'll never stay anywhere else. What we love about this hotel is the fact that you get a full kitchen, living room and connecting bedroom. For those of us who travel to Vegas regularly this comes in very handy. I have seen some unsatisfied reviews about this hotel and now that I've stayed in both their one bedroom and two bedroom suites I can see why. Their two bedroom suit is actually the one bedroom connected to the studio apartment. The studio apartment is a murphy's bed which was extremely uncomfortable. If your planning on staying here pay the extra money and make sure its at least a one bedroom suite. Otherwise we had a very pleasant stay. If you get a chance and will be in Vegas for a few days rent a car and check out Hoover Dam, Zion National Park, Red Rock Canyon, Snow Canyon State Park and the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a cheap price!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah4585
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Polo Towers for 2 weeks in the last week of August 2010/First week of September 2010. The hotel is situated opposite the newly built Aria/city centre so is in a great central location and about a 1 minute walk from the main strip. There is a Mcdonald's, Walgreens and Denny's just outside the hotel as well. The hotel is very basic as in it doesn't have its own restaurant or casino as it is a time share property and the rooms are mainly self contained. The room we stayed in was a 1 bedroom studio, the bed comes out of the wall and if you don't want it down all the time it can go back up and becomes a sofa. We had a mini fridge, coffee maker, mircrowave, LCD TV, hairdryer safe etc in the room. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were cleaned regularly, however we found that if you don't tip the staff they won't make your bed! There is a shop that you can buy pretty much anything from downstairs and an interent room. There is also a small pool on the roof however we didn't use it though as it was quite crowded when we went up there. We hired a car when we stayed here to go and visit the Grand Canyon and the Hoover Dam, there is free car parking at the hotel, however, it can be quite crowded. The only downside we found was that you were constantly bugged to take out a timeshare, we had new messages on the telephone answer machine every day and we didn't find the reception staff very useful in giving advice on transportation/bus routes, they will just get you a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Studio is terrible...”
Reviews.Author: hawaianchica
Reviews.Content: i stayed here -- 1bd suite last year and really loved it. so i decided to come back this year but this time i wanted to try Studio room, just to see how it is like. There was only about $10 difference between Studio & 1bd Suite and after all my experience, i learned that it's worth paying an extra $10 to stay 1bd Suite. the Studio has a Murphy bed(pull-out bed) and you need to physically move a couch and coffee table to use it. THEN there is NO room for them if you pull a bed out. so i needed to put the couch against a balcony slide window and coffee table in a closet. PLUS there was NO blanket in the room just a piece of thin sheet. The Room is clean and had small kitchen which are nice Plus the internet is reasonable -- $8 for 24hrs /$15 for 3days. other vegas hotels normally charge the interent $15 for 24hrs. One disappointment i had with my stay this time was first staff who helped me checking in. Her name is Sandra and she finally called me after waiting in a long line but as soon as i walked toward her, she started helping out someone else without mentioning/explaining/apologizing to me. Her manager came/cut in my turn and asked Sandra to help his customer. IF she kindly told me that, then i didn't feel bad. I tried to be a patient without saying anything. but after waiting in a long line and now took her another 10min or so to help other customers, she was STILL ignoring me and helping other customer. and i started seeing other customers behind me started getting their keys. Here is the worst part of her rudeness... when she finished helping the customer, she didn't even say "Hi", "Sorry for the wait" or anything.. she just asked me my last name without eye contact. i was really upset about her rudeness! she didn't even say any greeting words like "Thank you" or "enjoy your stay" as well as no eye contact. NO smile or anything! I went to my room and it was smelled like a cigarette though it was supposed to be a NON-smoking room. I requested to change my room but they tried to push me to use a spray to deal with it. They even said they were over booked and no room available. i needed to explain to them i was sensitive about the cigarette smell in order to get a new room. I don't smoke and I am really sensitive with the smell and i hate it. In addition, their walls are paper thin.. so you hear noises from your neighbor. my next neighbor with the first cigarette smelled room was pretty loud when i walked in. so i was glad i moved to a different one. Overall... I still like this hotel because it's in the middle of strip and reasonable rate. They keep their hotel really clean and other staffs besides this Sandra lady were very nice. So, i think i will still come back to this hotel in the future but next time better to get 1bd suite.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1970
Reviews.Content: Paid for hotel on travelocity. Got there they wanted 250 on a credit card for incedentals. Nuts. Then get to my roomn and it is a pull down bed!!! I didn't sleep all week! Make sure you do not book this room! Room Service food was terrible also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: jfong52414
Reviews.Content: The room was clean with a view of the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile and partial view of the Paris Hotel. As opposed to a normal 2 bedroom condo, this was a 1 bedroom/bath with a sofa bed in the living room, plus a lockoff studio next door. I do not consider this a 2 bedroom unit. Fairly quiet except when the garbage trucks came in the early morning hours. A short walk to Las Vegas Blvd, very close to New York, New York, the Excalibur, and the Bellagio. Wifi was available for a fee, though there is a complimentary business center with printer. Be aware of constant harassment to take a tour of the facility(timeshare sales).

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers Villas”
Reviews.Author: pugSTLouis
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into Polo Towers In March of 2011. Took our daughter and son-in-law with us. When we checked in we were getting a 1 bedroom unit with a sofa bed but managed to get a second 1 bedroom unit if we listened to their sales pitch, which we did. After we told them we would not buy into their timeshare the towel service in both units stopped unless we called the front desk. We were to receive a deep cleaning after 5 days, this did not happen, we called the front desk again and were told they would do it at 9:45 PM. We told the no thanks. It was done on the 6th day of our stay, we were leaving the next day, big deal. We felt we were targeted because we would not buy into their time share. My advise is if you go to their presentation make it as late as you can in your stay

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this timeshare..”
Reviews.Author: Sioned1
Reviews.Content: This is my parents timeshare that we used for the first time. I read previous reviews and basically they were a mixed bag. There is nothing we could say that would be detrimental to this property. Everyone to the front desk at check-in to the housekeeping were right on it from the first day to the last day. Let's face it people..this is not the Bellagio nor Ceasears Palace nor should it be! It does not even have a casino or a bar which my husband at first balked at. The location is in the midst of everything just a quick walk away. You have Monte Carlo across the street and MGM on one side and Planet Hollywood on the other. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, 18206 & 18206A and had fantastic views. The kitchen was excellent for those who want to cook in. Complete kitchen with Cuisinart cookware and appliances. The security had to come open the adjoining door that connects the studio/bedroom to the main common area (see pics). Security were wonderful and prompt. They also pay attention to things like when my husband and I returned to the rooms at 4am or so they noticed our door was not completely shut and alerted the front desk to call us and have us come to the door to make sure everything was all good. We didnt realize that we thought we slammed it shut upon arrival but it wasnt tight and was slightly ajar while we slept!! It was a very good feeling to know we had that kind of lookout. We were not at all harrassed with timeshare nonsense. We were offered to do the owners tour for the hour and half and recieve free tickets for $48 for the 4 of us to the shows of our choice as well as get 3 days and 2 nights in any timeshare with diamond resorts. The strip was fun and beautiful especially at night but old vegas, Fremont St is great! More down to earth, food is great and way cheaper than the strip. Went to Fitzgeralds for a great breakfast egg specials $1.99/ steak and eggs $8.99. Mermaids Casino has fried oreos and twinkies and fun staff and customers. Outside Polo Towers is the Hawaiian Market which has a restaurant , vendor stalls, gift shops and daily entertainment in the square. So, looking forward to our next trip back there in the future..have fun people

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: b2auguste
Reviews.Content: This was a finishing college/ last hurray trip for me and my friends. This was such a great stay. We got a two bedroom suite which was able to fit our large group. The people at the front desk were soo helpful and even suggest which clubs were the best in the area. The hotel was right on the strip in the middle of everything and close to the shuttle stop. Since the room had a kitchen, we were able to save money by making our own breakfast. I will definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wouln't stay again”
Reviews.Author: susmea
Reviews.Content: Although close to the strip, it has no restaurant in the hotel itself . The rooms were definitely not the 5star we were supposed to be trading our time for

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Non-Casino Hotel Located on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KorenMichelle23
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at Polo Towers. It is a timeshare property that rents out unused rooms; however, we weren't ever approached or bothered (it may have had something to do with our early morning check in). Our friends that also stayed on the same days were approached and did attend the presentation, but they received a free 3 day 2 night stay, a Visa Gift card, and actually wound up purchasing a package. First and foremost, the hotel is located behind the Hawaiian Marketplace on the strip. It is within walking distance to other hotels; we watched a boxing match at the MGM and walked over in about 5-10 minutes. We got a suite in the newly renovated tower and the rooms were amazing! Our suite was huge! It included a living room with comfy furniture and a flat screen TV, a dining room with a view of the strip, a full kitchen with all appliances and dishes (which is great if you want to eat in or enjoy some drinks - they even had stemware), and amazingly huge and immaculate bathroom with double vanities and a whirlpool garden tub which was AMAZING, relaxing and CLEAN. The bed was large and comfortable and there was also a flat screen television in the room. There was a ton of storage to keep items put away and the room looking uncluttered. There was also a murphy bed in the living room so technically around 4 people could have comfortable stayed in the room. The housekeeping service was GREAT. Another plus was there was a business center where you can print free of charge and we used it to print out boxing match ticketsThere is also a roof top hotel at this hotel that is extremely relaxing with cabanas, chairs, towels, and a jacuzzi. The only draw back was the annoying party people that seemed to flooding the area. This hotel definitely does not have the pool party vibe - it is filled with families with kids who promptly started to leave when the rude people were getting raucous and annoying. To the hotel's credit, a security person came up and spoke to them and told them they could not drink in the pool area, but I feel as though they should have been ejected. Other than that small issue, there was a lot of outside noise from the strip on Saturday night that made it a little difficult to sleep (this location is across the street from Diablo's Cantina). . There was also a weird smell in the lobby as other reviewers have mentioned. All in all, these small issues were really trivial and we will be back! Fantastic stay! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas Location”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen2009
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this TimeSharing Resort as part of an exchange from Interval International. We had reserved a 2 bedroom apartment. However, to our surprise, it was really a one bedroom and an adjoining studio (that they consider a 2 bedroom). Upon checking in, we told that if we weren't going to use the studio, we should return the keys so that they could rent it out. That sounded strange to us, as we were looking forward to having lots of space for the 4 of us. The amenities were of above average (kitchen) and also in the bathrooms and bedrooms. From the time of check-in to the time of check-out, you have to look out for the sales personnel there trying to sell you Timesharing. Even though you indicate that you are not interested, they continue offering you discounts for tickets, etc, over and over again (its annoying). Internet service is $7.95 per day in the suites. However, the guests can use the business center (for free) to check emails, airline information, etc and can print whatever information needed for FREE. The hotel is located very close to the strip (1/2 block in) and one can walk to many casinos from there. It is tricky to get into the hotel. From the airport,(on the right hand side), keep an eye for the McDonalds and then a public parking lot. Immediately after passing the parking lot, make a right turn (it does not seem as an actual street, however, it is the entrance to the hotel, which is on Las Vegas Boulevard South).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to return to and relax”
Reviews.Author: PALMR
Reviews.Content: First time at Polo Towers after recommendation from a friend. Go to Vegas year on year to attend the Shot Show. Stayed at many of the 'strip' hotels and would rate the Polo Towers amongst the best, more homely than glitzy. Convenient for all the action and shops and a great place to return to for peace and quiet after busy days at the convention and pounding the pavements! Good location and close to many of the attractions including the new City Centre area. We took our laptop but didn't use it as there and free computers in the business centre which was great. Front desk staff were really helpful and fun. The mini market on the ground floor may have a captive audience but the prices were very reasonable and a lot cheaper than some of the other stores just round the corner that just 'looked cheap'. The staff in the mini market were just brilliant and couldn't do enough to help - management take note they need some recognition! Studio apartment was clean, spacious and comfy although we could have done with a kettle. Just great for relaxing and even the view of the car park was sometimes entertaining. The courtesy buses were an added bonus and were class vehicles but book early as some trips fill up quickly. The only downside was that this is timeshare accommodation and we did encounter some 'selling' but we managed to dodge any meetings and not upset anyone in the process -come on folks we were only there a week on business and pleasure and there's too much to cram in already. Great stay would definitley return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: mwill210
Reviews.Content: First impression - the perfume smell in the lobby was horrible - it smelled like a product used to cover the smell of smoke. The timeshare presentation push was not bad, about 2-3 minutes, we declined. The one bedroom on the fifteenth floor was a great size with nice furnishings and a full kitchen. One negative was the expensive and extremely extremely slow internet. If you plan on doing any business online (as we were doing) you might want to allot 30-40% more time because of this.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: tcfJEN
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried going in since this wasn't a big name hotel, but we exchanged through our timeshare for a week vacation here. It was a nice hotel and the staff was very freindly and helpful. We stayed in the "suites" instead of the "villas"- only difference is the villas have already been renovated with newer furnishings & fancier details. My list of negatives is longer than my positives, but really I would stay here again! The + outweigh the - by far! Here were the negatives: - we were told ahead of time that the roof top pool was open, then arrived to find it was actually closed for a few weeks for maintenance. We could go next door to the Marriot's pool, which we checked out but didn't feel comfortable being the only ones taking a dip while 30 people were hanging out at the bar. -the lobby and hallway areas had a really strong perfume smell. i guess it could have been worse, but it was still a little too strong for my taste. - I was very disapointed to not see a recycling program in place.
