I asked an employee if they recycle at the hotel and they offered to take care of my water bottle, i'm pretty sure they just threw it in the trash. - it seemed like we did a lot of walking in the middle of roads and alleys since the hotel is off the strip and there weren't a lot of sidewalks leading out to the main drag -the garbage trucks came at 6:30 am to empty the 4 dumpsters located right beneath our windows- good thing we're early risers anyway! -the studio has a wall bed or "murphy bed", guess i missed that little detail -the washerd/dryers didn't seem to be working properly, if you plan to do laundry maybe find a laundry mat instead. The washer kept rinsing over & over and the dryer took forever to dry a load of clothes. The good points: - an AWESOME location! Because its off the strip the noise was low enough that we slept with the balcony door open almost every night! Super close to food & entertainment -plenty of room in the 1 bedroom and attached studio for my husband and our travel companions -eventhough the suites have not been renovated yet, the place was super clean and in very good condition. I didn't notice any wear on the carpet or the furnishings Would definately stay here again if & when we go back to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: brownbeer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PT for five nights through Interval Intl timeshare. I ended up in a studio (those designated with the letter A after the room number), 16206A, which faced south down the strip. The room was small and the bed was a double size Murphy bed. When folded out, the room was very small. Nevertheless, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was large enough with great water pressure, and closet and drawer space was fine. It lacked a larger trash bin, and since I had take out most nights, the garbage kind of piled up quickly. The room also had a small balcony, although access was restricted due to the sofa which needed to be moved in order to pull the bed down. On the positive side, the staff was great. They were very responsive to a couple of issues I had during the stay, and the fact that the Polo Towers is 200yds off the strip gave it a secluded feeling. The location can't be beat, between the MGM and Planet Hollywood, and across from the Mandarin, almost everything is within walking distance. On the negative side, the shared door to the room next to me, Rm#16206, was paper thin. You could hear every conversation, every rattle of dishes, and every flush of the toilet. I would expect a better noise barrier. It was also difficult to keep the balcony door open due to the fact that the floor below was a smoking floor, and the group below me smoked on their balcony. The smoke rose, and came wafting into my room. Finally, you had to pay for internet, $8 per day, $13 for 3 days, or $30 for the week. I was in Vegas for a trade show at the Mandalay Bay but they did not run a shuttle to the PoloTowers. Instead, I had to get off at the Planet Hollywood Casino and walk about 5-10 minutes to get to the Polo Towers. It's not a big deal unless you have luggage. Finally, there's lots of fast food in the area. McDonalds, Dennys, Wendys, and Del Taco are within minutes of the hotel. Also there is a very reasonably priced Philippine restaurant in the Hawaiian Market. Really good and very reasonably priced. We also hit BLT Burger at the Mirage and CraftSteak at the MGM. Both great, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastgirl1976
Reviews.Content: We belong to Diamond Resorts so this is one of our timeshares. Previously we have never used these facilities but after this weekend I will any time we go to vegas! We had a beautiful one bedroom strip view on the 11th floor. It was immaculately clean, non smoking as promised and the high floor we requested. You do have to avoid the timeshare presentations if you are not interested in them but as owners we benefit from listening with a free show, dinner and bonus time at another timeshare. All you have to do is say no if not interested. Not sure about the other reviews of noisy hallways and rude front desk people, but we experienced none of these. The hotel was very quiet, there were no children being loud and the front desk was friendly and helpful. We recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet getaway in Vegas without the smoke filled casinos, but still want to be "on" the strip close to great places to eat, gamble, and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers is an oasis of calm in the middle of everything that's Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Transplant75
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our one bedroom unit. The staff was friendly and helpful and the accomodations were very clean. I loved the security of having to use the room key to operate the elevator and the free parking was also a plus. Polo Towers has no casino or gambling but you are located in the middle of the strip. If you want somewhere to deposit your money, you simply walk out and find which casino you wish to use. We fould it very relaxing after fighting the crowded casinos and streets to come back to a quiet atmosphere. We did sit through a timeshare presentation but it wasn't too pressured or time consuming and they don't force you to go. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but just ok service”
Reviews.Author: Alohabuzzz
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers is located in a great part of the strip. Lots of action just out the doors from the hotel. Yes you see the guys handing out strip club cards but they are everywhere in Vegas, You can't get away from them. The room was nice but the service was just ok. All they cared about at the Polo Towers is getting you to the Timeshare Sales Session. They won't let you leave check-in until you listen to them ask again and again for you to go. They even tried to re-schedule my plans. Stay strong and tell them to pound sand. No means... NO! Everytime I went to the concierge desk, they asked about the sales session. It was a bit ridiculous. If you have a car, the valet is great. They get the car out in only a few minutes, unlike the casinos. I would stay again, but be warned about the sales pitch!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the early checkout, but loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: nicolemkelley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Polo Towers in Oct 2010 with my friends for her birthday weekend. It was great! Loved the one bedroom suite we had, ice machines were far floors apart, whiched sucked. Non of the housekeeping staff spoke English, so I had to just take what we needed off the cart. Hated the early checkout ( 10am) sucked because if you party hard on Saturday night, you are just getting in at 6am. Other than that loved this place and I got a great deal a night, but if you have a lae flight do not stay here, unless you have things to do after you check out. Oh yea, the cabs do not come to this hotel as fast as the other hotels I stayed at on the strip..but staff was nice! Oh and not having a Casino in the hotel was good, I hate that noise, but a place to eat in the resort would have been nice! The free internet use in the lobby was nice, with free printing!

Reviews.Title: “room spotless, good location”
Reviews.Author: LeoR024
Reviews.Content: Room had great decor and was immaculately clean. King bed had great mattress, sheets and pillows. Kitchenette was great to have and all appliances clean and in working order. Our room was on 2nd floor, one bedroom suite advertised for 4 people and view was only of a wall. Room great for 2 people but could be a little too cozy with four. The murphy bed takes up the whole living room and privacy is not what it is in bedroom. Loved bathroom, spa tub, 2 sinks, lots of towels. Great location on strip but I agree with others that the walk at night was a bit dark and isolated. Directions given for parking were vague and very dark in lot at night. Didn't go to time share presentation. They called us to schedule for 900 am and then called to remind us theday of at 845 am. When we showed up at 900 they said without apology that the time was 930. We decided not to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: irloyal
Reviews.Content: OK, In my opinion an average timeshare is equal to most 3 or 4 star hotel accomodations. In Las Vegas, it depends on what you want. We don't gamble so a Timeshare is great. We also like to cook so a fully equiped kitchen is great for us. This place worked very well for us. THE GOOD The building is behind the Hawiian Market. It is very convenient to City Center, the MGM, NY-NY, Planet Hollywood, and the Miracle Mile. The location is great IF you get a view of the strip and are at least 8 floors or so up. We had a view of the strip from the 11th floor, so it was nice. This time share had a decent Kitchen which was good for us. We made some really nice meals and looked out to the lights of the strip as we ate. You have a nice view of the big screen at City Center that shows the Fashion show, and views of the new buildings with the multicolor lights etc. Also a nice sunset view. The rooms were advertised as 4 star, but I would call them Marginal 3 star. Nice Counters, kitchen, TV's and bed. A DVD player and IPOD capable stereo are provided, but they are cheap. THE BAD The bathroom is like a cave. VERY POOR LIGHTING, so ladies will have a hard time with make-up and they don't have ventilation so they are always steamy. There is a connecting room with a door and if the neighbors are noisy, your room will be too. The hallways are noisy, and the building is set quite a ways off of the strip, so it is a little spooky going in late at night. The building is OLD, and the bones are beginning to show their age even with the recent remodelling. THE UGLY This place is right on one of the corners where the strip clubs pay illegals to hand out those strip club cards. You are perpetually annoyed by them when you walk out on the strip. OVERALL I would stay here again if I didn't want to use a car. If you have a car (and why not, since EVERY casino does free valet parking), I'd find a place off the strip that is less exensive. The location and views at sunset (if you get a strip view) are the only things that make this a worthy location in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, however, a hefty unauthorized fee was charged to our credit card.”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom2000
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, and I stayed at Polo Towers in a 2 bedroom timeshare unit. We really enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas. However, I just received my credit card statement and there was a $175 charge for the day we checked out. We left the unit spotless. we have been timeshare owners for 30+ years, so we know how to leave a unit as clean as when we checked in. Upon inquiry and being transferred to 3 different departments, we were told by security that we had been charged a deep cleaning fee. When I asked for details, I was told that there were no details on our record. Needless to say, I am disputing the charge with the credit card company. We will never stay at Polo Towers again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPPOINTED WITH DIAMOND AND POLO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lpscalzi45
Reviews.Content: We are Diamond owners and expect a certain level of accomodations, the suites are roomy, and kitchen well equipped, however.... We stayed on the 12th floor (which allows smoking on the balconies, the hallways smell of smoke) Our first bad experience happened when the valet shoved the wrong key into our keyless ignition and our new vehicle had to be repaired by a dealership, which took a day (so no car for us and NO offer to accomodate that inconvience) The car was repaired but again only a sorry was given! The property is not the best, smells old and musty, the photos you see are enhanced to make it look better than it is. The staff were friendly so that is the one positive. When we got home our credit card was charged a fee that was not authorized. Upon calling, the security desk explained the room on the smoking floor had to be deep cleaned, we explained no smoking was done in room and that we needed further explanation, Upon calling Diamond directly we had the matter investigated and were told a different story. It is very disturbing that an organization with self set standards operates in this way. WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN (for many reasons) AND NEVER RECOMMEND TO ANYONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Only tolerated one night and forfeited the rest! Studio is extremely small.”
Reviews.Author: DeeMacRN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a timeshare exchange, only tolerated the room one night and left. Do not book the studio room. The bed is actually a full sized murphy bed that pulls down from the wall and takes up virtually the whole entire room when down. The small couch that the bed pulls down from was filthy and stained. The armrest that become part of the bed, had stains on them so I had to put hand towels over them so that I didn't sleep up against them. At 6:30 AM on Saturday morning, the trash trucks come, and even though we were up on the 11th floor, the banging sounds of the three or more dumpsters slamming around woke us up. The bathroom is also very small, single sink vanity, shower on the wall behind the bathroom door. The glass shower door had a gap along the bottom and water floods out onto the bathroom floor. I don't know how the 1 bedroom villas are, but if you do choose to stay here, be sure to use the complimentary valet parking. The underground parking structure can be crowded and confusing. The only good things I can say about the place is that the shower had decent water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for timeshare exchange, wouldn't book as hotel”
Reviews.Author: Critical1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with a friend who exchanged his timeshare for Polo towers. It was a decent stay with some good points (location, clean, full service apartment) and some not so good (indifferent staff, substandard internet, crowded with prospective timeshare owners). The office staff was rather noisy when working in the business center and the elevators are slow and congested. I wouldn't book this as a hotel but as a timeshare choice it was adequate. As previously mentioned by another reviewer, you do miss the experience of a hotel, even at a 3 star level. The staff is always friendly as they must view everyone as a potential buyer and that is where their emphasis and energy is directed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Liz154914
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night glorious stay in the Villas of Polo Towers and loved every minute of our visit. Our one bedroom suite was absolutely beautiful, clean, modern and first class in every respect. The bed was comfortable and we loved the door opening to the balcony in the bedroom as we are fresh air feigns so slept with the sliding glass door open protected by the screen door. Towels were changed every day and the bed was made daily by friendly staff. The location of the hotel was perfect - close to the strip and other hotels and shopping venues. The pool was nice and the area was quiet and comfortable. . We also enjoyed the complimentary shuttles to Fremont Street and the outlet stores. Nice touch. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bemafar
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the 19th floor with a fab view of the strip. The room was spotless - appliances in kitchen were good as new. And the bed and pillows were the most comfortable I've ever experienced. Ideally situated on the strip although I would agree with other reviewers about access to the hotel - you have to walk down a short lane from the strip and it's a little daunting at night. Having said that, we didn't see or hear of anything untoward during our ten days there. No casino in the hotel which was why we chose it and a fridge and safe supplied unlike some of the hotels on the strip who charge extra for these. It is a timeshare place so be prepared to be asked to attend the spiel but we didn't get the hassle other reviewers did when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Best time-share location in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PropertyPartner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were very pleased with the location (between MGM and Planet Hollywood. We were walking distance to several casinos and right on the strip. The one bedroom unit looked much better than the photos. The kitchen was very well equiped. The dining area and living area had comfortable furniture and there was a flat screen tv in both the living room and bedroom. The major complaint we had, as with most time shares, is the rediculous extra charge for wifi. Maybe someday they will catch up with Motel 6 and offer it free! They did have three computers with printers in their business center that are free for guests, but very slow. The time share sales pitch was intense but the rewards for sitting through it were great - good tickets to Phantom of the Opera at the Venitian. If you are using time share, this is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average place. Timeshare, not hotel.”
Reviews.Author: salstar77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Polo Towers for 7 days as an exchange for one of our Marriottt timeshares. I had read the reviews and found that a lot of the reviews were correct. First let me start with the positives. The hotel is right off the Vegas strip, near the MGM and Monte Carlo and across the strip from the new City Center Complex which has some wonderful resorts , including the new Aria Hotel, an exclusive designer shopping center and fabulous restaurants. The staff is friendly. The rooms are comfortable. The negatives are, that this is a timeshare, not a hotel. Towels are changed every day, but room is only cleaned once during your weekly stay. There are no lounges or restaurants inside the property. The pool is very plain. The worst part of the stay was the noise level from the open air center right in front of the hotel. Every day they have a band playing a few hours in the afternoon and in the evening. You could hear the noise even with your windows closed. Luckily, they stopped playing at around 11:00 p.m. or so. But played longer on the weekend. We were staying in the front side of the hotel. The view was magnificent, but the noise was not! I understand that if you stay on the back side of the hotel you hear the early morning noise of the trash collector. For Las Vegas, I believe that it is better to stay in a regular hotel. Then you really feel like you are in Vegas and you have all the amenities of a Vegas resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in great spot at great price.”
Reviews.Author: snoweeee
Reviews.Content: Clean & comfy room but staff were a bit rude & un helpfull at times. Also pool area is way to small. In general great hotel in great spot at a great price. I would stay again. It is great that there is no casino!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: aestheticvoyager76
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers is a breath of fresh air in a city were most things do not come for free. My friends were staying in the MGM Grand and their check in took about 30 - 40 mins due to massive queues, at the Polo Towers with no queue my check in 3 mins. Yes I was asked to attend the timeshare meeting and various other meetings but I declined. My studio room was great with a balcony and a coffee maker. These two things are rare in Vegas as most hotels expect you to buy a Starbucks in their lobby and balconies are pretty much unheard of. The rooftop pool/spa was amazing and with no extra costs such as the use of the cabanas (MGM Grand charged $360 per day I know because I used their pools) and free use of two impressive BBQs. You can also take your own alcohol up to the pool just not in glass bottles. Again a big difference from MGM who charged $7.00 per bottle of beer (poolside bar) and did bag checks at the entrance to make sure you weren't smuggling any alcohol in!!!! The little grocery shop was great with just enough to tide you by and the staff amazing. The Polo Towers are situated opposite a 7/11 so you can easily buy alcohol to stock up your fridge and a Walgreens close by for pain killers should you drink too much! Location was great, I walked everywhere and didn't need to catch the bus as all attractions were so close. Polo Towers didn't let me down, I am a seasoned American traveller having stayed in many a hotel/motel all over the states and can hand on heart say this placed rocked! Oh yes final mention, they have a desk for the Bell Trans bus so you can easily get back to the airport at a cost of $7.00.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid 3 star timeshare”
Reviews.Author: californiadeb
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week at Polo Towers. We did a Getaway through Interval International and stayed in the Villas, not the Suites. The property is aging but it is clean and the location is good. We were on the 9th floor and had a very nice view of the CityCenter and the Strip. We were able to check in immediately upon arrival at 3:30 p.m. and were never bothered at all about doing the timeshare presentation. We thought the staff was excellent and very friendly. We valet parked some of the time and self-parked some of the time. If you come back late in the evening, there is no one to valet for you. We did not have any problem finding a parking space ever in the underground parking. Maybe we just got lucky! The long driveway out to the Strip only takes a few minutes to walk and we felt pretty safe at night walking back and forth down it. The unit itself, a one bedroom, was fine, nothing exceptional compared to most timeshares we have stayed at but it served it's purpose. It is smaller than we are used to, especially the livingroom, but we did not spend that much time in the room. It was clean and we did get daily maid service, which is unusual for a timeshare. We only cooked some breakfasts in and ate all our other meals out. The kitchen had everything you need although we found it odd and inconvenient that there was no garbage disposal in the sink. The king sized bed was very comfortable and we slept great! We did hear the garbage trucks every morning but we were awake by then anyway so it was not a huge deal. We purchased the in-room internet from ibahn for $36 for the week and it worked fine. I needed to check in for work purposes at least once a day so it was worth it for me. Seems a little high for what it is but at least it is available. The whole resort is showing it's age but for the price we paid, we were completely satisfied. The location allowed us to walk almost everywhere, down to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, Tropicana, NYNY, Monte Carlo, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, CityCenter and others. If you are looking for luxury, this is not the place but the location is excellent. We have stayed in many of the big hotels including the Venetian but we love having a kitchen so that we can have a leisurely breakfast in our room. We would go back! Just don't go expecting a typical hotel experience because it is a timeshare, which we like.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location great value would definetly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rachaeleddie
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is located between the MGM and Planet Hollywood Hotels set back about 30 seconds walk from the Strip. We had a studio apartment with a murphy bed which was really comfortable, even though we were located next to the elevators we never heard a thing. The roof top pool was a welcome break from the craziness of the Strip and I would definetly recommend for its location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: obob
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time at the airport and followed the signs to the car rental shuttle. Drove for the first time with TomTom navigation to the Polo Towers. Watch your entrance and use the valet parking the first time. This allows you time to get unloaded and checked in. We checked into a 2 bedroom, which is really a 1 bedroom with a hideabed and a lock off studio. This was okay as there were only 2 of us, but 6 would be comfortable. We never cooked, but stocked up with daily sncks, water and fruit. Many people enjoy the pool on the roof for barbeques and relaxation. Great place for a base camp to enjoy Vagas No view from here, but Vegas is all about the strip and I am so glad to be a little off the strip. Very quiet, but so close to the center of everything. We are within walking distance to the Bellagio, Ceasars, City Center, Planet Hollywood, NewYork NewYork, the MGM Grand, and so much more. If you are comfortable with driving, rent a car and see the sights your self, including the nearby tourist stops. Free parking is available at all hotels and it saves you from blisters and absolute exaustion. Remember that a Vegas block is much much further than it looks!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: lisacd30
Reviews.Content: Customer service was lacking. Our first night was spent listening to an air conditioner that sounded like it was about to fall through the ceiling. The next morning we were told we would have to leave the room for a few hours so they could fix it. When we got back the a/c wouldn't turn on and there was a big mess on the floor. Called maintenance again , was told the front desk was supposed to move us to another room. Called them, they said they would call us back. Waited an hour, finally went downstairs and still had to wait while they located a room . Had to pack up everything, went to a different floor which was still supposed to be non smoking only to have a smoker next door. The smoke smell was constantly in our room along with the smell of whatever they cooked daily. We were facing the strip so it was very noisy and the view was the roof of the building in front . We also had a problem getting clean towels daily. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Average Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sunshine-7504
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polo Towers from 09-24-10 to 09-30-10. I don't consider myself a snob by any means. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and room. I was extremly disappointed by the customer lack of service. We checked in a Friday afternoon. We waited for approximately 40 minutes in line to check in. Once we finally reached the front desk clerk, I confirmed our reservation was for 6 days. We were told sure thing, no problem. We proceeded to our room and when we arrived, what do we find? The housekeeper still cleaning our room. We asked how long, and were told 10 minutes. Now after taking a 4 hour flight, and waiting in line for 40 minutes, the only thing I wanted to do was rest my feet and freshen up. I called the front desk from the hallway and was put on hold only to have no one come back. So we had to go back to the front desk with luggage in tow. When we arrived at the front desk, we were told that our room was ready now. We did speak to a very nice young man who issued a $25 gift certificate to convience store. Once we finally got to the room, I was impressed. The room was clean, well appointed, and had a great view of the strip. Having the kitchen was a great bonus. We were able to eat in the room, and when we did go out, if we had leftovers, we were able to take them home for later. The room was very spacious, and were cleaned regularly when requested. Unfortunately the only provide you with coffee on your intial stay, and once that supply is depleated, you have to purchase your own coffee. As others have noted the parking is quite scare in the later part of the day, but we always found a park. Our room had a great view of Center City, and a view of the Bellagio Fountains. Overall, this hotel is a good value and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “pretty average”
Reviews.Author: lucyandrob
Reviews.Content: having arrived late after a long & delayed flight we were too tired to notice the only no smoking sign located on the wall as we came out of the lift on floor 7. My wife had requested a smoking room and there were no signs indicating no smoking in the room. As im a non smoker my wife only smoked on the balcony anyway, however 2 days into the holiday we were confronted by what can only be discribed as the gestapo banging on the door ( 2 security guards) saying "we have reports you are smoking in the room!" apparently you can only smoke on floors 3,6 & 12 and on any other floors balconies are still a no go area so be warned! We had a studio and to be honest it was very basic with no proper oven, only a microwave and no kettle. If you want to cook any meals go for a 1 bed as they apparently have ovens. There were several faults in our room when we arrived. Electricity kept tripping, tv didnt work, coffee maker didnt work. Maid service is poor with our bin not emptied most days and beware if you leave the slightest thing on the bed they wont make it. We also found out purely by accident that they had only checked us in for 3 days even though expedia had booked us for 7 days. the hotel then blamed expedia and said we would have to ring them! Umm i dont think so! Fortunately we had the confirmation email for 7 days and told them to sort it out which in there own time they eventually did and gave us a new room key programmed for 7 days. Had we not found this out we wouldnt have been able to get into our room after the 3rd day. When you arrive check your days as they wont ask you! On the plus side the hotel is very well located and has a very good supermarket with the only really friendly and helpful staff we found in the entire hotel. Finally watch out when you leave for the airport because what you think is a taxi may turn out to be an expensive alternative. We got in what we thought was a taxi and found out we were sharing it with 2 other people, and then got charged 10 dollars each per person. The guy got 40 dollars out of us lot in total, no wonder he was helpful, but its a rip off as normal taxi only costs you 12 in total. Loved Vegas but can do better than rooms here as they are not the best.......

Reviews.Title: “the best for your money and convenience”
Reviews.Author: loveshakur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Polo Towers last weekend and it was by far the best experience I've had in Las Vegas. I've stayed at other hotels that were on the strip and was not impressed by the customer service or convenience. This hotel is so close to the strip you could sneeze and hit one of the guys passing out naked fliers. Located in front of the hotel is the Hawaiian maket place that has cheap souveniers and great restaurants and a kareoke bar. We barley left our vacinity because everything we needed was right there. The rooftop pool was awesome, very clean and they even offer bbq's for guest use. When we arrived we requested "strip side" and were given a gorgeous, spacious room on the 12th floor and had the most aweome view of the strip at night and during the day. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone planning on going to Las Vegas who doesn't want to waste their money at one of the big casinos. Don't worry about the time share part, they are not pushy or get offended when you say no. Go, relax, enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Savings.”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaFiore
Reviews.Content: Got a great price, but didn't realize that it didn't include any of the hotel's amenities or housekeeping services! When booking, I didn't realize that the Polo Towers is a partial time-share. There was an $8 a day charge for the exercise facility that was advertised as an amenity, which was not disclosed upon booking or check-in. The hotel was severely understaffed, had only 1 person working the front desk on a busy Thursday afternoon with a 30 minute wait to check in. Rooms advertised as a junior suite were tiny regular rooms with Murphy beds & mini-fridges. Housekeeping only made up our bed once in a four night stay & had to be called every day for fresh towels or to take out the trash. Corridors were noisy and accessing the Strip from the hotel is done via a half-deserted run down faux Hawaiian strip mall. The only nice things about the Polo Towers were the amazing view of City Center from the west facing balconies and the small roof-top pool in the evening after all the overweight time-share families have cleared out. However, the staff was not friendly, helpful or efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - in a good way”
Reviews.Author: vacate your home and travel
Reviews.Content: Never been to Vegas till this visit. I thought the location of Polo Towers was great. We were on the eighth floor facing the Strip. Some noise from the road below. Nothing that was unexpected having read in previous reviews. Room size and creature comforts were what we have had at other Diamond Resorts. Bed was sooo comfortable. Reception and Concierge were very helpful. No pressure to attend any presentation. This set the bar for our vacation as we had booked into a further 2 DRI complexes at Sedona and Orlando on our US trip.

Reviews.Title: “Villa at Polo Towers - What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: Julele
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Villas at Polo Towers in Las Vegas was nothing but positive! We selected Polo Towers on a recommendation from a friend. It is only a short walk through a parking lot to the strip, and the cost was half that of anywhere on the strip. Bargain!! The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the strip. Upon arrival, the front desk staff person was friendly and efficient. The lobby was beautful. Our room was fabulous. Though Polo Towers is just off the Strip behind Plant Hollywood, we had nice view of the Strip. Our room was clean, comfortable and well-equipped. We had a one bedroom villa with a full kitchen and large bath. There was nothing that we were missing. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom had all the amenities we needed and was kept more than fully stocked. Though we didn't use the pool, the pool area looked wonderful and inviting. It also was not crowded and had adult-only hours. The small market was well-stocked with essentials from food to toiletries. We had one issue with the guests next door to us. The hotel is nonsmoking. Halfway through our stay, guests checked in next to us. They were smoking in their room, and because the rooms had an adjoining door, their smoke filled our room. Personally, I got enough smoke in the casinos. I didn't need more in my room. I was also concerned that the hotel staff would think that we were smoking in a nonsmoking room, and I didn't want to deal with arguing a charge when we got home. I called the front desk. Security was sent up immediately, and the problem was resolved. I was very impressed with the staff and accommodations at Polo Towers. We will be back and have recommended the Villas at Polo Towers to everyone we talk to about our trip.

Reviews.Title: “'Prima Fascia'”
Reviews.Author: LisaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: had trouble starting this review, very mixed opinions. Arrived at the resort late at night, after hanging around the airport for ages, Delta airlines had lost my luggage, and did not seem bothered, in fact, it appears this happens often. On a five and a half hour flight from New York, the only refreshments were a drink (half a can of your juice of choice) and a two fingered pack of biscuits. There was food on offer (bagel type sandwich or M&M's), but you could only pay with a credit card. I found this totally unsuitable and insufficient. I would not fly with Delta Airlines again, ever. Got checked in very quickly, got to my room, 313sq ft as advertised on the website. I don't think so!!! It was an average sized room, very tired and hungry, I decided to get my bed ready, tried to get the 'murphy' bed down from the wall (foldaway), couldn't get it, tried a few times, couldn't manage it, thought I must be doing something wrong and didn't want to break it so I opted for sleeping on the couch, (the couch is the foldaway bed) okay for sitting on, not for sleeping on. Very uncomfortable night. In the morning, went in search of a kettle or boiling device for tea, only a coffee perculator, phoned and asked if they had a kettle, they obligingly sent one up, but a stove top whistling kettle, no stove to put it on, they suggested that I use the perculator for hot water, knew what the result would be but thought i would try it, as I thought tasted coffee through the water. You would think that with all the european visitors and tea drinkers, they would provide even a small travel kettle. I have one, but because they advertised a fully equipped kitchen, I didn't think I would need it. I told them about the bed, they sent a handyman up within a half an hour and he declared that it was indeed broken, he would fix it that day, which he did. (The bed, when it is down and the cushions are on the floor, there is not a lot of room, even for one person). No apology was offered by management. On a more positive note, the view from my balcony was of the Strip and surrounding mountains, very nice. The room had good air conditioning, a good sized telly and a microwave which I felt was dangerously high for anyone under 6ft, especially when you are having to boil water in there and it bubbles over as you are lifting it out. I am surprised by this actually, bearing in mind the American Culture and their love of 'suing'. Hotel is actually a timeshare complex, and there are tours of people being shown around all the time, this is not an inconvenience, it just shows the interest in the place. The pool is on the roof, (22nd floor) nice but very very small, lovely views and very clean. There is a gift shop which is very well stocked and reasonably priced, you can hire dvds in the machine at the gift shop. This resort is in a perfect location, far enough away from the strip so that you are not bothered by the noise, but close enough to walk to strip. I have been to Vegas lots of times, and stayed at different hotels, this is the nicest one. The staff were very nice, yes you get the chance to win a special prize (a timeshare talk and tour), but you don't have to do it. Flights (all booked through expedia) were excellent, apart from Delta. Air France, were fantastic, I would thoroughly recommend. A jumbo jet flying out and an airbus on return, food was the best I have ever tasted on a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service blew me away”
Reviews.Author: StayFitLiveBetter
Reviews.Content: Located RIGHT ON THE STRIP! Which was perfect for us. We arrived early so we left our luggage with them, by the time we got back to our room in the evening our bags were in our room waiting for us. The gentleman as the front desk let us choose which suite we wanted ie: facing the strip on the highest floor possible. Anytime we called down for directions, assistance, whatever, they were always courteous, friendly and willing to help...even in the middle of the night! The balcony, honestly, was tiny...but we didn't care, you don't go to Vegas and spend time in your room! We stayed for free as this was my mum's timeshare condo. Never once did we feel pressured or asked to attend a sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but noisy outside in the early morning...”
Reviews.Author: TravelmoreSoCal
Reviews.Content: I've never even heard of Polo Towers until I did a search for Vegas hotels recently. I thought I'd give it a try since I wanted a room with some kitchen amenities. I stayed in a one bedroom suite which was actually very nice - full kitchen with all the appliances, tools, and dishware. The bathroom was huge with a large bedroom (King size bed) and the living room with a pull out sofa bed. I believe the room was set up to accommodate a disabled person since the shower has no steps with a flexible shower hose/head and a fold out shower seat. Because of this, the whole bathroom floor gets pretty wet because the water splashes out when showering. Bathroom amenities include plenty of towels, lotion, shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner, hair dryer. Lots of hangers also. Also an in-room safe big enough for a laptop. Really convenient. The only problem was that every morning around 6:30 AM, we were awakened by extremely loud trash and delivery trucks (we stayed there from Monday-Thursday). It lasted 20-30 minutes each morning so it was hard to get back to sleep after that. Lots of elevators. Secure access to our room since we needed an access key to punch in the elevator floors. They did try to schedule me for their timeshare presentation but I told them I wouldn't be in the hotel during the three time periods that they were holding them, which was true. They also left me a voicemail the next day to try to get me to go to the concierge's desk to pick up some "free coupons for shows and dinners". Didn't need the hassle so I ignored it. Otherwise, everyone was very nice. For the price and access to a full kitchen with a full-size fridge, plus the central location of the condo, it was great. I just wish there was no early noise...

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL IN VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: ambassadorq
Reviews.Content: The best deal you can find at a hotel in Vegas..you pay little, but get a whole lot! Large, comfortable, clean 1-bedroom suite with kitchen, living room, two flatscreens, dining table, coffee table, and couch (with pull-out bed). The only setback is the pool...not too lively...well, it's definitely no Tao Beach, but you will still have a great time with your friends. No casino or clubs located at the hotel, but who cares when Planet Hollywood (next door), Bellagio, Ceasar's, etc. are just right there? All the main attractions are accessible!

Reviews.Title: “NO CASINO”
Reviews.Author: natassia_santiago
Reviews.Content: If you're like me and hate coming home to a loud, dirty casino each night, then Polo Towers is perfect! It's a no fuss hotel, where the #1 priority is your quiet and relaxed stay. It's right next to Planet Hollywood and adjacent to the Hawaiian Marketplace. Our room had a murphy bed, which pulls down from the wall over the couch--nothing that inconvenienced us. We also had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker, which is exactly what 2 broke travelers needed. This is definitely my new go to LV hotel. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation I ever had.”
Reviews.Author: c5crew06
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a last minute exchange. traded 2 bedroom unit and got a one bedroom unit as I requested. Rented car at airport and was surprised it is only 10 to 15 minutes away. Checked in @ 1:30 and room was ready. Room was excellent with a decent view of the Strip. Hotel is in center of Strip and we were able to walk everywhere except for a few places that a car was needed. Front desk was very friendly and answered all my questions. Will come back again and bring rest of family.

Reviews.Title: “Excited”
Reviews.Author: sh0ndag
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I was kinda scared of this hotel, but I must say job well done by Polo Towers. Everything was great, I like to be straight up with people bc I want the same. This is a great hotel and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: F0x10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slightly (200 meters) off the strip which is good because it is easy to access but yet not right ontop of it. The room itself was clean functional and had a mini kitchen which was amazing! The only downside was that whilst we were here for 3 nights, the tv remote stopped working twice, the light seemed to stop working ( yet no fault could be found), and the toilet was temperamental. However none of these were major problems. I would still recommend and stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mexicanita_grl11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Polo Towers on August with my husband and another couple, definitely a great place to stay. We had a 2 bedroom condo, great rooms, a lot of space, each room with it's own bathroom, we would stay there again for sure. And since it has a kitchenette, we saved some money in food, we made some grocery shopping and had breakfast there, so that's a plus, specially if you're on a budget. The only downside is that they don't have enough parking spaces, even if you want to use the valet service...you have to park in a lot that's next to the hotel...but other than that...it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time by coming here.”
Reviews.Author: spazx
Reviews.Content: Right now I'm staying at the Polo Towers in Las Vegas. Both pools suck, check in was at 4 pm, there is a lack of information online. The rooms suck, it doesn't state that the lockoff room doesn't have its own bed, rather a murphy bed, but to use the bed you must first move the couch to one side of the room and the table to the other, which kills the space of the tiny lockoff room. There is no washer or dryer in the room, as Marriott has in its suites. When we arrived the person at the front desk neglected to tell us we had to pre-register in order to receive a room, even though we asked what we needed to do. Instead she told us to check back at 1:30. Instead of returning at that time, we called and found out we had to pre-register at the hotel, or wait until 4 PM or later, but then they stated that we should note we will not be a priority unless pre-registered. An hour or so after we went to the hotel and preregistered we still didn't have a room. At this point they had us waiting for 4 or 5 hours. After about 7 hours wait time we got a room, this was around 5 PM. On some site it stated there was WIFI available in the rooms, there is, but it is 7.95 a day or 39.95 for the whole week. There is no free data connection. At Marriott both are included. This was by far, the WORST interval resort available. Its location is pretty nice in center city, but there is no casino in the hotel, or on the block for that matter, the closest casino is two blocks away at MGM, unless you want to cross the strip, which is a b!tch. At the desk in the lockoff room the outlet under the desk has no available ports. I paid the money for the wifi just to type this immediately. I DO NOT recommend the POLO TOWERS to ANYONE. All they do is waste time and p!ss people off. There are many hotels that leave this one in the dust in the vicinity of this building. Also transportation to and from the hotel is hard sometimes, during the day the strip should be avoided to access the hotel, rather take the backstreets with less traffic, but still just as annoying. It is not really located on a street but rather between a parking lot and a shopping center. This place sucks, there is garbage all over the streets of the city and on the block there are people promoting prostitution.Vegas is nice, but Polo Towers isn't. If you don't believe me then come here and find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!! This place ruined our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mobybich
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say that is positive, is the location. That's it! Small rooms, extra charges, check out 10am. No tub, murphy bed, no ice, tried to double charge me. Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Vicky058
Reviews.Content: While researching the Polo Towers (as a timeshare exchange) I had a lot of trouble understanding the layout of the property. It's ONE property that goes by the names The Villas at Polo Towers and the Suites at Polo Towers. I could never tell what the difference was and the long and short of it is there is no difference. They both have the same types of rooms and have one lobby, check-in, pool, etc. I was pleasantly surprised at it's good location; not directly ON the Strip, but behind some sort of outdoor bar and souvenir shop which doesn't affect the view. You're right in front of the City Center, next door to Planet Hollywood and lots good restaurants are in walking distance. Some rooms have awesome views, some have no view. The room was large and daily maid service was a welcome feature - not one you usually get at a timeshare. The rooftop pool was a great departure from the typical Vegas overcrowded, loud pool. And because it is rooftop, you get a very nice breeze that again, is a departure from pools surrounded by buildings (think Caesars, Monte Carlo, Luxor, Mirage). My husband took advantage of the fitness center (free) every day and enjoyed it. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here on four occasions and cant fault it!”
Reviews.Author: LondonGeorgia
Reviews.Content: This place really is home from home. We stayed in a one bed unit in the Towers which was fabulous. They have refurbished the villas recently and the furnishings are really nice. All the kitchen equipment is new and the whole place is extremely clean. Polo towers is right on the strip and we were lucky enough to have a room overlooking the strip. There is a full kitchen and with a young child this is really important to me. We have stayed in some really nice hotels over the years but at the end of the day you only get a room. Here you get a large living room, huge bathroom and big bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place a minute off Las Vegas Blvd”
Reviews.Author: TFry55
Reviews.Content: At first glance the Polo Towers seems quite diminuitive compared to the gigantic-sized hotels/casinos on the strip, but when you consider you're basically living in a two-bedroom, two -washroom, full kitchen living room/dining room unit, you quickly see the pros of this place.My family stayed over Independence Day weekend in Suite 8305/8305A. This two-bedroom suite faces east (not a view of the Strip, but that was okay, because it cut down on noise), which was an easy ½ block away. Dark curtains kept out early morning sunshine. Mid-afternoon Friday check-in meant almost no delay, and suite was ready at least an hour before official check-in time. Small-ish lobby made things more personable (again, compared to the larger hotels nearby). Being a timeshare property, the daily housekeeping service was a pleasant surprise. Housekeepers kept us stocked on fresh towels, shampoo, soap and empty trash containers. The two queen Murphy beds satisfied our 22 and 18 year old sons, one of whom had his own bedroom, bathroom (with shower) and balcony. As we left the living room Murphy bed down, this put a bit of a cramp on space in the main living area, but we worked (and walked) around it. Main bathroom had large Jacuzzi tub and two separate sink areas (lots of room). One issue in both bathrooms was that neither had a working exhaust fan (which we never followed-up on). Air conditioning worked quite well. As there is no restaurant on-site, this may be an inconvenience, but the room service restaurant had great Italian food, and large portions. If you get the caesar salad, make sure they include the salad dressing! The Polo Towers also has a well-equipped and up-to-date fitness centre, which we took advantage of. Exchangers did not have to pay the daily fee, which I think was about $8/person. A couple of pharmacies with basic groceries are within easy walking distance. Everything seems to be within easy walking distance! Additionally, Polo Towers does offer free shuttle service to the outlet malls as well to a large full-service grocery store at various times through the week. We did rent a car, and while this made it convenient getting to and from the residence, it was not a necessity. The underground parking, at times, was a bit difficult (we didn’t think there were enough spaces for all the cars), until we discovered a second, attached underground lot. There is also another parking lot that is above ground, but is off property. It did come in handy for when we went on a day trip to Hoover Dam/Lake Mead. Then we appreciated the freedom having our own car gave us. Word of warning. If going to Vegas in the summer, be prepared to be in an oven. Dry heat or no dry heat, it’s tough. And going in and out of highly air-conditioned hotels/restaurants/stores makes it even tougher.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: MrVegas777
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Polo Towers for a long weekend to celebrate our 20th anniversary. (and to play in a poker tournament) This was my second time at Polo Towers and my wife's first. The room was great, the pool area is awesome, and other than having to walk down an alleyway to get back and forth to the strip, my wife seemed to enjoy the place as well. Would recommend to anyone going to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay... you won't be dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: Bdev1
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our vacation ownership week to stay at the Polo Towers (Villas) for a week in a two bedroom, which was a one bedroom with a studio lock-off. Overall, we were very satisfied with everything. No hotel is perfect 100% of the time, so I guess some of the complaints in reviews I've read here are accurate, but I think they are isolated cases. The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable, the kitchen had Cuisinart coffee makers etc., the iPod docking stations in every room were a great bonus, there were three flat screens throughout (with HD and DVD players), nice bathrooms with double sinks and a large tub, and the daily maid service was great too. The patio off the one bedroom was only big enough for standing, but the one off the studio was large. There was plenty of room in the two bedroom. I can see how some have said the rooms were tiny, because if you are in just a studio, it will be very small, but that's what studio's are. The location is great.. between Planet Hollywood and MGM, right across the street from the new Aria Hotel and CityCenter. We requested a view of the strip and landed a room on the 21st floor with a pretty good view where we could see the Bellagio fountains from our patio and dining room window. Our kids were not with us on this trip, but they would have had a blast in the kids water play area... very nice! The adult pool on the roof as others mentioned was small. The cabanas and grills were nice (grilled a couple of steaks), but there's not a ton of space up there. Regarding the trash trucks others mentioned, I did see/hear them but our room (21310) was far enough away that it wasn't a problem. I would recommend requesting a room that is not near the trash dumpsters as I could see how it could be annoying. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We sat through the time-share sales pitch because we own elsewhere and wanted to compare, plus they gave us a $75 visa card and a weekend stay. We didn't taste the room service food cause we cooked a lot and there are so many good restaurants in Vegas. My only complaints are that the air conditioner in the bedroom was a little loud in the night, and for what ever reason, wifi is not available on the higher floors. They offered us wifi in a room with no view... we chose to keep the view and I just used the wifi in the business center or lobby. Their are three computers in the business center with free internet access, but if you want wifi in your room it costs. We definitely recommend the Villas at The Polo Towers and will probably stay there again with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “More better than bad”
Reviews.Author: kischrisgene
Reviews.Content: So... Polo Towers Well first good is that they let me check in early :) bad is that there are room escourts (wierd men and women wearing white doctor looking shirts who if given the secret password by the check in person will give you a speech about buying one of thier lovely hotel rooms) I was one of the lucky people chossen to be talked to (note not everybody checking in got the speech very random. When i told the women no she rolled her eyes and said whatever. Snotty. During checkin they were so into the speech they forgot to tell me how to get to my room and almost forgot to give me room keys, lucky a nice maintance worker showed me my room. (Thank you again Tony for your help /TONY ROCKS!!!!) More GOOD! Room was clean, but small had a murphy bed room. Location was AWESOME. Best part of the room was the balcony. Loved the balcony. Security to room is nice need room key to use elevator. Parking is full but always found a spot somewhere. BAD! shower leaked when in use water poured out of the glass door no matter what i did. Pool nice but small. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed June 20 to the 25th in a Studio. The room had a small refrigerator, a microwave, and a full sized coffee pot. Dishes and utensils were also provided. My room was on the Strip side, so I had a nice view up and down the strip including a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to a grocery store 3 times a week and there were a couple other shuttles offered (one to an outlet mall and I forget what the other one was). The bathroom was adequate, with a fairly big walk-in shower. The TV was an LCD with expanded basic cable. The room had a couch and coffee table (which had to be moved to lower the Murphy bed). Very good amount of dresser and closet space for one person. The only negative about the room (for me) was the extremely firm mattress on the bed, but, this is not unique to this hotel as others I have stayed at also had really hard beds. The Positive aspects far outweighed the one negative (it was nice to be able to get up and make a pot of coffee and enjoy it on the balcony in the mornings, the view, the location, and other things). The location, between MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood and directly across from Aria and City Center was very nice. There was a WalGreens a short walk away and a little strip mall with souvenir shops next door. Between the hotel and the Strip was the Hawaiian Marketplace. This is a non-gaming hotel, so there was no casino to walk through which made a shorter walk from my room to the strip than when I stayed at MGM a couple of years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Location lets it down”
Reviews.Author: kezfiesta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2010. As hubby and I were already in Vegas we tried to see if we could check in early around 11am. This it would seem is not allowed and we were told to return at check in time at 4pm. We returned back at just after 3pm and were allowed to check in. There seemed to be a lot of people waiting to check in so be aware if you have an early flight that you may be hanging around until early afternoon to check in. Please also be aware that the hotel requires a credit card and chrges $250 to this. Unfortunatley hubbys card declined and they charged us $100 instead (that is still to be returned 10 days later grrrrr). This hotel is a non casino hotel. Hubbey felt that he missed out on some of the Vegas atmosphere because of this. However i do think if you are a family and do not want to expose you kids to seedier side of vegas this hotel is perfect. the rooms are fitted to very high standard that I have not seen matched by any other budget hotel. We had a studio room with a murphy bed. This is basically a bed that pulls out from the wall. Hubby is very tall and normally has probs with beds being too short but this was fine for him. We left the bed down the whole time we were there and did not have any probs. It is very handy having a fridge and microwave in the room. hubby and I just had cereal in the morning and saved ourselves for the buffets!!!! There are DVD players in the rooms and there is a rental machine near to the hotel shop. So again if you have kids and wnat an early night its great. However now the negatives. The car parking in appalling. There are not enough spaces under the hotel and they are rather tight. You can park on the outside car park, however I would not recommend this. As the hotel is tucked behind some shops bums/homeless people tend to hang around here and I did feel very unsafe. In addition the cops were there EVERY night arresting someone. One night they had 4 bums on the floor in cuffs. This is not something I expect to see. On another night hubby and were followed up the dark unlit road to the hotel and I did fear that we would be mugged. I am not someone who scares easily but I would recommend going back to your room early to avoid this. I however do not like going to my room early, It is vegas after all!!!!. I feel this is more a family hotel and not suitable if you want to enjoy all that vegas has to offer. I paid £200 for 5 nights here covering a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: angijc
Reviews.Content: My Aunt gave us a week in her timeshare for our honey moon. best of both worlds. So close to all the other casinos you can visit and still get the vegas vibe but a more secluded area of the strip where you can relax by the pool or in your room everything at your leisure and without the "heavily smokey but trying to be covered by dodgy airfreshener, could actually make you vomit" air in the casinos. Very friendly staff, very welcoming place to stay. Like a home from home (with a few more luxuries!) we will be going back there hopefully quite a lot and recommending to everyone we know! Thanks you to the staff who made our stay the best honeymoon ever!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: banana8710
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, it was our 1st time in Vegas, we wanted of course a Hotel-Casino experience, but i don't think we missed it, it was a really good choice, and cheap too, we got a 1 king suite, with balcony every thing was very good, clean, view to the strip, i will highly recommend this hotel. Even thought it doesn't have a casino -resort style but is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip.”
Reviews.Author: 88travelbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located on the strip very close to mgm grand, bellagio etc in my opinion. However it was not a casino resort type hotel so missed out on the whole las vegas hype and atmosphere. But was extremely cheap and clean in a good location. Therefore do NOT book if u want a hotel with a casino. Stayed in a room with a bed which came out of the wall.(didnt know this at the time of booking) but was comfortable at all times and felt like a real bed. Had a balcony, no chairs or tables provided. Had a view of the strip. Clean bathroom, had a problem with lights but it was fixed straight away. Small-ish room. Microwave, free coffee, iron, hairdryer provided. It might not be as plush as the other hotels but this was cheaper than the others and clean as well. Door to door shuttle from the airport for about 6 dollars or so per person. Runs 24/7. Booked a cheap trip to the Grand canyon for 85 dollars. about 60 gbp. (rather book this no frills excursion and save my money for shopping and eating)Coach trip included mini hoover dam and time at the canyon for self exploration inc breakfast and sandwiches for lunch. exit the hotel and turn right, walk past the stalls selling various tourist items and clothes and next to the restaurant/cafe/karaoke place called zingers or something similar(if my memory serves me correctly) is a little one man stand selling these tours. He takes a deposit and u pay the rest on the day Cheaper than the 130 dollars quoted by the man in the shopping mall.(because his includes on board wifi and a newer coach)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gem, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: soj0urner
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas with 2 small kids last week and stayed in Polo Towers for 3 nights. We found Polo Towers on Orbitz at a great price ($56/night) and right on the strip! We've never heard of Polo Towers before this. It was also a non-casino non-smoking and no resort fee hotel which was great for our family. We stayed in a one bedroom suite - King bedroom, and Queen sofa bed in the living area, huge bathroom, a good size kitchen with Cuisinart appliances, toaster, microwave, dish washer, 10-cup coffee maker (everything looked brand new), 2 flatscreen TVs! Definitely a very comfortable stay. There was no housekeeping during our stay - housekeeping was every 3 nights. But towels were changed and trash cleared every afternoon. Wireless internet is charged at $7.95/24hrs by ibahn. But our computer detected and connected to the free att wireless hotspot from the next door hotel (Grand Chateau). Yey for free wireless! There is also free internet at the business center on the ground floor. The kids enjoyed the children's pool, playground and water play area every evening. Washer/dryer was free but the dryer was pretty weak. Took ages for our clothes to get dried. It was faster to sun them at the room balcony. We arrived late so didn't get to meet any concierge. We received a 'key' to open a treasure box for a chance at a $100 Visa gift card. While waiting to check out, I saw several guest use the key at the concierge, none of them got the gift card, all of them (only the couples) were asked if they wanted to attend the hotel open house with free refreshments - and listen to the time share sales pitch. The guy manning the concierge was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “best value with a great view”
Reviews.Author: lovesvegas9
Reviews.Content: We received a week from a friend that has a time share. Never being to Vegas before we didnt know what to expect. This place is on the strip right behind the Hawaiian Marketplace. We had a one bedroom with a lovely living room, dining room and full stocked kitchen. The king bed and pillows were marvelous!!! We did do the 90 minutes time share salespitch and got a few free tickets to shows. i would definately recommend this place. it felt like home!! the pool on the rooftop is the only drawback if you like to swim, as it is only about 3 feet deep. We had a problem with blinds and a/c when we first checked and almost immediatly after hanging up the phone with the front desk, maintenance was there and fixed the problem. We would most definately go back to Polo Towers!!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGal40222
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find! I was concerned because I read negative reviews on other websites. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is steps from the Strip and is in a great location. We stayed in the studio suite which was very cozy. The room was very clean, and we had a great balcony view of the MGM Grand, NY, NY, Excalibur, Monte Carlo and other nearby hotels. The rooftop pool was nice and had nice views but was a little small. Not for the true swimmer, but nice if you just want to cool down. The kitchenette was equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, dishes and sink. The refrigerator came in handy for chilling snacks and the all important-bottled water. There is a small gift shop/store on the main level to pick up nick-nacks if need be. The hotel does not have free wireless internet, but there is a business center available. When you walk out of the hotel toward the strip, there is a small strip mall that has live music for most of the day. Also near the hotel are CVS and Walgreens to pick up anything you forgot to pack as well as many restaurants. The ACE and DEUCE bus routes also run very close to the hotel, running 24 hours/day to help nurse tired feet back to health. I would recommend getting bus passes to go up and down the strip. There are many options for bus passes including one-way, 24-hour, and three-day passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iva_van
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom apartment in Polo Towers because it was on the strip and the price was very reasonable. I was a little bit worried because it was a time share hotel and I read a lot of the reviews here. One week before our stay, a sales person called on my cell and offered the free tickets for shows etc. We said no, thank you, we are not interested in the free stuff. He wasn't pushy at all but we thought that our stay will be a nightmare because they start offering the free stuff even before we are there. BUT when we went there everything went so smoothly. We came at around 11 am, parked our car and they even offered that we come at 2:30 pm for check in. So we checked-in at 2:30 instead of 4:00 pm. All the front desk people were very polite. They send us to the "guest service guy = the concierge". He tried to offer the free stuff again, and we said no again. He wasn't pushy at all and he was very polite. The one bedroom apartment was gorgeous - new, clean, no Murphy bed. The bathroom was huge, two flat screen TVs, the view to the strip was marvelous and it was not noisy. Our tub was clogged - we called maintenance and they send a person to unclog it one hour after that. To sum up - wonderful 3 star hotel, polite staff and great service, gorgeous view, great location and very reasonable prices. I definitely would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to avoid casino's this is for you.”
Reviews.Author: No1Paul
Reviews.Content: A quality hotel in the heart of Vegas without all the hassle of a casino resort. We had the two room suite and was perfect for our needs with one room having a full kitchen and the other a mini kitchenette area. The only downside was the pull down bed was a bit hard, but I've always preferred a soft bed.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to first impressions”
Reviews.Author: JENKSEngland
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult drive into Las Vegas so when check-in passed us over to the 'concierge' who turned out to be the resident time share salesman, we weren't in the best of moods. He quickly abondoned his sales attempt. The room appeared great but the pull down bed never got put away and the sofa stayed wedged awkwardly in the corner for our 3 night stay. Although more elegant, the room had no additional facilities to those found in any cheap roadside motel and had no business calling itself a suite. The room did have a laptop sized safe, which was handy 'cos the free wifi never worked. We could have paid for ibahn but instead chose to queue for one of the 3 machines in the (haha) business suite. Although in a good location and at reasonable cost, this hotel did not live up to the intiial wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and value for $”
Reviews.Author: Fortyniner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a number of nights. Great place to stay. Polo have courtesy buses which take you out to the outlet shops. The trip was good but we could have shopped for much longer. Hotel staff friendly and welcoming. The only negative with this property is that although they have a very nice business centre they do not have free internet connections to the rooms. Crisp sheets and fluffy towels. Well equipped kitchen - great oven huge fridge, Balcony and windows that open.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home when I come to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HoustonNiki
Reviews.Content: I was greeted at the front desk with smiles and great customer service from the staff. When I entered my room which was a STUDIO suite (see pics), I was impressed with the cleanliness, the amenities (flat screen tv, ipod/cd/radio stereo, half kitchen and decor) and the feel of an apartment instead of a hotel room. The Polo Towers is located between the MGM and Planet Hollywood and a block away from a convenience store, McDonalds and the Hawaiian Village. Cab service was prompt and staff called me a couple of times to make sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. The rate was very inexpensive and if I could, I would consider buying a condo there!

Reviews.Title: “Villas at Polo Towers are amazing”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel0909
Reviews.Content: I traded our timeshare in Palm Spring for a 2 bedroom suite at the Villas at Polo Towers. The rooms were amazing. It was just my mom and I so there was plenty of space for the two of us. The Villa could have easily slept 6-8 people. Decorated very nice and very clean. Bathroom in the main bedroom was huge! The rooftop pool was nice but a little small for the amount of people staying there. Not enough lounge chairs either. I would have to get up at 8am every morning in order for us to have a chair to lay by the pool. I have always stayed in a hotel along the strip in Vegas, we go at least 2 times a year. This was the first time I have ever stayed at a condo there and I loved it. The location was perfect, right behind the Hawaiin Marketplace next to Planet Hollywood. Only one short walk from the strip. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great find”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely worth it. The price is cheap, but the rooms are far from cheap. It is conveniently located just 1/2 block from the strip. The rooms are huge, clean, and very up-to-date. We had a one bedroom suite. It had a living room with a murphy bed, a separate dinning area with a round table and four chairs, and a fully-equipped kitchen. The bedroom was separate from the kitchen/dining room by a door. It was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge and had 2 separate vanities - very convenient. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: max2214
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers isn’t one of those strip hotels you hear about all of the time, even though it merits the reputation. The hotel was great. I decided to stay there while a bunch of my friends got places at bigger hotels on the strip, but I do not regret my decision. Polo Towers had everything I needed during my stay. There was Internet access, gambling, and a great spa. I ended up with suite, which was pretty nice. It was very spacious and nicely decorated, not to mention the fantastic views. I will definitely return here, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “great time at polo towers”
Reviews.Author: heather2025
Reviews.Content: we stayed at polo towers for two weeks first week we were in a one bedroom second week we had a two bedroom. we found both had great facilities and had ample room. rooms were clean and fresh staff very friendly rooms were cleaned daily small pool on roof top be early to get a sun bed we found it hard to get one after 10 am we found polo towers a great location for most of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stay in villas or suites, not studios”
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. It is located a half a block from the strip. There is no casino so is easy to get into and out of the hotel. You are right in the middle of the action but it is a more relaxing quite location. We stayed in a villa and the room was perfect. No one approached us about purchasing a time share. The hotel is clean and the rooms were recently remodeled. Our friends rented a studio but would not recommend these as were very, very small with a murphy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Very Clean! Plenty of Room!”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravel57
Reviews.Content: We Exchanged our timeshare for a week at Polo Towers. We went with another couple, and had a 2 bedroom suite. It was plenty big enough for the four of us! We wanted to have a kitchen for coffee and light breakfasts in the room. We stayed at the Monte Carlo last year and really missed those amenities. The staff was very nice and helped us right away with any requests we had. Then they would call us to make sure our request was taken care of! We had fresh towels everyday, the trash was emptied, and our beds were made. I was surprised because this is a timeshare and they don't all provide these services. On the fourth day of our stay they cleaned the rooms, changed the bed linens, etc. There was no pressure to buy a timeshare. No one asked us to attend a presentation or anything else. It is in a great location! Almost anything you could want is within a few minutes walk! We were on the 17th floor of Tower II facing E. Harmon. Very nice balconies and views. The only down side was they have their dumpsters emptied about 6:15 am, 7:15 on Sunday! And we left the sliders open the first few days! Very loud! Security was very good! Cannot access elevators without room card. We had a great experience at Polo Towers and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, classy atmosphere, helpful staff and a priceless location”
Reviews.Author: JDRCapeCod
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Polo Towers. I am a Vegas regular and usually stay at a Casino but this time we brought our 10 and 12 year old sons and did not want to be in a Casino. Pros: Free parking in the garage, amazing helpful staff, super-clean rooms (no dust, even on the top of picture frames, etc.), quiet room, comfy bed, full kitchen, flat screen TVs, awesome location, smell of Polo cologne when you check in. Cons: Pool is clean but shallow (3 feet deep), outside of the building doesn't do justice to the rooms (the landscaping is amazing, but the building looks a bit dated). We really loved this place; we will be back. We stayed in a one-room unit (4102 was the number) and it was large and quiet. I never even think about buying a timeshare but this place seems like it would be good to own. They did not hammer me to buy a timeshare but the place is so nice you might be interested in asking them for a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay....no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: Exchanged my timeshare throught Interval for a week stay at Polo Towers. Have absolutely no complaints. Good experience, nice stay. We had a one bedroom suite in the Villas sections. Room clean, large and comfortable. Pretty much just like the pic's on line. Did not go up to the pool to check it out, weather was crappy while there unfortunately. Front desk helped us whenever needed and room was mostly cleaned every day and if not when we called down and needed something, they brought it or did exactly what we asked for in a timely fashion. Very convenient to the strip, no noice from the marketplace up front and again no complaints. I would absolutely trade my time share for Polo Towers again. Hope you enjoy when u go as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Okay”
Reviews.Author: ttopspin
Reviews.Content: This is a great location because you are right on the strip and can easily walk to different locations. What I liked the most is that the parking is very close and you don't have to walk for 20 minutes to get from the parking garage, through the casino, and up to your room, like you do in many hotels here. On the other hand, I could hear every conversation that the people were having in the two rooms next to me which is very frustrating. I guess it's just the luck of who you are next to. Also, the room was very small, but that is not a huge deal to me, but for some it might be.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a five star resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dianeoh
Reviews.Content: Although we had a studio, room was extremely small. When we asked for an upgrade we were told that the hotel was booked and nothing could be done, that was it, nothing can be done and then they hung up on me. Although there was a patio there was no patio furniture, when I called about getting furniture we were told that the hotel does not supply patio furniture. When I called for an additional chair (thinking we could have coffee on the patio) we were told that, due to the size of our room, (too small) putting another chair in room would constitute a fire hazard. The noise level from the next room was so loud we did not get much sleep. The pool's capacity was for 30 people, this hotel has three towers, so the chances of getting a chair was slim to none.
