The service was awful. We would get fresh towels everyday, but the trash would not be picked up everyday. On the fourth day our sheets were changed, ( I think) I paid dearly for a one bedroom timeshare through Interval International and am very disappointed in what they consider a 5 star resort. Although I have read and learned so much on TripAdvisor, I have never written, but felt I had to warn people that this place is not what one would expect from a 3 star resort much less a 5 star. Spend a little extra money and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Will Definetly Be BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAlatino30
Reviews.Content: The place is great, across the street from the new City center, you can walk there in less than 15 minutes. The staff was great, The rooms were clean nice and the beds were deliciously comfortable. I cannot stress how clean this place is, and the bed linens are top quality. We have stayed at many places in Vegas and for the price, This place by far the best we have gotten.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers was great”
Reviews.Author: Mottamopsie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used a "banked" week from our timeshare to trade into the Polo Towers. We were very happy with the resort. The 1 bedroom villa was clean, large and nicely decorated. The bed was super comfy. The location could not be beat, you are right on the strip and a short walk to Plant Hollywood or the MGM. The only issue we had was the air conditioning /heater unit; like the previous review, the unit was very noisy: it was not that warm outside, so we just opened the windows and left the unit off. It was great having a balcony, even though is was very small. Housekeeping came every day to change towels and empty the garbage, but they did not speak English and it was difficult to get something we needed, unless we called down to the front desk. The sales people did not bother us; just upon check in and when we told them we were not interested, they did not ask us again. The desk staff and the staff at the store were very friendly. We used the pool and were pleasantly surprised about the cleanliness of the roof top pool and the nice heated water. The jacuzzi was great. I would highly recommend the polo towers; it is a nice quiet place to retreat to after a day on the active strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service! Do Not Buy a Timeshare here! You will be sorry!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmbassyHotelManager
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel on the outside is quite shabby, and you have to drive thru an alley to get to it. The location I will say is quite nice. Upon entering it, was a nice lobby. The young white female with the long straight hair at the front desk was horrible. No eye contact. No smiling. Nothing. I work in the hospitality industry in Chicago and it was one of the worst check-ins I have ever experienced! In fact, all the employees at this location seem to only "be there" and are not representing the hotel in any way. Like they are not a part of it. Housekeeping was roaming the halls on their cell phones and you would think someone would help me find an ice machine (they are not on every floor like most hotels offer) but he kept talking on his cell phone and instead I wandered and found a security officer (not part of the hotel) and he offered to help me find one. had a question for Concierge. Not once did she acknowledge me as I waited in line for 10 minutes until she was done with the guest she was helping. You're supposed to acknowledge "I will be right with you" or something. Now....the timeshare people.....wow. They are very nice to you in the beginning but once they know you are not interested, they walk away very cold. The hispanic "Manager" came to us shook our hands, said his speech and then after knowing we weren't buying he just got up and said thank you in a very cold manner. The hallway smelled like fish for hours. Housekeeping did "surface cleaning" in our suite. The blankets were not even folded on the couch. The dirty cups were left on the counter, unwashed and not even replaced. No vacuuming occurred. The only thing that was positive about this place is that the suites are very nice and comfortable. The bed was ridiculously comfortable but the service and the people who run it just flush it down the drain. Knowing this, I am glad I did not buy a timeshare here!

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad...”
Reviews.Author: MalibuSky
Reviews.Content: Unit was nice and had everything we needed. Bathroom was huge and Whirlpool bath tub was fantastic. Real problem was the air conditioning was very noisy and for some reason we had to call engineering to turn it off. We needed air so we kept the kitchen window open only to find out that he first morning we were in the flight path of the airport and that the first flights t take off at 6:30 a.m....and it was noisy enough to wake me up. We were quite surprised that our beds were made each day in that we were in a timeshare, I don't know if this is normal but we didn't want to question it for fear they would stop the service (or charge us). Staff overall was very friendly and more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-one of the best I've stayed in in 30 years of travelling”
Reviews.Author: Gary51Essex
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews here I was a little worried about the space in a studio for my 6 night stay so I booked a one bedroom suite. It was big enough to live in full time! Unlike the huge casino hotels check in was quick and easy. I was in my room within minutes of arrival. There was a living room with large settee and chair along with a dining table for 6. Kitchen was very well equipped. Save money and eat in for breakfast. In the living area there was a Large flat screen TV on the wall with DVD player and separate CD/Radio. The bedroom had a smaller flat screen TV on the wall and Ipod dock with radio alarm and a King size bed. Bathroom well equipped with two sinks and plenty of towels bath with powerful shower over. Plenty of storage space and a small balcony(not big enough to sit in) topped off this fantastic property. Staff were friendly and when I rang reception to request an item they then rang me later to check that it was delivered. The 'Deuce' bus that runs along the strip stops outside the access road to the property about two minutes walk from the front door. The monorail is a bit more of a mission to get to. Approx 20 minute walk away including a long walk through to the back of the MGM Grand which is 'next door' . In Vegas speak thats around a 10-12 minute walk away. Be warned the monorail stations are all at the back of the hotels listed as the main stops. Its a long walk to most of the other hotels listed along with the main stops. The hotel is at one end of the strip so the Deuce is the best form of transport to the centre of the strip but can take a while at busy times. But back to the Polo Towers, I would move in tomorrow permanently if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: nelliedeanLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 week in March; it cost $450 for a studio for the week and it is right on the strip. I booked directly from Internet - go direct it was cheaper than the so called cheap booking websites. I was not hassled by any sales people (maybe they got my measure!) the room was comfy and clean. Whenever there was any issue it was dealt with speedily and professionally. Reception staff were very courteous although the concierges were a bit hapless about Las Vegas info butI understand that this is the norm for most hotels, They run free shuttles to do your food shopping as there is nowhere to buy fresh food on the strip and as long as you can cook in a microwave you will save lots of money. Given the exhorbitant prices being charged on the Strip this was escellent value. The Murphy bed was a tad on the high side and too cumbersome to fold up everyday but that was OK for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but be careful”
Reviews.Author: waveMI
Reviews.Content: Nice, non-smoking, no casino, close enough to everything. But, beware the "sell" tactics. Just to get a room upgrade (that I should have had anyway) I foolishly spent at least 3 hours trying to be sold vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but a good value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a a Studio unit for $90/night rate for a weekend via Hotels.com for myself and a friend. Unfortunately, Hotels.com was a bit misleading -- they advertise "all" Polo Towers rooms as including a rollaway bed, and that my studio unit would have a Murphy bed as well. In actuality, the room only had a single queen-sized Murphy bed, and the hotel management claimed our room (a 313 sq. ft. studio) was too small to also fit a rollaway bed. The management actually told us to put couch cushions on the floor instead! Aside from that problem, the room was clean and quiet and had plenty of amenities. The Polo Towers' location itself is pretty good -- right on The Strip, between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood. PROS: Professional front desk staff, tasteful decor, clean rooms, an actual balcony wide enough to sit/stand on, full-length wall-to-wall blackout curtains, wide tile showers with glass doors and good water pressure, a coffee machine, fridge, microwave and extra sink in the kitchenette, an iPod docking alarm clock, stereo, and a DVD/VCR. CONS: the iPod docking stereo didn't work (but the docking alarm clock did), no lamps; only ceiling lighting, tiny trash cans that get filled too easily, low-quality shampoo and conditioner, no ability to checkout via the in-house cable TV system, and they make you talk to a sales rep after check-in (they're a Diamond International timeshare resort).

Reviews.Title: “Vegas 2009”
Reviews.Author: ryee38211
Reviews.Content: Great resort on the strip. Enjoy the large space. Better than a hotel room. Very close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: rondreizer
Reviews.Content: We where at the polo towers during CES in january. All other hotels where suddenly fully booked, so we had to find something else. The Polo Towers is an hotel without casino or restaurants. Cause there wasn't a casino it you could walk easily walk in the hotel. The location was perfect at the Strip. We had a 1 bedroom suite, which was very big. We had an own kitchenette with livingroom and a seperate bedroom. You could see that it wasn't new, but well maintained. We liked it that there was a seperate bedroom so you could come in late without disturbing the other one. There was also a balcony you could stand on, great for smokers. We had a perfect strip view. There was a dvd, tv in living and bathroom. The only negative thing is that it is part of a time-share organization. Just say NO and don't mak an appointment with them. Internet rates (wireless) was also good. 13 dollar for 72 hours. Stay at the 1 bedroom Suite, just a little more expensive, but you won't regret it. If you like luxury, this isn't the place to stay. If you are looking for a good location, nice price, and a big room, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location...Awesome Price”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_PEI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a girlfriend of mine for a "girls only" vacation. The service was definately decent. We had a smaller room with a murphy bed but it suited us just fine...besides, who goes to Vegas to spend time in their room? The roof top pool was small and the chairs filled up fast, but it was roof top and the views were fantastic. There was remodeling and construction going on in the hotel when we stayed there but aside from walking around the abck of the hotel we didn't even notice. City Centre still wasn't open either, so the area was full of construction but i didn't find that much of an inconvenience either. I'd definately stay here again...if just for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place great location”
Reviews.Author: kitnbootspadell
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20 year wedding anniversary with a trip to Las Vegas for a week. We stayed at the Polo Towers right off the strip. The staff was nice and the place was clean. I liked having the kitchen in the room so we could have coffee, we had a view of the strip so we could sit and watch people coming and going as we started our day. One night after a day of sightseeing we went to use the jacuzzi. Its on the roof of the building. It was just beautiful to sit there and see all the stars over the desert sky. It was also nice to smell Polo cologne each time we walked thru the lobby. Staff was friendly. If you have to do some laundry forget, guest laundry room was out of the way, small and dryer didn't work but over all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently close to Shopping, restaurants and nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: surfer123California
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is a great spot to everything on the Strip. Had a great time but bummed that my trip was so short. The only thing I have a complain about was check- in. The lady that assisted us didn't seem too interested in helping. She was very bland and I felt that she is only doing a job rather than giving excellent customer service. Housekeeping was very good at getting items I had requested for. Bell service was ok as well as Valet. Room was very spacious and clean.Other than that my stay was great. Hopefully to come back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this place”
Reviews.Author: eecsbear
Reviews.Content: good location, close to everything. clean, really like staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hidden secret on the strip on the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: pyramoon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel as part of a time share exchange. We have 2 weeks per year to use and exchange, one week of a full suite, 1 week of an efficiency/traditional hotel type room with kitchenette. On this vacation we used the efficiency style room. Despite what a few other crabby, nit-picking, unhappy people write, the room was great! How big does the room actually have to be??? Ever travel to San Fran or NY? those cities have small hotel rooms! When on vacation, having a comfortable, clean room is a must, BUT I AM NOT THERE TO HANG OUT IN THE HOTEL ROOM ALL DAY!!!! It's just a place to sleep, shower and maybe have a snack----the size shouldn't matter!! There were 2 adults in our party with MORE than enough room to move around, despite what some reviewers might have you believe!!! The murphy bed was easy to use & comfortable, the kitchenette was sufficient, the bathroom nice as well. The room even had a large balcony- something you really don't typically see in Las Vegas.......The hotel rooms and grounds were clean, staff friendly, free underground parking, a pool on the 23rd floor (great!!!) and the location.......RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STRIP WITH EASY WALKING TO EVERYWHERE! Even if you don't like to walk as much as we do, you're still close to cabs and the bus line! Polo towers is neatly tucked off the main drag, there is no casino in the hotel, so the mobs of people passing through don't exist!!!!! Polo towers is located directly across from the new ARIA complex, so you really are in the center of it all!!! We did take a bus to the OLD DOWNTOWN AREA.....YIKES!!! Super seedy, creepy and full of OLD people, with oxygen tanks, smoking!!! It was something to see, but I would NEVER go down there at night, even to see the light show!! It just seemed a little creepy and NOT comfortably safe to let your guard down! We don't gamble, i never thought i'd love las vegas vacationing as much as i do because you really only hear people talk about casinos....but there is TONS to do!!! Not only are there some of the world's best restaurants, shopping and live shows, but there are also great activities to enjoy......We hiked in Red Rock National Park, went to the Hoover Dam toured the inside and went to lake meade, and hiked in Zion (in utah). All were a close car ride away! The POLO TOWERS was a WONDERFUL hotel.......without all the comotion and crowds of some of the larger places.....we were VERY happy with this hotel! ps....go see the LOVE SHOW AT THE MIRAGE!!! I was never really a beatles fan, too young to really know their stuff, BUT I HAVE A NEW APPRECIATION FOR THEIR MUSIC!!! book a seat about half way up, in the center of the row, it's the BEST way to enjoy the show and see everything, and there's A LOT to see, A LOT of stuff to take in! SO WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: CScharer
Reviews.Content: This place is almost nicer than my own home. A separate bedroom, a kitchen with an oven, stove and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Polo towers delivers again”
Reviews.Author: NOLACreole
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly late in posting this review. My husband and I stayed at Polo Towers for 3 nights at the end of September. This was our second time staying at here and booking through Interval International. However, this was our first time staying in a studio. It had a kitchenette which included a mini fridge, microwave and small sink. It came with two sets of dishware and silverware. The bathroom had only a walkin shower. There were two closets, one near the front door and the other near the bathroom. There was a very small desk area with wireless internet access that if I remember correctly was about $14 for 72 hours. We had a murphy bed that in order to get down, you had to move the coffee table and the 2 couch cushins. No big deal, but I have never slept in a murphy bed and it did take the two of us to make sure it didn't come down too quickly. Once the bed was down, there is no more space in the room, but it was only down when we were ready to sleep so that wasn't a problem for us. We didn't experience any outside noise which was nice. Just a quaint room and a great location on the strip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to the craziness of a casino!”
Reviews.Author: KimKDallas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed 4 nights in December at the Polo Towers in Vegas. It turned into a great weekend, so I thought I’d share a little about our experience with the property. LOCATION / VIEW Our room was on the 20th floor overlooking Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio, etc. Overall it was a great view of the strip. I don’t think we closed our windows much as it was wonderful to look at any time of day. You could even see the fountains at the Bellagio from our window! From a location perspective, the hotel is really well located. It’s an easy walk north or south to a large portion of the strip. There are several mini-marts, a Wal-Greens and a CVS nearby to pickup staples like cereal, bagels, snacks and drinks. Not grocery store prices, but cheaper than the onsite convenience store on property. ROOM Our one bedroom suite was very comfortable. Living room, dining, kitchen, bedroom (with king bed) and bath. Suites do not have laundry facilities, but they are available on property. Beds / linens were very comfortable. They did towel swap / trash removal daily, but since it’s a timeshare property, they didn’t do a full clean each day. Unit was clean and fresh on arrival, and we found no issues. Kitchen was adequately equipped. There were 2 large flat screen TVs. The sofa was comfortable enough for napping. Bathrooms and kitchen had granite countertops. The unit appeared to be recently remodeled. Internet was available in the room for $7-8/day. There was a business center downstairs with computers, printers and internet. SERVICE Front desk staff was great. Bell staff was usually helpful, although could be a little grumpy about the cab situation --- more on that in the next section. Concierge wasn’t as helpful as I would have liked. They might have been fine for tickets, but always sent you to the bell stand for directions. TAXIS/ TRANSPORT The property sits back from the strip, and there are seldom if EVER cabs waiting. You can’t hail your own on the strip, as they aren’t allowed to stop. The belldesk must call them, and you never know how long it will take. We tried to get them to order one in advance so we wouldn’t have dinner / show issues, but they insisted it was first come / first served only. This was our biggest issue --- but it was really only a problem when going out in the evenings – where there could easily be 2-3 groups in front of you when you got down there. They also have a transport service that helps them, and if there aren’t cabs available, they’ll put you in one of those. It’s a little more expensive --- about $15 to most places – but if you are going to be late, it’s not worth arguing over. We did run into one of those drivers that expected a pretty extravagant tip (he didn’t plan to give us change for a $20 on a $10 ride). MGM or Paris are the closest monorail stops. There’s a deuce bus stop next door in front of Planet Hollywood ($3 one way or $7 for 24 hour pass). The bus is fine if you are in no hurry. I had to pick up tickets at the Stratosphere. With traffic, it took 30 minutes to get there and 50 to get back. Overall --- It was a great place to be -- without the craziness of an onsite casino. I loved it, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bilashk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Polo towers 1 week. Got strip view on 16th floor which had a balcony. Loved the view and enjoyed the closeness to the strip. A "tix for tonight" booth is right in front on the strip which made getting discount show tickets a breeze. The house keeping cleaned our room everyday which is hard to find in a time share. For light sleepers you can hear Karaoke on the street till 3 am so be warned. Polo towers has one of the best locations on the strip and our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: southerntravelbelle
Reviews.Content: We had a Studio at the Polo Towers, the room is small but well appointed, it has everything you need. I was affraid of the Murphy bed but the bed was very comfortable. Rooms are very clean. We had fresh towels every single day of our stay. The location of this hotel is great, you can walk to MGM, Planet Hollywood, NY NY etc., I have been reading bad reviews about this hotel and I can only say one thing, if you are looking for luxury you need to stay at the Bellagio, Encore, Wynn, pay the price and don't complaint. This is a very comfortable and clean hotel. I will stay at the Polo Towes again.

Reviews.Title: “Just average...really, really, average”
Reviews.Author: schulzey
Reviews.Content: First of all, we had a lock off room with a kitchenette and that's never a good idea. Second, we own at the Marriott Grand Chateau next door which is WORLD's better, but wasn't quite finished when we made this trip and our week was a free comp from Marriott for our timeshare purchase. The room was very average and small, but that's because it was the lock off room. It is in a good location, just right off the strip and we only rarely drove or used a cab to get to anything. Service was average at best. Whenever we asked for something it took a while and often, multiple calls, to get what we wanted or needed. You need to know that with most timeshares, check out is 10am and since we didn't get in until 4am the morning we were supposed to check out, we negotiated an additional 2 or 3 hours for an extra $45. We needed the sleep and check out at noon or 1pm was a much better idea. Alas, the front desk called at 9am to verify that we were going to be checking out late. And woke us up. And yes, I was not very pleasant. Then, just as we drifted back off...housekeeping started cleaning the connected room very loudly and then knocked on our door repeatedly and then tried to get in. By the time I pulled the door open, the cleaning lady was running down the hallway, because she realized she'd made a mistake. Not her fault. She wasn't told not to clean our room, but should've been told. I wanted to argue about the $45, but my wife wisely suggested I go get the car and find my peace and she checked us out. Better to write off the money and enjoy the rest of the day. So...my experience was sub-par, but I'd say overall the Polo Towers is a very average hotel and I feel for anyone who buys here with something as nice as the Grand Chateau next door. Oh, and even if you don't stay here (which you shouldn't), check out the three horse sculpture in the lobby. There's something really wrong about it and I think all three horses that posed for the sculpture are going to need some counseling. I'm just saying, it looks...well, it looks wrong. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Trip May 2009 - Stayed at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: jemw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Polo Towers Memorial Day Holiday 2009 (5/22-5/29/09) for our 21st wedding anniversary, using our time share exchange. We had a delightful time at Polo Towers and in Las Vegas! We could not have asked for better accomodations at the Towers. The loacation, being almost in the middle of the strip, is perfect for everything - - easy access to the casinos and public transportation. The gym was nice and clean and very well equipped for a small gym. We didn't use the pool (because we're not pool people) but stopped up to see it on the roof - quite interesting! We especially enjoyed the cozy bed and very nice pillows. Saw Carlos Santana in Concert and visited the Grand Canyon, among many other interesting things. We will definitely go back to Las Vegas and stay at Polo Towers. The only drawback was that it was the hottest May ever in Vegas (high 90s everyday), but that did not slow us down.

Reviews.Title: “great time @ Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: beeeechbum
Reviews.Content: I have a timeshare through Diamond Resorts and had actually been told by a fellow timeshare owner at one of the Maui properties that Polo Towers was kind of a joke. I also read some of the reviews on here and must disagree with some of the negative points. I did notice that some of the photos are from 2006 and they do not look anything like the room we stayed in. I went with 3 friends for my divorce party and I must say that we had a great experience. From the moment we pulled up, all of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful- the guy who checked us in even googled something for me. The self parking was interesting. After attempting to self park, I decided to valet- the parking structure is a bit oddly shaped and there is not much available for self parking. Valet is free anyway, we just tipped the guy a few bucks and it was worth it to avoid the hassle. Our room was well appointed with a kitched that had a full sized refrigerator and oven which was very useful since we didn't want to spend a ton of money eating out in Vegas. We were on the 9th floor with a good view of New York New York, Monte Carlo and a few other places. This hotel does not have a casino which was good for me because I am not a smoker and I didn't have to deal with the nasty smell of cigarettes that lingers in casinos. It is situated in between Planet Hollywood and MGM- a great location for walking almost anywhere. There is a nice pool area on the roof with a smallish pool, but the decor is nice and there are cabanas if you want to stay out of the direct sun. I also was pleased that they had a business center that had 2 computers with complimentary internet use- I had to check my work email because my BlackBerry was having issues. I will definitely return to this great hotel, but be aware that it is not the Bellagio. If that is what you are looking for, stay there and not at Polo Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: blue2man
Reviews.Content: I read many of these reviews online with disbelief. They talk about how their whole trip was ruined because the couch had a stain, or they saw a pube in the shower. Polo Towers is a great place to stay , especially when you consider that it is right on the strip and what it costs for a tiny hotel room anywhere nearby. It is clean, has decent staff, and the usual facilities you would expect. Primadonnas who start nitpicking about furniture style are like psycho brides whose wedding was ruined because the carnations were misplaced. Overall, it is very similar to the other timeshares in the area, ie Summer Bay, Jockey Club, MGM. signed, Happy Camper

Reviews.Title: “Location works for me...”
Reviews.Author: Islandsue
Reviews.Content: I think the location of the Polo Towers are good since you can pretty much walk to tons of places. Yes, it is set back a bit, but that's not a problem. The problem I have is that the maint. fee's keep going up. Compared to other timeshare properties, I think it's a bit much. We have been owners since 1991 and bought in the Villas. When I arrived last week (9/6-9/13) I tipped $20 and asked for a view of the strip. Not sure what took so long, but the girl looked like she did her best by typing for such a long time, then checking certain reports and talking to co-workers about certain rooms, etc. It was like it was an ordeal to get me a room with a view. So naturally I was very very thankful. But once I got to my room I noticed that it was not a Villa. It was a Suite. Basically they are the same except that the Villa's have upgrades that make a huge difference for me. The bathroom, in particular has two sinks instead of one. Also the bathtub is a jaccuzi in the Villa's and just a small tub in the Suites. The Villa's have better decorations, better bedding, better furniture, and better kitchen counters and equipment. Just nicer. So it was again an ordeal when I went back down to the desk and talked to the same nice girl who told me to return the next day. I did return in the morning but was told to return in the afternoon. Sigh. So I returned in the afternoon and FINALLY I got a Villa. But not on the strip. So I felt like I tipped her $20 for nothing! As it turns out, I loved my Villa and I loved the view of the mountains, facing east. Beautiful sunsets every morning. Other than that, I enjoyed staying at Polo Towers. It's not a mega resort, which I like. It is more like a private condo. Private and quiet. That's what I wanted while in Vegas. Personally, I would rather walk to the casino's and enjoy the quiet peace where I sleep. Speaking of sleep. I slep SO well the entire time I was there. The bed was very comfortable. I actually looked forward to turning in every evening (as I have problems sleeping generally). The only thing I wish they had was a really nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Long Week-end!”
Reviews.Author: epsloop
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at the Villas at Polo Towers. We did a "shortstay exchange through interval" for a long week-end. Upon arriving, they told us there was some construction going on in the villas, which was what our reservation was for. They offered to switch us to the suites, or keep us in the villas and put as as far as possible from the construction. We decided to stay in the villas as planned and were placed on the 8th floor. We weren't bothered at all by the noise of rennovations on the 15th floor. The rooms themselves are small compared to American standards, but they were very well appointed. If you are going to stay for a week, you may want something larger. The kitchenette included a large refrigerator, sink, microwave and any utensils you may need including a corkscrew. The sitting area had a flat screen tv with a dvd/vhs player and a stereo with an ipod mounting dock, both of which were very nice. The couch looked a little shabby considering the room had just undergone renovation, but the murphey bed pulled down over it, which may have been the reason. The bed itself was large enough, but very firm, which you may like if you prefer firm beds. The nighstand/desk area had an alarm clock that also had an ipod mount. Our closet had a safe to put your valuables in and extra pillows and blankets. The bathroom was very clean and had a nice walk-in shower with good water pressure. The bathroom counter had just been remodeled and looked great. Something else that stood out to me was the fact that the hairdryer in the bathroom was awesome! It was like a salon hairdryer compared to most of the crappy ones you find in hotels. This makes a difference when you have long hair like me! The location of the hotel was another plus. While not on the strip, it is only about a block or so back. When you are trying to sleep, this makes a big difference as you will avoid a lot of the noise from the strip of loud music, drunken revelers, etc. that are non-stop in Vegas. The hotel within walking distance to MGM, New York- New York, Luxor, Tropicana, Monte Carlo, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Paris, Excalibur, etc. You can also take a ride on the "Deuce" bus ($3 one way) to get to some of the hotels on the northern strip such as Wynn, Trump Towers, Venetian. The Deuce also goes all the way to old Vegas where you can gamble cheaper (Binions, Mermaids, Golden Nugget, etc). The hotel also offers several free shuttles you may want to take advantage of. In terms of ammenites, we used the gym, which is located next door to the hotel. It was awesome! Most hotel gyms are tiny and lack a variety of machines/weights. Not this one! It had everything we needed (bikes, treadmills, eclipse, weights, machines, pull up bar, stair-stepper, etc). Overall, the hotel was in a great location, offered great prices/value, and the service was good too. Anytime we had questions the staff was quick to help out. If you need extra towels, shampoo, conditioner, whatever.. don't hestiate to ask... the staff will try to accomodate you ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Place is over rated”
Reviews.Author: bucketofbolts
Reviews.Content: The place is in back of restaurants and other businesses, which means there are trash cans and other not so good to look at views. The spa and swimming do not live up to the photos they advertise. Rooms or suites are small and stuffy, you feel like you are sitting on top of each other. The maintenance fees are out of sight, compared to other much nicer resorts in Las Vegas such as the Tahiti Village. The staff is fair, they do not go out of their way to make your stay pleasant or something you can't wait to tell relatives and freinds about. I am so happy that I only own every other year.

Reviews.Title: “great fun but not for kids”
Reviews.Author: aofn41
Reviews.Content: Polo towers was a great place to stay, rooms were clean, staff was friendly. I swear they have polo cologne coming thru the air vents, but it wasn't over powering, just right.... Found the staff selling tickets to shows off their lobby over priced. It was easier to walk outside the hotel to go to the ticket sales on the corner or to the location itself for cheaper tickets. Loved the hotels pool and hot tub, its on the roof so you can enjoy the stars and views of Las Vegas. Its just off the strip so it was convenient to everything. Not sure if we personnally would travel back to Las Vegas but if the chance should arise again I would return to Polo Towers

Reviews.Title: “Polo has been nicely renovated, but the service kills the deal.”
Reviews.Author: RickyLee
Reviews.Content: Second time here. First time we had problems during their renovation. People were working late and making a lot of noise. Now that it's renovated, it is fairly nice. However, service to the rooms was nonexistent. We got fresh towels and trash service the night before we left. Completely unacceptable. There are a lot of great deals for lodging in Vegas. This is definitely not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway to a Fabulous Condo”
Reviews.Author: UtahFamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: After writing an average review of the Polo Towers over 2 years ago, I can officially say that the rooms have been remodeled and our condo was beautiful! We gifted the first half of the week to my sister and her husband and they had a fabulous time. My husband and I took the last couple nights for a quick getaway and I couldn't believe the difference in the room. Granite countertops, new carpet, furniture, flat screen t.v's, bedding, and we even had a room facing the strip. There is so much construction still in that area that the sidewalks are torn apart and I'm sure some noise comes from it, but we didn't stay that long. The pool was awesome, we walked up at the perfect time and was able to snag a cabana with a couple of lounge chairs, the whole pool area was filled to capacity! We took a cooler with drinks thinking that we would have to hide it but there were people there BBQing, eating fast food, and drinking from their coolers also. The only rule I saw was that you had to smoke in designated areas and no glass containers at the pool. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom condo and it is very spacious, you could have 6 adults or a room full of kids and feel like you aren't all shoved into the room. I still feel that you can't beat the location, its easy to grab a cab or if you drive to valet or park yourself, and now that the rooms are remodeled, I definately think it's a first class resort. We will definately book again for next year!

Reviews.Title: “First time guest of Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: keriann714
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our 5 day stay at the Polo Towers. We were welcomed by friendly staff, had a clean, spacious room, and were in walking distance from all "the strip" action. We enjoyed the roof top pool as the weather was hot while we were there! We would absolutely stay at the Polo Towers again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent priced option virtually on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: cdchess
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Had a studio room with a great view of the strip. The room was small versus US standards but tasteful in decor and in excellent condition. There is a small kitchenette area with fridge/sink/microwave. Bathroom area has a walk-in shower only. Coffee maker in the room which makes a nice change. There is a small rooftop pool area which gets plenty of sun and was busy when I looked in. A decent shop selling basic needs is located on the ground floor. Housekeeping is limited to towel change/bed making/trash removal on a daily basis with a full service every few days. Housekeeping happy to dole out extra coffee/shampoo etc. Polo Towers is well located between MGM and Planet HollyWood casinos. The room was quiet despite being only 100m off the strip. There is a monorail stop at the MGM casino. There may be a back route to this monorail directly from the polo towers which I didnt find. The monorail is right at the back of the MGM which means a walk to the strip, down the strip to the MGM and then through the entire casino which is huge. It is definitely worth checking this out as it will save a whole lot of walking. Overall a good option and a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice timeshare in hotspot on Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: psmith27
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas, we traded our 2br/2bth Orlando unit for a 1br/1bth in Polo Towers, the only resort left in our exchange company's network for the dates we wanted. We had our 14 y.o. son with us. The resort was in a very busy spot with construction around and close to the airport but noise was never a problem. Upon arrival we found a very friendly and helpful stafff, nice lobby area with marble floors and a center fountain. The entrance to the resort was presentable but to get to the underground parking one has to drive around the building, thru a narrow entryway that ran past the dumpster area and then around to the garage entrance. It was just a bit awkward getting to the garage. I might add this is also the side of the resort where the kiddie pool is, the sun barely hit that area all day and it was not the most attractive spot for a child's play area, as it overlooked a large parking lot, construction site and the aforementioned dumpsters. As for the main pool, it was on the roof, looked very nice but was only 3 ft. deep. It stays open until 10pm but kids are not allowed in after 5pm, we saw the security guards actually kick the kids out once. They were the only ones using it so I thought it was a little mean of them. The room was much nicer than I expected from some of the reviews I've read. The decor was very up to date. Carpets were clean and new, no odors, I didn't see even one bug anywhere. The bed was a very comfortable king size with lots of fluffy pillows, I would compare it to a Sweet Sleeper or even a Heavenly. It was that comfy. The bedroom was a nice size with sliding door out to a very tiny balcony. Being on the 12th floor, we had a nice view of MGM, NY-NY, Excaliber, etc. Lots of lights and activity to observe from our window. Our son slept on the sofa bed, he said it was comfortable. Kitchen had tiled floor, granite counter, dishwasher, refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and all the dishes and utensils you need for 4 people. Bathroom also had granite counter, good water pressure in shower. Housekeeping was not as reliable as I had hoped, we came back a few times after being out the entire day to find they had not been in yet to change the towels, empty the trash or make the bed as promised. However whenever I needed something I just called housekeeping and someone was there in a matter of minutes with whatever I needed. A follow-up phone call from the HK supervisor to see that we were taken care of every time was much appreciated. The one thing I would have liked to see is free Wi-Fi. They have an outside company and you have to pay $35 for a week of use or however long you wanted. There were instructions on how to connect but it was complicated and required changing some of our settings so we decided to pass on that after lugging our laptop across the country for nothing. All in all we enjoyed staying in Polo Towers and would stay there again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Shu69
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Polo Towers for 4 days and it had the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept in away from home. I read some negative reviews and was concerned about arriving but everything was clean. The halls were quiet and the service was impeccable. I would definately stay there again. "Two thumbs up"

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy everything”
Reviews.Author: lovelaughtermusic
Reviews.Content: We chose the Polo Towers thinking it would be somewhat comparable to any Marriott Hotel and were very disappointed. It has a shabby and strange hotel entry; you must drive past dumpsters and down an alley to arrive for the valet. After check in and arriving to our room; we were surprised at the size of the second bedroom. It's very small; just wide enough to accommodate a murphy bed and dresser. After unpacking and putting our food in the kitchen we were unpleasantly surprised to find a cockroach climbing in our bag of cookies! We called the front desk and explained that we had a baby with us and roaches in our room wouldn't do! They moved us to another room and as we were attempting to hang our clothing, the closet door handle came off the door. I'm wondering now how this hotel has any positive reviews. We just couldn't believe it later when my son flushed the toilet and water flooded the bathroom floor....oh my goodness, did this place pass code? At this point, I was seriously wondering if we could change hotels since we'd booked at this one for an entire week. The manager then "upgraded" our room and gave us dinner at a local restaurant. We moved again, it was a long night, and tried to make the best of it, have a good attitude and settle down. While staying in the upgrade, the kitchen sink became plugged and our room keys failed to open our doors 3 times, maid service included taking out the garbage and giving us new towels. It's a bit like a Motel 6 wishing it were a nice hotel.....stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Timeshare Property”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have gone to Vegas for a 5 day trip after New Year last year we stayed at The Jockey Club which we thought was very good but the Polo Villas surpassed that We arrived very late nearly midnight so check in was quick pleasant & efficient . We were on the 10th floor (you need to use your key card for the elevator ) A really nice one bed apartment tuscany decor decent bathroom nothing fantastic but 2 separate vanities , Jacuzzi bath Tub ,no separate shower. Fully equipped kitchen,nice living room with a Murphy pullout a very nice suite. The staff were always pleasant,beds made daily new towels etc a nice touch not usual for timeshare. We didn't try to use the internet because yet again so hotels have subbed it out to an outside source which is usually exorbitant . There is a small mini mart on the ground floor they sell fresh donuts and basic essentials I used the gym daily it is pretty well equipped 5 flat screen TV's lots of treadmills ,bikes ...Free for guests Polo Villas is right on the Hawaiian Market great location Planet Hollywood is next door .The huge construction of Town Centre is opposite but we were there from Friday to Tuesday and never heard a thing. We really enjoyed our stay at the Polo Towers and will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Good standard”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiresfinest
Reviews.Content: We didn't know anything about the Legionnaire scare until we were given the official letter in our check in pack, which was very low key - we are from England and we didn't get any phone call. Don't know if this was because we were going in on a timeshare basis and therefore did not have as much choice about where to stay as people who had booked in on a hotel basis. Having said that everthing was perfectly fine - the room was very clean and comfortable with TVs in both bedroom and lounge - towels were changed every day, new toiletries left and bed made - which is MOST unusual in timeshares. The staff were friendly and helpful - we did ask for a quiet room and we got one on the 8th floor but we were woken a few times at 6am by the truck emptying the rubbish, so not sure if we could have had a quieter room! We sunbathed a couple of days at the rooftop pool and it was well kept with plenty of towels and a heated pool. The position of Polo Towers is excellent for the strip - just 1 block away and central - we have stayed at several different timeshares in Vegas and this is definitely a good one!!

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PennySlotsAZ
Reviews.Content: OK, chicken littles, the sky is not falling! We received a phone call a few days before arriving at Polo Towers informing us of the 4 cases of Legionnaire's disease over the past 12 months. Educated ourselves via the internet about the disease. Phoned the doctor for recommendation. All systems are go. We stayed at Polo Towers, loved the staff, the room, the location, the amenities. Have been to Vegas numerous times, will go many more times and hope to stay at Polo again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: chsane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the studio suite. The room was nice! It was just enough room for my husband and me. It is right behind a few stores so you can just walk to the strip and get in all the action! This is our 4Th time to Vegas and we will definitely stay at Polo Towers again. The pool is so nice. They have these nice cabanas there but they are first come for serve. We really loved the extra security that they had... you have to use your room key to use the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed even with Legionnaire scare. Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Das42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I belong to Diamond Resorts Intl. Timeshares and made this reservation through them many months ago for a 1-bedroom suite for 10-23-08 thru 10-28-08 for my husband's birthday. The Polo Towers was one of their top-rated resorts. The day before we were to fly out, we received a phone call from the Polo Towers telling us about the Legionnaire problem. They did not volunteer to put us in another hotel, but they did say that we may want to get on the web and read about Legionnaire's and if we fell into any of the "high risk" categories of possibly getting it, we may want to postpone our trip to a future date. When I got on the web, it said people who are at high risk are the elderly (which we don't consider us that yet - we are in our early 40's), people who smoke (neither one of us have ever smoked), or people with a low-immune system (and neither one of us as far as we know have that), so we decided to go ahead and still go. We also doubted if the airline would let us change our flights to a future date without a huge penalty and we didn't know if Diamond Resorts Intl. would give us our timeshare points back if we didn't go and even if they did, we would have had to have used them before the end of the year or lose them, and both my husband and I have jobs that are not very easy to get time off of, so these were also reasons we decided to go ahead and go. We decided that when we got there and talked with the Polo Towers directly, if we thought it was too bad, we would ask them to move us or we would just go somewhere else on our own. When we got there, we were pleasantly surprised. It looked very clean and there were all kinds of young and old people wandering about the lobby and going in and out of rooms and the desk clerks were very calm and laid back. The only thing was that they were not very informative about the Legionnaire's scare. I tried to ask them specific questions and they just kept telling me to read the info packet they handed to me. It didn't really say too much except for that 4 cases had been reported to them of people who had stayed there that had contracted Legionnaire's - 2 from last year, and 2 from Sept/Oct. of this year. They said that Nevada Health & Environment were aware of it and that the Polo Towers had started treatment for it. Well, we decided to go ahead and stay. We checked into our room which was very nice. It had a king-size bed in the bedroom which was very comfortable along with a TV, closet with safe, and a small balcony (if you could call it that). It was just a very small 6 x 10 concrete area - room for one chair - if you sat in the chair, you couldn't see over the concrete. We had a view of the parking lot. The only noise we heard was the trash truck that came by early in the morning and I can't remember now, but I don't think it was every morning, just a couple of days during our 5-night stay. The bathroom was large with just a regular tub/shower combination and single sink, but with a large countertop. We did take short showers and left the doors to the bathroom open while showering so as not to make steam (don't know if this really helped with the Legionnaire's or not). There was also a very strong chemical smell coming from the water, which we assumed was the chemicals they were using to treat it. It smelled something like chlorine. The living room had a TV, stereo, couch, and chair and the kitchen had a full-size frig, stove, and microwave. Our TV wasn't working right when we got there, so we called Maintenance and they had it fixed immediately. We had rented a car also and talked to the valets a lot when we would drop off or pick up the car. They were very helpful and nice. The store they have inside the hotel is small, but has everything you might need - bottled water (which we drank instead of the faucet water), aspirin, eyeglass screwdriver, snacks, etc. (some of the things we purchased) and the people working in it were very nice too. We went up to the roof-top pool/hot tub one day just to see what it was like. It looked nice - kind of small, but nice. All in all, it was a good trip, as long as we don't end up getting the Legionnaire's. The web said you should see signs of it within 2-14 days after exposure to the bacteria and we have been home now for 13 days and so far, we are both fine. I would have strongly recommended this hotel to anyone if Legionnaire's wasn't a factor, but it is really up to you personally if you want to stay here until they get the problem fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Legionnaires Disease”
Reviews.Author: IowaBlitz
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for a 2 bedroom suite at the Polo Towers for 10/18/08 - 10/25/08. When we arrived, the lobby was so crowded we couldn't believe it, as we've been there previously and never ran into this. Well, the reason for the back up was explained to us when we finally got to the desk to check in. We were given a letter explaining that 4 cases of Legionnaires Disease had been reported there the previous week and we would have to sign a waiver to stay there, or they would book us elsewhere. We were told we could stay, just don't take showers or drink the water. Needless to say, we went elsewhere.....to the Luxor. Had 2 beautiul rooms and a great time. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Marissabiz
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Las Vegas last week and was a little worried about staying at Polo Towers after reading some of the reviews. When I got there this is what I found. It is conveniently located right on the strip. Just sits back about a half a block. You can walk or ride the bus anywhere. The staff was some of the nicest people on the strip. They all were very helpful and very sweet. Joel and Darma helped us with our luggage and both were so nice and funny too. The room we got was clean and beautiful!!!! I had a large Jaccuzzi bathtub in my bathroom along with two sinks one on each side of the bathroom. My bathroom even had a telephone in it. It was all tiled very nicely and the counter tops in the bathroom and kitchen were made of granite. My bedroom had a king size bed with a television and a balcony along with french doors that led into a full size kitchen that was stocked with everything you need including a dishwasher and dining room area. My stepson had his own queen size murphy bed in the livingroom area along with his own television and stereo. The second bedroom had its own balcony and queen size murpyhy bed and a bathroom so my friends had their own privacy. It also came with a microwave, sink and refrigerator. I was very happy at this place( I did not want to leave) and I will definitely go back there. What other people are complaining about, I am not sure? Maybe they thought that they were going to be staying at a Penthouse suite with Criss Angel?????????

Reviews.Title: “underated”
Reviews.Author: julsbythelake
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we were somewhat apprehensive about what we would find at Polo Towers. Here is what we found, courteous service from all staff members, a very clean and comfortable room with an awesome view. Polo is close to everything, half price tickets, major casinos, Miracle Mile shops are on the next block and the new city center will be directly across the street. Down side might be the size of the pool_it is barely three feet deep. All in all, it was very good and we are looking to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barry&Pat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the apolo Towers for a week in the middle of September 2008. Was a little apprehensive as I had read some of the reviews. I was nicely surprised when we got to our suite on the 15th floor of tower 2. The suite was very well presented and was immaculate. We had a one bedroom suite and as our daughter came with us we were very pleased with the size. The sofabed was a queen size and extremely comfortable. The kitchen area had full amenities with a huge oven. The balcony off the main bedroom was very small but was good to step out onto to view the strip which looked amazing. The bathroom had plenty of storage for all our stuff. There is quite a lot of construction in the area which does start early but didnt bother us. The only thing that woke us was the trash wagon at 7 in the morning. Other reviews stated they had trouble getting cabs but we had no problem at all to or from Polo Towers. Overall this was. a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at PT!”
Reviews.Author: Pookaloki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at PT with my best friend for 3 nights. We got a newly refurbished room with a strip view. The suite was spotless and had everything we needed. Having a kitchen was very nice, we were able to keep and reheat leftovers and saved a little money by doing so. We picked up a few groceries before we arrived as well. The suite had a modern feel, contemporary decor and plasma TV's. The location is awesome too, right next to Planet Hollywood and MGM Grand. They even had shuttles to the Fashion Show Mall and the Albertson's (grocery store). They only thing they don't have is room service, but they did provide a sizable list of local places that deliver, with menus. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the Noise About?”
Reviews.Author: dougjule
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 weeks in August 2008 at the Polo Towers after trading our 2 week timeshare in Mexico. We are seasoned Vegas tourists and always thought the Polo Towers would be nice to stay at. Believe it or not, not all the construction noise is on the strip, it's at the Polo Towers! At times it sounded like a jack hammer in the next room because of the air conditioning turning on and off. The water pipes also added to the symphony as did the running toilet. Also, our entry door was damaged by staff and was coming off the hinges because the cleaning staff jammed the doors open while in the room. It took over a week to get this repaired and we could only enter or leave the room with a strong shoulder to the door. And then, just under our window was the garbage pickup and every morning at 6 a.m. the banging and clanking began. You don't need an alarm clock! Linens used for our guests were not removed for a week. There was no intense cleaning of the unit and it was very dusty. No dishes were done by housekeeping and several days there was no bed making or towels provided. Other than the above, the lobby looks great, the location is fine, pool is nice but small and shallow, only 3' deep. The one really nice thing was the bed. It was very confortable and the pillows were to die for. Too bad for all the negativity.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Martydee
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay in a studio and use our points. Room was clean and murphy bed comfortable enough. However room a/c was extremely loud and shared door with next door room where neighbors made too much noise. Next time a real hotel and will use points in other timeshares

Reviews.Title: “Love Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: Fiebs
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in New Orleans for the Polo Towers in July this year. After reading reviews on this website, I was a little worried about it being run down.....don't be. It was like it was all spanking brand new! We had a one bedroom with pull out couch and it even smelled brand new when we walked in. The bed and pillows are "to die for". I wish I could find out where they got the pillows they are soooo comfortable! Our friends had a two bedroom, which is one side is just like the one bedroom and the other side is like an efficiency with a murphy bed. It was very nice also! The pool area was nice but there isn't a bar or restaraunt on the site...which didn't really matter because you have a full kitchen and you can bring your own. It's in a great area of the strip...and here is my only complaint...our room had a great view on the 9th floor facing the strip, but it was right behind the "hawiian marketplace" which is a fun place during the day, but at night it's very loud. People are still karaokeing at 3:00 am! And they play loud music all night. Luckily I always wear ear plugs (my husband snores!) and he snores so loud he wouldn't hear anything. Not the Polo Towers fault but you might want to ask for a higher up room or in a different location. Otherwise I was very pleasantly pleased with the Polo Towers. They even had a shuttle pick us up and 4:00 in the morning to take us to the airport! Great Time...and here's a little tip. Rent a car and go to the North End of the Grand Canyon! Awesome! Sorry I would have had pictures, but I lost my camera while I was in Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Updated Rooms and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: pvnjcmm
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I was very reluctant to book at the Polo Towers given the reviews, but I exchanged my timeshare week to stay there anyway because of the location. I went with a list of other hotels/prices in hand in case the rooms were as bad as the reviews indicated. I was pleasantly surprised to walk into the beautiful marble lobby. (I had to ask if I was at the right hotel). When we checked in (4 hrs early) to find out that all of the suites had been remodeled, I was ecstatic. The rooms were gorgeous. We had a 2 BR unit with plenty of room to spread out. There were LCD TVs , DVD players and ipod docking stations in every room. Everything was modern, clean and beautiful. The beds were REALLY comfortable, especially after a long day of walking. The location was perfect for us. The Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood were to the right and MGM was to the left of us. We rented a car (no parking fees) so we were able to drive to the north end of the strip without a problem. The Hawaiian Marketplace was directly in front of the hotel and was a great place to eat, shop and get a massage. There was an active construction site in front of the Marketplace, but we didn't hear any noise from there. I read the review about the air conditioner being loud. While I did notice it kick on and off, I wouldn't say it was the loudest i've ever heard. I'm used to sleeping with white noise anyway, so the hum of the a/c wasn't obnoxious to me. If you have to sleep in silence, I would imagine that it might be a problem. We're already talking about going back next year. The kids have a list of things they didn't get to see in the week we were there, so I will be back to the Polo Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Villas at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: rbjjm211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged our timeshare for a 1 BR at Polo Tower Villas. The unit was great and we had more room then we needed for the two of us. It does have a queen murphy bed in the living room if needed for extra guest. Location on the strip was great. Staff was accomodating and we liked the quietness of the place. Pool is on the basic side. Enough chairs and sunlight though so overall it works. I felt we made a good exchange and will use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: bonmyster
Reviews.Content: My friend a I took our daughters for a 21st birhtday celebration. Our experience was great. We were slightly worried after reading the reviews, but were pleasantly surprised. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which comfortably slept all six of us. The kitchen was all very nice as were the bathrooms. Although they only came in once during the week to change beds and do a thorough clean, they came everyday to change towels and empty garbages. The pool on the roof is not big, but it is very nice. We were always able to get chairs and towels. The access to the strip is great. We walked almost everywhere and on the rare occasion took a short cab ride to our destination. Everyone working the front desk area was very helpful. Checkin and checkout went very sooth and our luggage was safely stored so we could enjoy our day before our flights. All in all our stay was very enjoyable and I would recommend this hotel to all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Location on the main strip”
Reviews.Author: Meebo
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Interval International timeshare exchange. Good hotel. Located on the strip. Caught a shuttle from the airport to the hotel. Rooms good. Hotel opposite Bellagio, in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodGuy
Reviews.Content: Given some of the review, I had a little trepidation prior to booking a 2 bedroom at the Polo Towers. I am glad that I did though. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in one of the renovated suites in Tower 1. The place is elegantly appointed with LCD televisions in each room. There is a full kitchen in the 1 bedroom portion which was perfect for the family. The studio side has a microwave, sink, and fridge. The pool on the roof is good since you get a nice view around you. The odd thing I thought was that it is only three feet deep. However, given the number of people just hanging around in the pool with a drink in hand, it sort of made sense. For families with smaller children there is a water play park. There is a 1 foot deep pool with a shower in the midst and a place to run around with squirting fountains. Kids will love this. By far the best thing about the Polo Towers is the location. It is steps away from Planey Hollywood (formerly the Aladdin) as well as the MGM. Surrounding the property are the Marriott Grand Chateau as well as some other condominium projects. The location is perfect. As far as food is concerned there is the Hawaiian marketplace adjacent to the property and there are many food choices available. This is a great place to stay and I look forward to our next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Amateurs”
Reviews.Author: Polo_Sucks
Reviews.Content: I wanted to hire a piano player to play some music upon entering the lobby for my wedding night - I asked them if I could do so. They said yes. It turns out the piano had a protector of some kind over the keys, so the pianist couldn't play - time and time and time again, they were called by the piano player and myself, asking if they could do something so that this could be possible. They never responded - ever, not even once. What a lame group of turkeys.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: emt4u77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Polo Towers from May 17th-24th, We stayed in a Villa on the 10th floor 10208 & 10208A, it was a renovated room, very clean and comfortable, we rented a car and used the underground free parking, (there is also valet we chose to self park) Clean towels every day, and I asked for extras with no problem, since we were traveling as a family of 4, two adult children it was perfect, each of us had our own space, and the kitchen came in very handy, we saved money and calories by eating in breakfast and some lunches. The rooftop pool with the cabana's was very nice too, although the depth of the pool is 3 feet deep it is just enough to cool off, there was also a hot tub. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay their again”
Reviews.Author: sgoet
Reviews.Content: We traded through Interval for a one bedroom suite. We stayed in Rm 2001 for 6 nites. It was a renovated unit. Everything was in great condition. Our floor was quiet and smoke free. The balcony was small and unfortunately the Planet Hollywood sign blocked our view of the Bellagio fountain. But the place rates pretty well with me if that is the worst thing I can say. I am really surprised at some of the negative reviews I read. Maybe they were staying in an unrenovated unit? The pool was on the roof and very nice. The location was great, close the the best casinos, a wallgreens and mcdonald's. The staff was courteous and helpful. They cleaned our suite every day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Polo Tower Villas!”
Reviews.Author: mcb1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Polo Towers Villa during the week of April 18th. We had a two bedroom / two bathroom unit that we booked through our timeshare exchange with Interval International. I was a bit apprehensive beforehand due to some of the TripAdvisor reviews but could not have been more pleased once we arrived. It was wonderful! Our unit was just beautiful. My husband and I took my parents and there was plenty of room for the four of us. One bathroom had a Jacuzzi tub. The other had a large walk-in shower. My parents’ bedroom had a king-sized bed. Ours had a pull-down queen-sized Murphy bed, which we left down for the entire trip. (There was no sense in putting it back each day since we had a couch in the living room to use.) We were on the second floor and didn’t have much of a view, but we hardly noticed. The towels were replenished daily and the beds were made. The gorgeous full kitchen was great for making coffee in the morning and storing snacks. We easily could have cooked but we chose not to. The small convenience store on site was helpful. Perhaps the best thing about the Polo Tower is its location. It’s smack in the middle of the strip. We had an easy time getting to all of the casinos. Regarding cabs, there were a few times where we had to get the front desk to call one for us but they always showed up quickly. I have no idea why prior reviews complain so much about the cab situation. We did not use the rooftop pool but would have if the weather had been better. While it’s not a luxurious pool, it’s certainly adequate. It’s true that the Polo Towers does not have a casino on site. After all, this is not a resort hotel. We, however, loved this. It was nice to come “home” at the end of the night and be able to walk right up to our room without having to hike a mile through a huge smoke-filled hotel casino. It was such a peaceful place that you truly felt relaxed the minute you walked through the doors. We never heard any noise from construction or the strip. We were never once approached by timeshare representatives. Prior to our departure, I did receive a call from Polo Towers asking if we wanted to book a timeshare tour but I simply explained that we already own a timeshare and weren't interested. As I said, we weren’t approached at all once we arrived. In summary, we loved it here. I would go back in a heartbeat. My parents have stayed in many of the big Vegas hotels and even they agreed that the Polo Towers is their new favorite because they had so much room to spread out. I cannot say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Overall not great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nerdy_Dood
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the one bedroom suite. Had a nice sized kitchen with all the amenities. Also had a fold out sofa for extra bodies. The room itself was not bad. I was expecting worse, but the room I had was pretty updated with two plasma tv's and the bathroom was nice and spacious so I could stretch out..if you know what I mean. The best part about the whole thing was the location. Literally 2 -5 minutes away from the Hawaiian Marketplace that has a bunch of shops and restaurants. They actually had a live Hawaiian band playing at nights in the middle of the center, which was pretty cool. Decent mix of restaurants and shops to buy stuff you need. Hot tip: There's a place to buy show tickets and other things in the Hawaiian Marketplace called 1/2 price tickets...really cheap compared to buying direct or online. Really enjoyed myself and the only thing lacking from it was a good pool scene and an actual casino. Aside from that, would definitely go back, simply just for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tweetypie96
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th girls trip out to Vegas, having stayed at other timeshares and the Stratosphere previously. The Polo Towers was a gem! We did have a rental car, which was valeted, so never any problems getting in and out. The valets, and front desk staff were helpful, providing maps or internet directions to anywhere we wanted to go. We stayed the week of April 5th-12th, 2008. Since there is a kitchen area, our first stop was to the SuperWalmart to stock up on food (keep the eating out costs down)! We had a 1BR Jr Ste with the adjoining efficiency on the 15th floor of I believe Tower I (the elevators are closest to the resort grocery store). There were 4 of us, 2 shared the efficiency and the others shared the 1BR. There are 3 huge dressers in the space, so it is easy to unpack, hang clothes, and stretch out (I hate that living out a suitcase feeling). The 1BR had a huge bathroom, private balcony, king bed, and flat screen TV. The living area had a sofa bed couch, updated full kitchen area, and another flat screen w/DVD and stereo system. The eff had a Murphy bed, another sleeper couch, kitchenette, bathroom, desk area, balcony, and flat screen w/DVD player and stereo. We moved the couch in the eff out to the living area, rearranged some furniture, and made more space in the eff, while giving the living area more seating! The location set back from the strip, but still close to everything. We were located facing the MGM, NYNY, just above the driveway for the Polo Towers. The view was great! The resort does sit behind a shopping area that does have a bar w/drunk karaoke singers. We didn't hear them though, as we were not on that side. The walk from the strip up the driveway to the resort takes about 2 minutes, and unless you are walking alone and no one else is out (which doesn't happen in...it's Vegas remember), I had no concerns with safety. There are souvenir shops, a 7-11, CVS, Walgreen's, McDonalds all in the close area, and very handy! We did walk to Planet Hollywood, Monte Carlo (across the street), and MGM...drove everywhere else! The City Center that's being built is huge, can't wait to see it next year! There is a FatBurger in the next shopping complex, so that helped with the late night munchies! Also try the Harley Davidson Restaurant (the food was so good). Looking to get cheap drinks...Diabolo Cantina is across the strip, connected to Monte Carlo. From 3-6 is Happy Hour where various drinks/shots are $2! Thanks Pablo for being a great bartender!

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th stay at Polo”
Reviews.Author: ladyexecutive
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th year of staying at Polo Towers for Easter Week. When we checked in we were given a 2 bedroom unit on the 5th floor. As usual old unit in need of remodel...Polo towers has been remodeling all the units for the past 2 years!!! I think City Center will be built before they are finished!!! The next morning about 6:00 am the noise started!!! They were working on the floor above our units...It sounded like the ceiling was coming down. When I went to the desk they told me that I shouldn't have been given that unit unless i was aware that a lot of noise was expected. We were moved to one of the new remodeled units on the 10th floor. This was one of our best stays at Polo.... I do think that they are trying harder to meet guest needs. Alex at the desk was great!!! You can't beat the location,and the advantage of having a kitchen and living room! As noted by others...It is terrible getting a cab...There is a guy in a golf cart who will take you to Planet Hollywood. Just another one of the strange adventures that come with your stay at Polo Towers.......Best of luck to all who pick this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your room depends on who owns in...”
Reviews.Author: dljpdx
Reviews.Content: Even if you book through a hotel booking site, you may or may not be renting someone's time-share unit. In our case, we were renting a time-share unit, which was totally fine by us. The rate was reasonable, and the location was fine - not right on the strip, but just off. It was a studio with Murphy Bed. With the bed up, there were some cushions that formed a couch for seating 2-3 people. With the bed down, well, seating was on the bed. Room was quite small but we knew that going in - suitable for maximum 2 persons. You could squeeze 3 people on the bed and have a 4th sleep on the pile of cushions on the floor (as we did one night when a couple friends surprised us), but it's definitely not recommended (and may violate your agreement). Nice balcony with views (though view depends on what side you're on). Room was very clean and had pretty much everything you'd want for a weekend get-away: mini-fridge, small kitchenette with plates etc, full bath, TV, CD player, DVD player, radio. On-site mini-mart had anything you might have forgotten at home, plenty of other shops nearby. Took forever to get a taxi to show up, at any time of day. Again - your experience will vary with whomever owns the room, but in general it seemed the property was well-kept.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms- Center Strip”
Reviews.Author: traviseve
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room. Flat panel TVs in both living room and bedroom. Full kitchen was great. Full-size fridge, strove, sink, etc. Large bathroom with nice shower. Balcony and view was great. Rooftop pool was very nice with great views. I highly recommend the Polo Towers in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: SFWander
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-room unit that had recently been remodeled. It was clean, quiet, and very nicely updated. The staff were always incredibly accomodating and responded very quickly to our needs. We all enjoyed staying in our rooms and were pleasantly suprised at how nice everything was, and we will definitely stay there again. It's a major bargain in Vegas, and it's so close to everything. Yay for Polo Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TMH44444
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed there and will be the last time for sure. This place is a dump. It was not maintained at all and the staff was not friendly. My friend had this as her timeshare and sold it. The villas were supposed to be new and are very run down. The furniture was broken down and the doors did not latch properly. The room as just dirty. The only nice part we found was the lobby. Most of the staff was not helpful at all. The place is in behind the Hawaiin Marketplace and is scary to get to when its dark. You have to walk down a dark alley to get to it. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The room was supposed to be non-smoking but it didn't smell like it was. They did have nice soap and shampoo's. The hairdryer didn't work either. When we go back we wont be staying here again! Don't waste your time on their timeshare deals either, those were really mis-represented. Loved Vegas, hated Polo Towers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2 BD Suite”
Reviews.Author: 40something2
Reviews.Content: I like to write reviews of the places we have stayed in order for others to read before booking a trip because I read TA for the same reason. We booked 3 nights-4 days at the Polo Towers using my parents timeshare. My mother was celebrating her 67th birthday. The Polo Towers are very clean and the staff were also very nice. I'm not a fan of the location but once the City Center is completed and hopefully they get rid to the 2 strip malls out front, the place would be much better. The strip malls out front attract an undesirable crowd but we just didn't let it bother us too much since we drove most of the time. We had a 2 bedroom suite which is actually a 1 bedroom suite with an attached jr. suite for the 2nd bedroom. We were given a room overlooking the strip on the 14th floor right near the elevator. (We were exciting that we didn't have to walk the south 40 from the elevator). The rooms were one of the remodeled rooms and the decor was really nice with granite counter tops, and the colors were rich golds and browns. My parents stayed in the 1 bedroom suite side and my husband and I stayed in the jr. suite side. The jr. suite side had a separate entrance, small kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker, sink, and refrigerator. Bring your own coffee as they only provide one small sampler for your coffee maker.
