Also we had a hugh balconey and a hugh shower. There was only one sink and with the hugh shower the bath was small. (I wouldn't recommend a long term stay in just the jr. suite since it is a little small but with the attached 1 bedroom it was a hugh apartment). The 1 bedroom suite had a full kitchen with everything including a full size refrigerator and dishwasher. All utensils, plates, cups, etc are included. They provide shuttle service to the grocery store if you don't have a car. All in all the Polo Towers were nice (didn't check out the pool areas). It was a comfortable stay and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CharandMatt
Reviews.Content: All in all we found our stay at the Polo Towers very pleasant - the location was excellent, a very central spot on the strip and easy access to everything. The rooms were clean and comfortable, staff very friendly and the concierge was always more than helpful. Not the best hotel if you want all the glitz and glam of Las Vegas in your hotel (this is basically just a hotel, no shops, casino or anything on the complex) but all we wanted was a room to stay in as all casinos, shops etc in the other hotels were easily accessible and most places within walking distance - if not just a short bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Us - December 22-29”
Reviews.Author: OhioTraveler63
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to get a room at the Las Vegas Marriott. All rooms were booked, so they gave us a suite at Polo Towers. Check-in went smoothly and the concierge was very helpful with any information we needed. We stayed in Tower I on the 7th floor. There were six of us and it worked out great. The two rooms they gave us were connected, but they also had their own entrance, which worked out great. The kitchen came in handy. It is very expensive to eat out every meal in Las Vegas, so we kept food in the room for breakfast, lunch and snacks. Polo Towers is great when you want to get "away from it all". All of the glitz of Las Vegas can be a little overwhelming, and Polo Towers allows you to come back to nice, quiet accommodations. The only downside to our suite was the carpeting. It had many stains on it in the main living room. We did have to call maintenance because our refrigerator was not working. They took care of the problem right away by giving us a new refrigerator. I would definately stay at Polo Towers again.

Reviews.Title: “A good quiet vacation”
Reviews.Author: MNPokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Villas at Polo Towers" and were happy with our overall experience. We were never once asked to sit through any presentations, our room was very very quiet, the security is good (you need to use your room key to go up the elevators). The location can't be beat. The room was very, very clean. Our only issue would be the mattress - it seemed to be a bit worn (sagged in the middle w/o anyone even on the bed). Check in and check out were very fast. I recommend the VILLAS. I hear the suites are going to be upgraded and will also be great, but I don't know too much else about the SUITES.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jaabda
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three friends in a one bedroom suite. The living room had a queen murphy bed, the bedroom had a king. The decor was really nice, the room was equiped with everything we needed when we weren't out doing the Vegas stuff. The bathroom was big, two sinks, one on each side of the bathroom so plenty of room for four to spread our stuff out. The place was very clean, had a great convenience store and very helpful concierge service. You can get a cheap shuttle to and from the airport, no line when I was there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WillyPickering
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a 2-bedroom suite. It was ideally set up perfectely for us. My wife brother and his wife had a totally seperate entrance with their own keys to enter from the outside hallway, and we had our own keys to enter the main suite which led us into the living room, full kitchen and the main bedroom with a king size bed and a full wash room with double sink. There was a small hall way which then took us into the second bedroom which had a small kitchenette, a very large shower and a balconey with a murphy bed.(pull down from the wall). The room was very clean, with all new furnitures and a fully equipted kitchen. We had daily light maid service (made beds, change towels, and garbage removal). On the fourth day they change all the bed linens, vacuum, wash dishes along with the other daily service.Polo Towers is ideally located on the Strip, close to everything that one would want to do in Las Vegas. Check in took no more than 5 minutes and because our room was ready we were able to go in early. The roof top pool was excellent with a hot tob and two gas Bar-B-Q which is available for your use. We prepare supper on the Bar-B-Q one evening and immediately it was cleaned by their staff. The only problem I had was the A/C fan in the main bedroom was noisy, but after informing the front desk, it was attented immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Villas were Fine”
Reviews.Author: Jacobia
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers Villas were fine. We had 2 bedroom villa through timeshare exchnge. The entrance to the property was hard to find. The staff was great. Don't know anything about the suites. Didn't experience any maintenance issues. Maid service could be better. Location was great. Don't eat at the China Resturant at the Market Place Hawaiian Village. BAD FOOD and COLD FOOD. Perfect place if wanting to not be in Casino atmosphere all the time. Would Stay at this place again even though I have made better exchanges with Interval. Compare to other hotel/casinos this is not 5 star. Maybe 3/4

Reviews.Title: “polo towers nasty room”
Reviews.Author: patsy24
Reviews.Content: spent 2 weeks in a 2bdrm at polo towers last week. we have been going there every year for the past 5. this trip we had the room from hell. the previous guests used the dishwasher and flooded the carpet in the living room which stayed wet for the 1st week. broken towel rack. dirty and dusty furnishings. bathroom sink drain not working. backed up bath tub drain. dirty a/c filter which whistled. maid didnot show up 4 out of 14 days. received coffee and shampoo only twice. all these were resolved with a few phone calls. but the maids are pretty poor. the mid week cleanup/sheet change/vacuum was less than stellar. the first mid week cleanup the maid washed a dish under running water wiped dry and put in cabinet. we concluded we better wash all dishes whether we use them or not to avoid getting sick. though the furnishings were excellent maid service was not. we had a knock on the door late one afternoon. it was 2 security guys and 2 guys with spray bottles to pour chlorine in the sink drains. i thought this was very strange. we will definately go back, but we have had better stays there. other than the maids, the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tsully11
Reviews.Content: This was actually the second time we had stayed at the Polo Towers. The first time was a couple of years ago and the room was perfect. This time around we had a much smaller room that has not been renovated yet. It was very clean, However the first room they put us in the toilet did not function properly nor did the cable on the TV. Called maintenance the second night. he suggested that we be moved to another room. They were very accomadating with the move and was done promptly. The next room was as clean with a nice comfy bed. The first day we were there (in second room) they did not bring clean towels. The second day they gave us clean towels but did not take dirty ones away. Nor did they take the trash out of our room. In the afternoon I went down to the customer relations to tell them about it. They said they would make a note about it. Would I stay at the Polo Towers again? You bet! Just because they have a employee that is lazy and not doing their job isn't gonna spoil the rest of the experience. Tell someone what you don't care for let them correct it and get on with enjoying YOUR vacation. It will work out. Polo Towers great location to almost everything. My favorite people at the Polo Towers - The valet group. They are great....

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: tcordero
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip...within minutes walk of the Bellagio, Paris, Alladin, Monte Carlo, MGM. No restaurants on premesis, there is a convenience store with good items at descent prices. Restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself needs renovation. Our suite was clean, but starting to look run down. No free internet. Definitely not a luxurious place to stay, but location is great. Not sure if I would return if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Caleyx2
Reviews.Content: The Suites (and Villas) at Polo Towers is a time share. I think it has the best time share location in Las Vegas. It has a Strip address and is across from the Monte Carlo and between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood. We exchanged in for a two bedroom with no problem, but we arrived late and there were no non-smoking, two bedroom suites left. We accepted a one bedroom for the first night and they were able to transfer to a two bedroom the next day without any problem. We were not interested in any of the trips and tours available, but we did use the concierge to book tickets for the Blue Man Group. They handled it well and we even got a complimentary seat upgrade when we arrived at the theater. There was a small convenience store that sold all the basics (no alcohol) at fair prices. There was no gambling on premises. The pool was a rooftop, 22nd floor, 3 feet deep, 20"x50", family friendly (until 5:00 P.M.) affair with hot tub. There is a separate children's pool. The pool can't compare with those at some of the other resorts, but there were always lounges and cabanas available. We spent most of our time there during the days and enjoyed it. Our suite was large, clean and well-equipped. Staff was friendly and helpful. We checked out at 10:00 A.M., but our shuttle wasn't going to pick us up until 8:10 that night. There was no hospitality room, but we asked for and got courtesy keys for the pool. One problem: it has a Las Vegas Blvd. address, but it is set back a little from the Strip. If you didn't know it was there you might miss it. Access was though a deserted former food court, or down what amounted to alley ways. My wife said she would have felt a little uncomfortable entering or leaving the building alone at night. While there are newer and glitzier time shares in the area, the location means that if I "trade in" again, this would probably be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas3232
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip between MGM and Planet Hollywood. Easy going environment, many resturants nearby and you can escape the casino crowds. Nice suites that need a little updating around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: solarsister
Reviews.Content: First off, this property is located in the perfect location on the strip. We were directly across from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops. Good restaurants in that mall, and the Ocean Grill had excellent food and prices. Higher-priced but still excellent were Lombardi's and Pampas. The only negative experience was our check-in. The room had not been prepared. (This was about 11:30 pm) We said we were going out and the front desk contacted housekeeping and told them to get moving. When we came back about an hour later we were told the room was ready. Nobody had touched it. The final straw was the dirty bathroom. We were promptly moved to another room and from there on out we had no problems. The staff was friendly. The rooms need to be upgraded, but our suite was comfortable and clean and I would certainly stay there again. It isn't the Marriott, but I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Towers was great!”
Reviews.Author: matthewandtricia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 3 year old daughter and 1 year old son just returned from a week in Las Vegas. My parents own a timeshare and we chose the Polo Towers. Vegas is a wonderful city to visit. We had a 2 bedroom condo on the 16th floor. There were no problems with the room, a little outdated, but renovations are to begin in August, floor by floor I guess.... There was a big construction project across the street which was noisy, but alot of construction in Vegas anyways... RIght across the street from Monte Carlo, location was perfect. The childrens pool was reallly nice to have, always clean, staff friendly, etc etc... Constant security, so you always felt safe even at 4 am. Had a full kitchen, with a noisy dishwasher, but that was the only problem that we had...Would definitely stay here again, easy walking distance to all the casinos on the Strip. As far as the regular rooms that they rent to the public, we had no experiences with those, but the suites were SWEET! VIVA LAS VEGAS!

Reviews.Title: “great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jrzgrlsailor
Reviews.Content: time share exchange This was a great resort centrally located on the vegas strip. the concierge was very very knowledgeable, and we utilized this service frequently. there was a ton of information available on local activities, and public transportation was readily available in a variety of forms, trolley, shuttle, cabs, etc. Although there was no on site restaurant, there were plenty right outside the door! Gambling was also a short walk next door away!. The only less than impressive things were that the pool was closed while we were there, there was some noise from construction, and the room decor was a little dated with an uncomfortable pull out sofa. Overall, one of the best vacations we have had. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Towers aren't luxury but they are nice”
Reviews.Author: Tonitaxes
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the Polo Towers and I already wish I was back. I had a 2bdrm overlooking the strip which was fantastic. I was really scared of staying here after reading a lot of negative reviews and I called a emailed Diamond Resorts and after finally getting someone to acknowlege my concerns I was told that the rooms were as they are on the web site and if I had any problems, they would be handled when I got there. Fortunately, I was satisfied with the accomodations that I had. The rooms were large and clean. They could use better towels and linens but that would be my biggest complaint. The staff was friendly. The rooms were cleaned everyday. The view of the Strip (if you get it) was amazing. Sometimes traffic was so bad that it was hard to enter the lot but you can use the back entrance. I have no real complaints and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nic27
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about staying here after I read some of the reviews. But my worries were put to rest as soon as we walked through the reception. The staff were polite and helpful on check in and out. Our room was clean and very comfortable. It had everything we needed and more. The pool was great and always clean. The view from our room was great. overlooking some of the strip. We would definitley would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck, don't bother with this time share.”
Reviews.Author: numba1goalie
Reviews.Content: Coming to the Polo Towers from the Signature - MGM Grand was probably a bad idea because Polo Towers had a lot to live up to. My Grandfather owns a week at Polo Towers and I have used it a few times in the past with no problems. It was this trip that revieled Polo Towers age. If you would ever imagine staying at a hotel that really goes that extra mile to make sure your room is clean and orderly, make those last minute reservations, or even bring you a couple of extra towels, you've found the wrong place with Polo Towers. It really started with check-in. I was pushed aside in line by a very disturbing incoming guest. She was livid about something and didn't care about standing in line. The front desk whitness the whole thing, and didn't bother to ask her to wait for a manager, or perhaps wait in line (we all know this is not the right thing to do anyways though). Check in was a breeze. I was however very disappointed with their check-in/check-out policy being 4PM check in, 10:00 AM check out! Arriving to the room was imbarassing. Being I had some of my friends with me, I imagined they were expecting me to pull a rabbit out of a hat like I did by finding that gem Signature. Our first welcome into the room was via a paper warning sign placed on the carpet, saying "please take off your shoes if they are wet". What a welcome huh? Scanning the room, you can tell the furnature needs help quick fast. The couch and armchair's apolstry needed help, the carpet was well worn, the windows dirty, th kitchen freshly mopped only to have them push the hard to reach items under the fridge. YUCK! Our bedrooms were bottom of the barrel. Both King beds were well used with large body imprints on each side. The bed spreads and sheets smelly and looking like they were pulled from the Travellodge below us. I would assume that they do not seperate the bedding fromt heir smoking and non smoking rooms as these sheets smelled of smoke very bad. The credenza in front of the bed proved warn too as the laminate on the front of one of the drawers was ripped off showing the true colors of below. On a good note, after getting a little settled in, we called down to housekeeping for two extra rollaway. I figure they would have an extra charge for these, but found that to be unture, they were free. After only waiting for maybe 5 minutes, the doorbell rang, and two rollaway beds were brought in. A funny thing about 5 minutes later, the same lady brought us two more rollways. We happily declined, letting her know that there must have been a mix up, we already have two(as I was pointing at the two we hadn't even moved out of the way yet). At check in. I had requested a room which was strip view. The room he picked out for us was a room that actually was in the corner of the capital i (Imagine one lines crossing the top and bottom of the capital letter "i") shaped building. Thus, we basically shared a view of Planet Hollywood & Travelodge with another balcony located about 2 feet away, can you say "Awkward"? All in all, I think I will pass the next time my Grandfather offers me a couple of nights at this place. I would rather pony up the additional $620 for two more nights at the Signature.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal - the best timeshare location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Catella9
Reviews.Content: What a great Vegas experience! This was the third timeshare facility that we have have stayed in Las Vegas and the best so far! We recently purchased this timeshare site unseen- what a deal. From the moment you drive up to the moment you leave the staff is very attentative to every detail. The location of the resort is on center of the Strip. If you want to stay in a 5 star resort this is it! This the way Las Vegas experience is meant to be!

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: Maazy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Polo Towers 3/23-3/30 and was happily surprised. After reading some negative reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect. The villas were beautiful; very clean, well-maintained and comfortable. The staff was friendly and professional whenever I dealt with them. (This was a time share exchange.) I saw the Phantom (spectacular), Mama Mia (fun) and Lance Burton (unbelievable and I was seated in the front row!). I tried some restaurants I had never been to and would recommend all of them: Mesa Grill and Rao's (Caesar's), Olive's (Bellagio), Emeril's New Orleans Fish House (MGM) , Grand Lux Cafe (Venetian) and Market City Caffe (Monte Carlo). Some were a little pricey but it was my vacation and the meals were worth every penny. I played slots from Mandalay Bay to the Venetian and did well at Caesar's, MGM and Monte Carlo. This was probably one of the best vacations I've ever had: fun, relaxing, exciting. What more could I ask?

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place”
Reviews.Author: pirviii
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay. We used the properties flex time for 5 days the last week of March. The weather wasn't the greatest, but that isn't the resorts fault. Eventhough we find the units nice, we are looking forward to the upgrades. The furniture and cabinets were showing there age. Looking forward to fututre stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Margob111
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have obtained a rental from Craigslist - paid the owner for it, called the Polo Towers to confirm my reservation, didn't think to bring my receipt from the credit card company proving payment. They told me I had been charged one night's rental on my cc yet I had been charged for two nights and had a confirmation from the owner...got that straightened out and went up to the room. Good location on the Strip but definitely needs a facelift. I found out this morning that the cabs boycott Polo Towers so plan on waiting at least 30 minutes for a cab. Staff was aware of problems but rather nonchalant about it. The cab experience was too stressful for me. Since this was our son's 21st birthday, we rented a room at the Jockey Club for him and two of his friends and had to wait for the cab to pick us up plus then had to go get them. Had a problem checking out as well - front desk staff insisted I owed for another night - finally got that straightened out. Since this was Spring Break for a lot of people, hotel rooms were expensive so I can't complain about the price, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sjones9090
Reviews.Content: My sister and I celebrated my birthday in Las Vegas Nov '06. We stayed at my timeshare Polo Towers 5 star timeshare (7 nights)which is located right on the strip within walking distance of many attractions and hotels and casinos. So we parked our cars, free at the Towers, and saved a bunch of money for transportation. My one bedroom timeshare sleeps 4 with master bedroom and sleep sofa in living room, and one bath. There is a full kithchen which comes in handy for preparing breakfast and lunch. Even though you are in Vegas with plenty of eateries around, prices are going up. Not like they once were where you could get a 5 course meal for $3.99. No more! So the kitchen comes in handy. Room was clean, comfy, good housekeeping services, and a serious home stereo theatre! The Hawaiaan Market place located in the front of Polo Towers is a bonus. Has a mini market, sovenirs store, etc. but best of all it has an open area for dining and watching the free entertainment of a live band playing carribean music from 12n to 10 at night. There were also dancers performing Hawaiaan dances. Other pluses. I bought my timeshare off of ebay which included a deed and the mortage was fully paid for, for $2999! My annual maintenance fee is $589. Where can you stay in Vegas for $589 with full kitchen, great location, free entertainmnet, and free parking? In addition, Polo Towers belongs to II excahnge company anf for a fee I can travel just about anywhere I want to go especially since Las Vegas is a hot travel commodity. I highly recommend Polo Towers for the place to stay in Las Vegas. sjones9090

Reviews.Title: “No Go Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: flyingquant
Reviews.Content: For Las Vegas, Polo Towers offers below average accomodation. The Good: Great loaction The bad: -The main door to the bathroom had a sliding door that wouldn't shut completely. -Paint was peeling off the walls. -The staff wasn't the friendliest. -Most hotels in the area offer wireless internet acces from you room. The only internet acces offered was in the loby at the price of 10USD/hr It was my first trip to Vegas and I stayed at a few properties while I was out there. Polo Towers was the last place I stayed. It was sub par in comparison to the rest. I felt like I was on Myrle Beach rather than Las Vegas. If you have other options then I would go for them rather than stay at Polo Towers.

Reviews.Title: “it was o.k. but rember you are second in line as a guest the staff come 1st”
Reviews.Author: Mark.dUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: You can see that they tried, but not succeded, it lacks something........ not a scrap of furniure on the balcony, The rooms need a re dec. What anoyed us most "YOU CAN NOT" AND I REPEAT, " NOT" USE THE LUGGAGE CARTS TO TRANSPORT YOUR LUGGAGE. we tried twice to use the carts and were stopped by security so we struggled with 2 suitcases and 4 bags to the elevator and to the car. you had to pay someone to collect your luggage for you. it must be the only hotel in the world where you can not use the luggage carts yourself. the car park all the spaces near to the hotel elevators are reserved for staff members, the paying guests have to park furthest away from the elevators. and woe betide if you park in them you get a ticket. Be prepared for plenty of messages on your room phone every day trying to sell you something. Don't ask the concierge for anything unless you are buying something, they don't want to know. Security is 1st class god there all over the place, but beware if you want to stop and unload. they will not allow you to do so. PLEASE DON'T FORGET THE STAFF COME 1ST GUESTS ARE SECOND IN LINE. otherwise ideal location, directly set back off the strip between Mgm and the Alladin. Ask for a high floor if your at the front the smell from the indian restaurant is strong and the noise from the market place in front of the hotel can be noisy. i would stay there again if i could not get in anywhere else, we paid about $84 dollars a night. we have had cheaper and better, mark

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: MOintheOC
Reviews.Content: Booked an owners week (arriving on 12/26 and departing on 12/31) in the villas. Since our arrival date was a Tuesday, most of the higher floors were already taken (Friday is the standard arrival date). Ended up on the second floor (non smoking) on the back side of the building. The units (2305 and 2305A) were in great shape. The furniture was well maintained, carpet was clean and the bedding (including the matresses) was very comfortable. Kitchen and bathrooms were fully stocked (dishes, utensils, towels etc...) and in good working order. Valet parking was complimentary and bell service was very prompt. My only complaint is that the smell of smoke came through the air ducts in the master bedroom. If I was more sensitive to the smell it might have been an issue. Overall, I was very impressed. After reading some of the reviews I was not sure what to expect. I would definately stay there again as well as recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better In Vegas:Trust Me”
Reviews.Author: rx007
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare and exchange thru Interval. Stayed one week Oct 15-22, 2006. If you are exchanging -- there are definately better places to stay. This hotel is outdated and needs a facelift. 1) Make sure to get the highest floor possible. Facing the strip is not such a good thing at this place. If you face North directly below you is the garbage dump area. Garbage pickup is done daily between 6:45-7:15AM -- They produce the loudest clunking sounds that it wakes you up, and if you want to sleep late -- forget it ! We mentioned this to their management team -- they didn't seem to care. 2) You cannot actively control your own a/c unit from your thermostat. You have to call down to maintenance if you want your air turned on -- then they turn it off at their leisure. I had to call 4 times in a 4 hour time period to keep getting them to turn it on. 3) It is a timeshare -- but they are not as pushy as some other timeshare resorts. They will give you a 90 minute presentation if you want for a free show or dinner. They also take you to the new Marriot Grand Chateau being built directly behind them. They have completed one tower and are building four. I would recommend trying to exchange to the Marriot Grand Chateau -- they at least have much nicer facilities and are up with the times. 4) The pool is on the top floor (23rd). It is small and has a wall around the top, so you can't see much of the strip or anything for that matter. The water is always pretty chilly and is only about 3 feet deep. The hot tub is ok though. 5) You need your room key to get anywhere on the elevator, so be sure to have it with you at all times. 6) The mini-mart is ok at best, no alcoholic beverages though -- and that is there downfall there. 7) The fitness area is in a totally different area-- not even in the same building. It is located in the Hawaiian Market Place directly in front of Polo Towers. 8) If you need a cab -- call well in advance -- cab drivers don't like to come to Polo Towers if they don't have to. 9) The kids pool area is located on the North Side directly next to the garbage dump area -- it is very shady there so the water is pretty cold there all the time. I personally think that there are other places in Vegas to exchange to, that are much nicer and much more comfortable than Polo. If you should have any questions feel free to contact me directly at GarzaRx007@aol.com I will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great deal for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rtsmudbug
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare exchange from the Palms resort in Orlando. Overall our experience is good and I don't think there is a lot more they could do to 'fix' any of the items we weren't ecstatic about. We stayed in the 'newer' Villa section which has received better reviews. I've over heard other guests mention that some of the rooms on the Suite side are newly remodeled, hopefully fixing some of the complaints elswhere. We stayed in room 7304, which I personally wouldn't recommend for two reasons - it is lower to the ground and the street noise at night reverberates between the two towers, and kept waking up 3/5ths of our party (two of us were smart enough to take Lunesta). The front desk is well aware of this problem and hands out ear plugs...thoughtful touch, but a sign they realize there is a problem. It was worse on weekend nights - the sound is from the Hawaiian Marketplace where some band or piped in music went all night long. (my wife said it was still going at 5am). The second reason to get a different room is the view - my dad at first was offered a room on the 23rd floor. It was a handicapped room which I think is why he turned it down. They beat us here from the airport otherwise I would have grabbed that room right away. The view is better, plus being a tall person I've found handicapped rooms are usually larger in size than regular rooms. Which brings me to my only real complaint - these rooms, while nicely decorated, furnished, and clean, are the smallest timeshare suites we've had, comparing with resorts in Orlando, Aruba, Cancun, southern California, New Orleans, and I'm forgetting a few. The bedroom is 'tight' with less than 2 feet between the foot of the bed and the TV dresser cabinet. The closets are small. The main living room is cramped, albeit with nice furniture and big 46" flat screen tv with DVD/VCR and a stereo. When the Murphy bed is down, you have to pile all the moveable furniture in the 'dining area'. In the 2nd bedroom, it is also small with no room for anything once the Murphy bed is down. With it up, it is a nice sitting room. That being said, realizing we have a 2 bedroom unit with a full and half kitchen in Vegas for an exchange that only cost $149 for the week...I'd stay here again. Location is good - a 5 minute walk to Aladdin, 10-15 minutes to MGM, 10-15 to Monte Carlo. The kids water park area is closed (seasonal) but our 2 year would love it. We also booked another room here for the same time for my wife's employees (all in town for a convention) so the bargain is even better and they've all enjoyed the room much more than a hotel room. The bathrooms are very nice, equipped with double vanities in the master (one vanity bathrooms always get too crowded on vacation, to us anyway). There are coin operated washer/dryers on several floors (another 'downer' since most places have them included in rooms). The front desk staff and housekeeping are excellent. Any request we had was attended to promptly (more blankets, suggesting ear plugs, directions, etc.) and they were friendly and eager to help. They also offer a couple of show tickets if you take a 90 min tour of the Marriott Grand Chateau property next door. We haven't taken them up on it...yet.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Filmstar
Reviews.Content: This was a time/share exchange arranged through Interval International.After the dissapointment on arrival to learn that we were given a studio (a room with pull out bed) and no bath just a fixed shower - our swap was a one bedroom - we were offered a wonderful one bedroom suite which was excellent but had to pay extra charge but well worth it. Polo Towers was in a great location, very clean,room tidied every day,clean towels,toiletries and coffee. Security was first class felt very safe. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “excelent view”
Reviews.Author: DAMAYA
Reviews.Content: this was my firsttrip to vegas and the polo towers was a beautiful and relaxing pLACE!!e to stay. I'll be returning as soon as ican save some money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: eddie3500
Reviews.Content: Has a Vacation Owner and first time staying at the Villas of Polo Towers it was Great very clean staff member very polite would stay there again with NO PROBLEMS

Reviews.Title: “Go ANYWHERE else”
Reviews.Author: Rick-from-CO
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers is awful. It's old. It's dirty. It's not well taken care of. (My pictures will tell the story.) I just left Las Vegas on the 11th of September, 2006 after a two day stay on the 15th floor of the Polo Towers. Forget the fact that I couldn't get into a unit until 5:00 p.m. when check-in time is at 3:00. When I finally got a room, I was appalled at it's condition. The windows looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years. There were tains on the carpet and on the sofa (I hope it was coffee). There was rust and mold buildup around the caulk and tile in the bathtub. The walls couldn't have seen paint or even a sponge in a very long time. There was dirt and grime in the corners and along the baseboards...I could go on and on. (Again, see the pictures). It was terrible. I knew when I went that I wasn't going to get a five-star resort but I was expecting something along the lines of a three to four star hotel. What I found was a Motel 6 at best. It would be great for a group of college kids who go to Vegas and spend very little time in their room and who have no real discerning standards - whose goal is to pack a lot of people into a reoom and spend as little as possible on accomodations in order to have more money for beer. Honestly, if you don't have to have a condo, for the same money, choose one of the hotels. Even Circus Circus or the Imperial Palace would beat this place. The building is surrounded on all four sides by either a driveway or an alley. The new children's pool area was built on the north end of the building. To access this area, you have to walk through a loading dock driveway and smell the buildings dumpsters. (I have a phoo of this as well.) The smell was very unpleasent to say the least. I heard that there was a bar near the top of the building offering great views of the strip. It's been closed. The rooftop pool does not offer any great views because the walls are too high. I felt that exposure the the pool water for more than about five minutes was to risk hypothermia. I'm not trying to be unfair here. I have often come to tripadvisor to research hotels but have never written a review before. I felt strongly enough about The Polo Towers that I wanted to warn other potential renters to think otherwise. If you do go, ask for a room on the east side of the building - away from the strip. There is a complex on the west side of the building with an outdoor theater/stage where bands play until midnight on the weekends. It gets very loud on the west side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Worst time share experience ever”
Reviews.Author: teetee5
Reviews.Content: Ok so we just came back from one of the worst time share experiences of my life time. We have traveled all over the world with our time share and I must say this was the worst ever. We arrived and checked in. About an hour later, while we were in our room, the door opened and another family came walking in, they had a key. The front desk said they made a mistake. (pretty big mistake if you ask me. What if we were not there, would our money still be there) No one ever told us about the after hours club that is located in the hotel parking lot. It opens at 4 am and the music sounds like its coming from our living room. The club is opened thursday friday and saturday. We have a small infant and went on vacation alone to get some rest. Well we got no sleep on these nights. And when you call the front desk to complain they say, sorry we know but there is nothing we can do. I understand that, but you would think someone would have wrote this in their reviews and no one did.. The front desk, bell hop and the entertainment desk acted as if we were bothering them anytime we asked a question. I tried to get tickets to a show, however the 3 girls behind the counter who were doing absolutly nothing but socializing could not find the time to help us. Forget about getting a cab from here because none of them want to be inconvenienced by traveling through the out of the way parking lot. (thats what the cab driver told us and the manager of the towers) The pool upstairs on the roof is clean but very small and only 3 feet. There is no where to get a drink or snack. My room was clean however both sinks were clogged with hair and the shower was also. It took three days for someone to remove the hair so the water would drain. Will never go back here and hope that who ever is reading this will not book this place

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Polo Towers Villa”
Reviews.Author: Debb54
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas staying at a time share which was the courtesy of a very good friend. We cannot thank her enough as the Villa we stayed in was more than we expected. We did have both sides so sleeping the 5 of us was not a problem at all. Very spacious and every bit as charming as seen on their web site pictures. We did put the large kitchen area to use also, found it to be well-equipped. The front desk personnel were very helpful and whenever we had a request such as picking up a bag we put outside for trash they were there immediately, aided us with our Lake Mead Tour reservations (which is a must do too). The pool area was very clean and pleasant. At first we thought with the pool being shallow would be a bother but instead was a delight as there were no kids doing cannon balls, etc. Hot tub and pool very clean. The rooms were quiet, we never heard neighbors, never were we bugged to see the time share for purchase, etc. Walking out front to the strip was a stone's throw away. Felt very safe also as they do have a keycard needed to use the elevator, etc. The small store in the Polo Towers had all the little things we needed along with fair prices. Would love to go back there again next year, all 5 of us were very pleased. Thank you for making our week in Vegas enjoyable from simply a relaxing point of view that Polo Towers afforded us when our feet were tired and we needed pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm.... not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend had a timeshare there and this was the 1st time we stayed there since she purchased it, it was not at all what we expected. The room (villa) was not very big. We had numerous problems from the start. The sliding glass door did not lock and the screen did not slide, the bathroom always had a sewer smell to it. We moved twice when we were there, the 1st non-smoking room we had smelled awful. They had removed the lounge that had a view on the 19th floor and made it into offices. The towers are in behind the HawaiinMarketplace and you have to walk down an alley to get in the towers, local people cautioned us to be careful the the travellodge that is beside it was a "bad area".. we did not see anything going on while we were there but there was a cruiser parked in a lot beside Polo Towers a couple times. It was not as nice as the unit we were showed when we toured the place in 2004. My friend was very disappointed and she wants to sell it, especially after seeing the other timeshares that are there. We could hear the cleaning people cleaning the other units and people partying around us. We asked for chairs to sit out on the balcony and the new laws say its a fire hazzard so you can't even sit out on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Good People, NOT so Clean Unit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare for the Suites at Polo Towers. This was our first visit in 5 years. When we arrived at midnight, check in was great! Then we went to the Suite. It was filthy. There were linens missing on the bed. So I called down and requested another room. Got the key, went to that room. I couldn't believe that things were worse in that Suite than the previous one. The Sofa/Murphy bed was broken, the floors and furniture were outrageously filthy. Got another room, it was better, but spoke with the Customer Service the next morning. Our room and furniture were cleaned and the staff was very kind. Just don't believe that should have occurred since we pay annual maintenance fees. We will not stay there again until we are assured that things are turning around.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Suites at The Polo Towers. They do sit back about 1/2 block from the strip. There is a small marketplace that sits in front of it. They did have kereoke and a band that played at night maybe until 12:00? We could hear it. Our unit faced the strip and the marketplace. No restaurants in the tower. There is a small store inside the tower. There are two drug stores close by with food etc... The unit it's self was on the 8th floor. We looked onto the strip however there is a lot of construction going on everywhere. We looked down at the rooftop of the marketplace. Inside the unit it is nice to have a living area, kitchen, bed and bath. My husband and I would rather have that then just a hotel room. We did get clean towels, soap, shampoo and coffee each day. They did make the bed... short of. We took a smoking room hoping that it would not smell. Wrong! It did! The king size bed was fine. We felt safe and had no problems walking to the other casino's. You do run into the people on the street trying to give you stuff and sell you timeshare's. They seem to be quite heavy in that area. We have stayed here for the last two years and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “lot of aggravation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Polo Towers from 11/26 - 11/30. Had to check out early (were booked til 12/3) due to the fact that we got sick from the lack of heat and the inability of the maintenance staff to fix it. We were even moved to another unit, still no heat. Not worth the aggravation. Would never stay there again. Very unresponsive desk staff. Refused to believe there was a problem even though the maintenance crew was in the unit trying to fix the heat (broken compressor and switch) at the time we were leaving. We felt like we were on trial. Clerk claims to have credited us for one night (totally unacceptable to us)since we lost $700, not to mention the trip being ruined due to our becoming ill. They seriously need to get their act together if they want to sell time shares.

Reviews.Title: “we are already booked to stay again next year”
Reviews.Author: MIkkinJay
Reviews.Content: my husband and I exchanged half of our time share to get a one bedroom at the polo towers. we had booked over the internet many months in advance so I was a little nervous that there was no further contact. Once you have your confirmation e-mail that is it. we didn't need to park because my dad lives out that way and picked us up at airport...we had waivered on the need for a rental and finally decided we didn't need one...we won't get one next time either. the desk clerks were great and since it was our first time in vegas, we asked for a strip view when we checked in. they checked availability and we got one on the 11th floor. maybe this is a much nicer floor than the 15th, but we enjoyed it. granted, it was not as posh as the westgate we stayed at in orlando but definately better than an average 3 star. the location was great and we loved our view. our only real complaint was that the onsite store closed early and there are no vending machines anywhere for those soda cravings at 2:00am when you're wondering in for the night. the pool was under construction when we were there so can't comment on that, and since it was February wasn't a priority for us. bottom line: great location, nice people (we were never hassled by exchange people), and a quiet place to get away from the casinos to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the Villas at Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: starrynights
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at the Villas at Polo Towers. In previous visits to Las Vegas we have stayed at Aladdin and last year in Paris which was beautiful but we exchanged a week through Interval Int. to get the Villas and we have to say that we were not disappointed with the quality of the unit. Everything looked new and to have the convenience of a separate living area and kitchen as well as the bedroom was a bonus as opposed to just the hotel room. We admit to visiting the strip/casino areas for hours on end - before anyone says why do you want the extra space but it does make a difference as we have seen after years of just hotel rooms before we had timeshare. This exchange if far superior than some in europe but maybe not as luxurious as the Marriotts in Florida - if that helps. The staff were courteous and efficient and we even had towels/toiletries renewed every day which usually doesn't happen with most exchanges. The pictures shown on the website are accurate for the Villas but cannot comment on the Suites. The Villas, I believe, are much newer. Would definitely book again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd year staying.This year we stayed in the Villas--1 bedroom on a exchange through Interval. We had a fast speedy check-in with great service.I enjoy staying in a condo --just to get away from the crazy crowds & noise of the casinos--not so my hubby-he loves the action.The unit is very tastefully decorated and everything was at hand with kitchen utilities.We only ate 2 meals out.We get tired of buffets & prefer to eat more healthy food.Their is a small grocery on site--prices comparible to a grocery store-just not as much fruit & veggies.This is a great location--midway on the strip.We found it nice & quite despite the Marriott doing some building next door.The lounge has a great veiw but the drinks very pricy-pool small but quite.There is a barbacue to grill at the pool.I didn't find much difference between the towers or the villas--both good-villas just more updated.We had no problems with timeshare reps.They left us alone & were very freindly when we met them on the elavators.We have stayed at many timeshares--our own & our daughters & found the Polo Towers one of the most courteous.Perhaps it not the most ellegant but friendly staff are very important to a good holiday.we were invited to breakfast 2 mornings to meet other travellers--a nice touch in a city that hosts thousands.Everything is clean and neat. Some problems with parking which is underground and safe.A shuttle will take you down to Treasure Island & The Venetian next to the mall.The Mandalay Bay is across the street & the Aladdin next door.This place is good for families as you can get away from the strip.It has a play area for small children.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: no1spec
Reviews.Content: We owned a timeshare here for several years. The last time we visited was in June of 2004. We ended up selling our timeshare in 2005 because we were not able to use it enough to justify the high yearly maintenance fees. I highly recommend if you are looking to purchase a timeshare, any timeshare, that you never ever buy straight from the developer. Only buy a timeshare on the secondary market. Very few people ever get their moneys worth if they pay the retail price. That said, Polo Towers is a pretty nice place, I would say about the equivalent of a 3 star hotel. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, and having the refrigerator and kitchen facilities is very nice. No other hotel I have stayed at in Vegas had a refrigerator. If you are going to stay in a two bedroom unit, it is supposed to be able to sleep 6 people. However, we heard from our friends that stayed with us that the fold-out couch was very uncomfortable, so that is probably best left for kids or young adults. The king bed in the main bedroom was comfortable and definately not too hard. If you are staying in one of the studios, we saw at least 2 different kinds of beds. If you get a studio with a regular bed that will be the most comfortable. If you get a studio with the pull down bed that turns into a couch, that bed was much less comfortable. The lobby was clean and well decorated, but is pretty small. Be aware that the only onsite store is a small gift shop that has nothing but a few snacks and some souvenirs and closes early. The pool is a big negative for this hotel, it's on the roof, is very small, has only about 20 loungers and has little shade. The pool landscaping is practically non-existant, i.e. no plants, palm trees, waterfalls, etc. that seem to be a standard at most strip hotels. If you want to lounge by a decent pool, definatly do not come to Polo Towers. In 2002, we paid a special assessment fee that they were collecting in order to build a 2nd pool area that would be larger and more family oriented, leaving the roof pool for adults only. However, during our visit in June of 2004, we did not see any sign that any construction had begun on this pool. There is no on-site restaurant, room service or casino. However, next door there is a small strip mall with an indoor food court served by several fast food style booths. I think you can get food delivered from outside restaurants, but not sure how this works. This hotel is on the strip in between the MGM Grand and the Aladdin. It is about a half block set back from Las Vegas Blvd, so there is a bit of a walk to get to the street. It is about a 10 minute brisk walk to the Aladdin or Monte Carlo and even further to the MGM Grand so if you or someone you are traveling with has mobility problems or is sensitive to the heat(if you visit during summer), you don't want to stay here. Additionally, practically the entire walk to the surrounding casinos you will be approached by numerous street vendors selling tours, timeshares, etc. Also, there will be numerous people trying to push flyers into your hands. If you don't want to walk through all this just to get to the nearest casino, don't stay here. Overall, I might recommend this place if you can get a cheap rate. It is clean, comfortable, centrally located to the strip and safe. The downsides are the lack of on-site amenities and the walking distance to get to any of the big casinos. One of the reasons that we sold our unit is because we didn't want to stay here any more when we came to Vegas. There are so many better hotels on the strip and the casinos just offer so many more amenities. Every time we stayed here, we wished we were staying in one of the casinos instead because we got sick of having to walk 15 to 30 minutes just to get a decent meal and to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with Polo Towers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 1 week at Polo Towers; it is not the Marriott 5-Star quality.....the pool on roof is only 3 ft and was green when we arrived. The hotel didn't know why it was green; that was very upsetting. The suites were clean but not high quality furniture and cheap formica cabinets, and did meet the Marriott standards. Then we find out that there were other Villas of upgraded quality in the Towers that we could have gotten as Marriott owners. The staff was helpful but the location of hotel was not at the best part of the strip. The shopping in front of the building was dirty and smelly and that's where the fitness center was located; not on site as stated. We would not recommend the Polo Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5, 4 , or 3 Star- in the timeshare world”
Reviews.Author: tracker7088
Reviews.Content: The positives first: Location great, kids waterpark my 5 y.o. enjoyed, ATM machine on site so you dont get raked over the coals on cash advances. Tram service (but I didnt use) No timeshare sales pressure, comfortable King bed. Staff friendly and attentive. Daily towel service. Now the bad or at least worse than expected: Outdated at least 10 years - old uncomfortable couch which was even worse as a bed, shower/bath slow drain , General bad smell- smokey in the room, alley smell outside- (go figure there is an alley right outside with dumpsters), Dirty pool, Patio off unit filthy and no chairs. Basically it served its purpose as a room with a kitchen- It just makes me Question how Interval International rated this a five star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip, but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from Polo Towers in Las Vegas. We had a great time. It's easy to keep kids busy during the day hours. Lucky for us! We didn't have to spend a lot of time in our room. We traded into a two bedroom on the 15th floor from our home resort in Orlando-(major difference in 5 Star ratings) The carpets were torn, cheap furniture and kitchen fixtures, stained towels in bathrooms, and broken toilets. How can this be rated a 5 Star? All three TV's were 13 or 14 inch! There is a pool on the roof top, that is only 3 feet deep! Kids are only allowed there until 5 pm then if they are under the age of 14 they must go to the kids pool and "splash park" located on the second floor. Again, this is a joke. It's only for toddlers. Access to the hotel lobby and shuttle service is off the street, down an alley. Yes, it is well lit, but it is beside an open parking lot and the alley is deserted when you return to the hotel after dark. What were they thinking??? There should be covered walkway from the street. The lounge was adequate. Also, no internet access in the resort. Las Vegas was GREAT! the location was GREAT (we could actually see the fountains at the Bellagio from the balcony) but Polo Towers has alot of upgrading to do. There is a lot of police presence on the Strip, but I felt very safe walking at night. The shops are great, because there is something for every price range, the buffets are great for families, and cabs are easy to catch. The monorails and trams are great. The Venetian is a must, the fountains at Bellagio are a must and the Rainforest cafe at MGM is great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky Salesmen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas. We also got pitched with free show tickets if we attend a "no pressure" presentation. We agreed. We walked through the beautiful hotel eager to hear the "Affordable Prices". Once we heard how much they needed down and how much they wanted a month for our 1 week of vacation time, we refused. The sneaky salesmen sent us to "get our tickets", this time we also got pitched to with "come back for a one week stay to see how you like it and all the money you pay towards the vacation would count towards the down payment if you decide to buy". The sales pitch sounded awesome. We were to put $295 down and pay $100 a month for 10 months and in turn we would receive 2 vacations. One 8 day 7 night trip to Polo Towers and another 4 day 3 night to our choice. The vacations had to be used in a 2 years. We assumed that would be absolutly no problem. We gave our card to the gentleman for the down payment and he came back and said "You have over $3000.00 in your account, why did you say you couldn't afford the offer. I was appalled and that should have been my first hint at what kind of business techniques these people had. Over the next ten months we were paying off our vacation and yes a few months it was late. Well the last month fell in the middle of December and having three girls EVERY payment that month was late. Well because they had already received all of our payments they decided to enforce a "late payment means forfeiting of all monies and the contract is void rule". How convienient that they only stated this after receiving almost all the money. I was livid!!! I called to take care of this for once. They said they cannot refund the money but they would give me my vacation (as a favor to me). When I asked about the other one they said you had 18 months to fulfill both meaning 8 months left to try and arrange for both vacations HOW IMPOSSIBLE IS THAT!! I will get some of my money's worth by taking one vacation. But we are supposed to listen to another sales pitch and my complete attitude is ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND???

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: lms2
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice staff. Free parking self and valet. Has a wonderful location, close to action, but very quiet and relaxing. Would stay again for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good rates”
Reviews.Author: ECD10
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers is conveniently located in the heart of the strip. You are very close to Aladdin, Paris, Bellagio, and MGM. The rates were the best we could find for the strip, just under $100 a night. The decor is ordinary but it does the job. We stayed in a studio and it had a mini fridge and microwave -- very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again at the Polo Towers!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after I read the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised! We stayed for one week, we were in Vegas from Canada to get married and double booked for 2 nights at the MGM (also highly recommend). -1 BR suite very clean, spacious and full, modern kitchen (only 4 each of plates, glasses etc though. -Location is awesome, very central. -We were not bothered at all to attend sales presentation, asked once upon check-in and that was it. -Check-in is 4pm, we arrived at 8am and asked for early check-in, no problem, got us in right away. -Bell staff and concierge very friendly. -Housekeeping tidied up and brought fresh towels daily. A few problems: -Construction noise bothersome. -TV/cable never seemed to work right. -Late-night operators VERY rude. -Rooftop pool isn't great, only 3 ft deep, but we never used it anyway. Overall, a great stay. The problems we encountered were minimal in the grand scheme of things. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Hotel itself not up to 5 star Quality”
Reviews.Author: ginadi64
Reviews.Content: Polo Towers is in an excellent location, directly in the center of the strip. Closest Casino is the alladin, across the street. The rooms in the Polo Towers were very plain and could use sprucing up. Interval Int'l gives this hotel a 5 star rating, it must be for the location! The new Marriott timeshare is currenlty being built directly behind Polo Towers. The new Marriott looks beautiful. I probably would not stay in Polo Towers again. I will either wait until the Marriott is completed or stay in one of the Mega Casino Resorts next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: 65oski
Reviews.Content: Spent two weekend nights at Polo Towers. Rooms are nice and spacious, nothing fancy. Very convenient for walking to Monte Carlo or Paris. bit of a hike to get to the Venetian. Parking's limited but close by. If you forget something in your car it's not a big deal to go retrieve it like at a larger resort. Very quiet. Never got a phone call or solicitation for a timeshare presentation. Amenities are limited, no restaurant or casino. Small shop on ground floor has basic food and travel items at reasonable prices. Suite on 15th floor had a full kitchen, pretty good view of the Strip. Some construction noise on Saturday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Timeshare Experience, Needs more Amenities”
Reviews.Author: slyons29
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay in a friend's timeshare (an exchange with Flagstaff) at Polo Towers. We were 5 women in our 30's for a weekend getaway and a great time was had by all. Polo Towers is a good place to stay and our two bedroom suite was ample in size, very comfortable and had an amazing view of the Strip (and two balconies). Great location. We only paid a $40/day upgrade for the two bedroom which was fantastic . On to the review: Rooms: spacious, comfortable beds, furniture, not my style, by in great condition and ample. Bathrooms: spacious, big stand up showers, good water pressure. Showerheads might be a little low for guys/gals over 5' 8". Plenty of towels delivered each day. Housekeeping: We didn't have housekeeping b/c we were utilizing the time share. However we needed extra blankets and they were there within minutes of the call. Every morning we got a wake up call and fresh towels and wash cloths. Kitchen: amazing to have a full size fridge and cabinets. A little light on the dishes/glasses and other kitchen items. One hand towel. Ice maker worked great. Staff: No problems except for one timeshare guy who, after we had all been handed off by the sales guy/tour guide (thanks Josh, no pressure, good info, got me thinking) gave us the final hard sell before we got the free txt to the Rat Pack Tribute (good show at the Greek Aisle, which used to be the Debbie Reynolds, CHEESY CHEESY hotel and casino. But remarkable show, RECOMMEND). Concierge at Polo Towers helpful, bartendar in the Hush Lounge wonderful. Rooftop Pool: Eh. Double Eh. The Day we arrived it was nearly 80 degrees and we were looking forward to lounging around the pool and having some fruity cocktails. Were we in for a shock. The pool (which is only 3 feet deep but was refreshing) was packed with people including several families with babies and small children. Exactly what we came to Vegas to get away from. Signs say no food or beverages in the area of the pool and there were limited numbers of loungers. Everything was clean and there were lots of towels. I didn't see a single staffer or employee in the area. Overall good rating. There is no restaurant in the hotel and no rooom service, but an outside menu for deliveries. A convenience store on-site for snacks etc., and a short walk to corner shops for necessities. Would stay there again if my friend got her timeshare -- would not pay what would probably be over $300-$325 a night for the 2 bedroom suite. Would stay at one of the larger hotels with a casino and great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: eag1952
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polo Towers for one week. We rented a two bedroom condo. The condo was a smoking condo but you would never know it. Everything was very clean. They only change the sheets once during the week but that was fine. The extra bedroom had it's own private bath, refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, tv and balcony. We were only asked upon arrival if we would like to see a presentation for a new complex going up they are affiliated with. We said no and that was it for any pressure put on us to see their presentation. On the street and other hotels/casinos, you are asked constantly if you want free tickets for shows. Some people can get obnoxious when you say no. My advice, say you're leaving that day and they stop bugging you immediately. I would definitely stay at Polo Towers again. It is at a great spot on the strip and a very elegant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor signage”
Reviews.Author: ministryinsight
Reviews.Content: The Polo Towers is a nice place to stay, but it is difficult to figure out where to park unless you park outside. Also once you are in the hotel, it is difficult to find your way around. The suites are nice...but I had to wonder if it was worth the money because we spend most of our time walking around and doing things outside of the hotel. I would not go back..we also spent three nights at the San Remo and found it to be a great hotel. ( the twenty dollar trick worked...great room on the 16th floor. I would highly recomend this place for the money it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to own and stay at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I own two time shares. Polo Towers is an an excellent timeshare to own. The staff has always been kind and courteous. The "hotel" immaculate. Located in the center of strip - makes this location extremely convenient to all the casino's. Making reservations is easy and convenient. The rooms are just like the pictures. Most of us have had the experience of seeing a sample of a hotel's rooms - and then find out we get a dump. This is not the case at Polo Towers. For anyone looking to own a time share - this is the place to own. We have not had the same experience with our other time share - Med Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Polo Motel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon entry we noticed many problems with the cleaning from the previous guests. Seems as if they rushed to get the place ready on time and missed quite a few spots including the bathrooms. Turning off the hot water for several hours without proper notice was completely unacceptable nor did they find the need to apologize after calling one truly rude rep downstairs for explaination and when it would be restored. Then for two days we had construction on the floor above us which would be ok with us if it didn't start at 6:00am. Offering to move us was too much of a hassle we asked if starting at 9:00am would be better than 6:00am which was ignored. Having to troubleshoot your own audio/video problem with the television equiptment only because the repairman was more concerned with his teenage daughter standing outside our door trying to sneak over to the casino to meet older men. I will not return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We purchased our 2 bedroom time-share in 4/03. Looking forward to staying there in 04, we were disappointed it was not yet ready. (We had purchased on a floor not yet ready for occupancy). Although the yearly fee does hurt, when I consider what it would cost to furnish a vacation place plus the upkeep it makes it worth it to us. I work Sun-Thur & my husband Sun-Fri and having this it makes the trip worth the money. We just need to allow for it in our monthly spending! We also love being with Interval International. When we found that we were unable to stay at Polo Towers, (they called apologizing for the change and refunded our yearly maintenance fee) we found another Condo to rent at $125 for a week (the room posted at $1500/week). We are looking forward to staying at "our place" at Polo Towers next year and enjoying the many offerings surrounding it. The most important thing is that we can turn it over to our children when we are no longer able to travel as well as share it with them in the meantime. Thanks for making such a lovely facility so affordable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the sales people!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm an "owner" of a timeshare unit at the Polo which I get to visit every 4 years but only after paying a $500 home owners association fee each time on top of the sale price. No room service but there is a crapy substitute service that won't find your room till food is nice & cold; and don't dirty sheets or you have to pay - they only change them every third day. The pool is cool if you like checking out the 80 year olds in bikini's. Not 24 hours like the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Information they give you broken down....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here is the information they give you broken down so you can make your own analysis: Studio or 1 bedroom offered ($24,000 & $28,000 with a "BUY IT NOW Discount of 3,000-8,000 off with more room to "bargain" possible but unlikely) with a true cost closer to $10,000... This was what I was told when I did the "tour" in March of 2004. Now, on top of this you have a yearly fee for (maintenance, taxes, staff, etc) This fee varies depending on the style (studio $595 / 1 bedroom $895) and is paid every year by you... So, using the information that I was given this is how it breaks down (with the "discount" they gave me to try to make me buy): 1 bedroom $21,000 with yearly fees of $895 (note: this does not include the other fees to be able to trade your share with others or to participate actively with their other timeshare properties) So, let's assume you will vacation for the next 10 years and want to do it in Las Vegas... 21,000 + (8950 = 895*10) = 29,950 for 10 years 2,950 each year or 421.43 each day for seven days Now, the room is nice and the location is good BUT 421.43 is very high to be locked into for a week in Vegas that you have to bid for... Even at 20 years the yearly/day cost is still high at $1945/$277 year/day... Not to mention the fact of being tied to a bidding system. Now, if you just KNOW when you will be in Vegas to vacation and can buy that week then this might be worth your time, otherwise, just book a good hotel or buy property... Especially since you can't receive any hard information directly from them and if you ask to review some then they will "allow" you to do so but only on site at the time of your "tour" I don't know about you but if I can't review a major purchase overnight and I'm denied any written documentation but only asked to "trust" some total stranger that he or she will act in my best interest---??? I WALK AWAY... Others may feel different but I prefer to gamble with at least a good understanding of the game before jumping blindly in.... Hope this helps.... joseph_ut@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: jjeni
Reviews.Content: Our visit was above our expectations. We were thrilled to find it in the middle and right on the strip. No need to have a car if you want to stay in that area. We were in the newer tower and had a beautiful view of the strip. They even have a mini-mart for necessities. Everything was very clean and the staff did everythingthey could to accomodate our needs. We will definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Polo Towers Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 3745 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
